courses.bio: კურსი შექმნილია დამწყებებისთვის და მათთვის, ვისაც ამ სფეროში სხვადასხვა პროფესიებიდან გადმოსვლა სურს.
objectives: როგორ გახდეთ UX/UI დიზაინერი.
როგორ მართოთ დიზაინ-ეტაპები: ემპათია, განსაზღვრა, იდეაცია, პროტოტიპირება და ტესტირება.
როგორ დაგეგმოთ კვლევები, ჩაატაროთ ინტერვიუები და გამოყენებადობის ტესტირება, ასევე გაანალიზოთ მიღებული შედეგები.
როგორ იმუშავოთ ფონტებსა და ფერებთან.
როგორ შექმნათ და გამოიყენოთ UI-Kit, Style Guide, Design System.
როგორ შექმნათ პროფესიონალური UX პორტფოლიო, რომელიც მოიცავს პროექტებს იდეის გაჩენიდან საბოლოო რეალიზაციამდე, რათა მზად იყო სამსახურის საძიებლად.
როგორ გადასცეთ მაკეტი დეველოპერებს.
როგორ მიიღოთ უკუკავშირი და ასევე გასცეთ.
როგორ ელაპარაკოთ სწორად თქვენსავე კოლეგებს.
requirements: კომპიუტერი (Windows, Mac)
Figma
ნებისმიერი ბრაუზერი
courses.description:
გამარჯობა, მე ანრი შაკიაშვილი ვარ — საქართველოში ერთ-ერთი წარმატებული დიზაინ-ბლოგერი და UX/UI დიზაინის მენტორი.

სავარაუდოდ, გეცნობი ჩემი ინსტაგრამის პოსტებიდან და ვიდეოებიდან.
და რადგან ახლა ამ ტექსტს კითხულობ, ეს ნიშნავს, რომ ოდესმე შენც გიფიქრია საკუთარი აპლიკაციის, ვებსაიტის ან ბლოგის დიზაინის შექმნაზე.
დღეს ციფრულ პროდუქტებს ისე ხშირად და ბუნებრივად ვიყენებთ, რომ ვერც კი ვუფიქრდებით — ისინი ჩვენი ყოველდღიური ცხოვრების და ფინანსური ბაზრის განუყოფელ ნაწილად იქცნენ.
ახალი, ვირუსულად გავრცელებული აპის იდეის მოფიქრება მარტივია. მაგრამ მისი რეალობად ქცევა — თითქოს რთული ამოცანაა… ან ასე შეიძლება გეგონოს.


სწორედ ამიტომ შევქმენი ეს UX/UI დიზაინის ონლაინ კურსი.
ამ კურსში მე და შენ ერთად ვისწავლით ყველაფერს, რაც საჭიროა იმისათვის, რომ UX/UI დიზაინერად დაიწყო მუშაობა.
ამისთვის გამოვიყენებთ პროფესიონალურ და ამავე დროს მარტივად გამოსაყენებელ ინსტრუმენტს — Figma-ს.
კურსის განმავლობაში:
გაეცნობი UX/UI დიზაინის პრინციპებსა და სტრუქტურას
ისწავლი ვიზუალური დიზაინის ელემენტებს, იერარქიას და კომპოზიციას
გაივლი დიზაინის პროცესს — კვლევიდან საბოლოო შედეგამდე
და შეისწავლი ფერებისა და შრიფტების სწორად შერჩევის ტექნიკებს


ეს კურსი იდეალურია მათთვის:
ვინც ახალია დიზაინის სფეროში
ან კი არასდროს გაჰკარებია UX/UI-ს
მაგრამ სურს ციფრული დიზაინის სფეროში თავისი გზა დაიწყოს თავდაჯერებულად და საფუძვლიანად


კურსის განმავლობაში გელოდება პრაქტიკული დავალებები, რეალური მაგალითები და ბევრი შთაგონება.
ყველა ნაბიჯი დაგეხმარება არა მხოლოდ თეორიის გაგებაში, არამედ უნიკალური ნამუშევრების შექმნაში — რომლებსაც დაამატებ შენს პორტფოლიოში.
მოკლედ რომ ვთქვათ:
დროა, შენი დიზაინერული გზა დაიწყოს სწორად — ნულიდან პროფესიონალამდე.
target_audience: დამწყებებისთვის - თუ შეგიძლიათ ბრაუზერში მუშაობა, ეს საკმარისია სტარტისთვის. დანარჩენს მე გასწავლით.
სტუდენტებისთვის - ბევრ ჩვენგანს პირველ ცდაზე არ გამოსდის საოცნებო პროფესიის არჩევა. თუ წლების შემდეგ გადაწყვიტეთ რაიმე სიახლე შეიტანოთ თქვენს ცხოვრებაში - მაშინ გელოდებით!
დეველოპერებისთვის - მათთვის, ვისაც დიზაინში უკვე აქვს გამოცდილება, თუმცა სურს სიცარიელეები ამოავსოს თეორიასა და პრაქტიკაში. დიზაინერი არასოდეს წყვეტს სწავლას და ეს არის წარმატების წინაპირობა.
UX დიზაინერებისთვის - ვისაც სურს აიმაღლოს კვალიფიკაცია და ჩაუღრმავდეს დიზაინ პრინციპებს.
ვინც დაიკარგა - ადამიანები, ვინც ადრე გაიარეს კურსი და ვერ იპოვეს ჭეშმარიტების გზა.
პროექტის მენეჯერებისთვის - ვინც პროექტებს მართავს და სურთ უკეთესი ხედვის ჩამოყალიბება.

courses.description:
Welcome to the Learn User Experience Design from A-Z: Adobe XD UI UX Design
Where you’re going to learn how to get started with User Experience and User Interface Design (UX/UI) Design and how to land your first job as a UX Designer even if you have no prior knowledge or experience.
In this practical, hands-on course our main objective is to give you the education not just to understand the ins and outs of UX and UI Design, but also to learn exactly how the web development industry works, the different roles within a team, how color psychology and color schemes work , so you can learn first hand exactly how to design websites and mobile apps in Adobe XD and create an amazing user experience as a UX & UI Designer.
Blending practical work with solid theoretical training, we take you from the basics of UX/UI Design in Adobe XD to mastery, giving you the training you need not just to create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes, but also the understanding of behavioral psychology and influence triggers so you can become a well-rounded UX/UI designer.
And we understand that theory is important to build a solid foundation, we understand that theory alone isn’t going to get the job done so that’s why this course is packed with practical hands-on examples that you can follow step by step.
My name Juan and I’m one of your instructors in this course. My background in the Tech space specifically with Digital Marketing and Web Development.
Arthur is your other instructor in this course and has over 5 years of experience in the graphic design space as a UX/UI designer.
Together we’re going to give you the foundational education that you need not just on how to design websites and mobile apps, but also how to get paid for your newly developed UX/Ui skills. The course covers 7 main areas:



1: LEARN UX/UI COURSE INTRODUCTION
This foundational section gives you a full introduction to the basics of UX/UI and what the current graphic design and UX/UI marketplace looks like.
UX vs UI
UX/UI Designer Marketplace
UX/UI Different Roles


2: INTRODUCTION TO THE WEB INDUSTRY
This section builds on the lessons learned in section one, showing you the different phases of the web development industry, roles and responsibilities for each team member, and various project management frameworks such as the linear model, the agile approach and the scrum framework.
The Phases of Web Development
Team Roles & Responsibilities

Project Management Frameworks


3: FOUNDATIONS OF GRAPHIC DESIGN
This section shifts the focus to graphic design with color psychology and color schemes. You'll learn how to use the font types, icons and various colors to create amazingly beautiful designs.
The Psychology of Color
Color Wheel & Color Schemes
Working w/ Fonts & Icons


4: UX DESIGN
In this section, you’re going to learn exactly how the UX design process works. You’ll learn about the customer journey and sales funnels as well as behavioral psychology and influence triggers so you can create an amazing user experience.
UX Design Process
Customer Journey vs Sales Funnel
Principles of Influence


5: UI DESIGN
In this section, you’re going to learn exactly how the UI design process works. You’ll learn about the different UI design types such as landing pages, websites, mobile applications and the various controls and components so you can create an amazingly beautiful user interface.
UI Design Process
UI Design Types
UI Components & Controls



6: OPTIMIZATION
In this section, you’re going to learn about optimization. Once you’ve designed a website or mobile app, you want to track the metrics so you can find areas to improve. You’ll also learn how to create a UX/UI usability report that will provide value to your potential clients.
Feedback & Getting Referrals:
Using Analytics/Heat Maps:
Creating UX/UI Usability Reports



7: STARTING A UX/UI CAREER
In this section, you’re going to learn how you can land a job using your new skills. We’ll also walk through how you can start freelancing, personal branding, and how you can position yourself as the go-to expert in your field. Then finally, some of the best places to find jobs.
How To Start Freelancing
Personal Branding
Best Places To Find Jobs



This course is comprehensive, showing you the ins and outs of UX/UI.
Together with the emphasis on practical examples that you can follow step by step benefiting from the excitement of hands-on learning.
This real-life learning is an invaluable part of your education, enabling you to become an elite UX/UI designer and stand out from the rest.
No matter what the scenario or how complicated a website or design may be, this course gives you the foundational training you need to design amazingly beautiful websites and applications – and start pursuing a career in a field that is increasingly in demand as the global reliance on technology grows.
target_audience: Students who want to become UX/UI designers

courses.description:
Цифровые продукты более абстрактны и сложны, чем любой продукт, который мы создавали раньше. Люди используют свои цифровые устройства быстрее, менее сознательно и больше отвлекаются, чем когда-либо в истории.
Эти проблемы создают новые проблемы, для решения которых требуется новый вид команды дизайнеров. Этим командам дизайнеров необходимо понимать сложный спектр поведенческой психологии, восприятия, творчества и бизнеса. Им нужно понять, что было раньше, ведь история дизайна началась не с iPhone. История продуктового дизайна началась с истории продуктов!
Мы разрабатываем самый сложный продукт в истории для самых отвлеченных пользователей. Мы ожидаем, что дизайнеры будут работать с очень узким пониманием дизайна. Мне пришлось создать для них этот курс, мне пришлось создать мастер-курс по дизайну цифровых продуктов, потому что никто другой этим не занимался;)
Мастер-курс по дизайну цифровых продуктов даст вам все необходимое, чтобы начать создавать продукты, которые нравятся людям. Это займет время, и я советую вам выполнять все упражнения в течение нескольких месяцев, оставляя время для размышлений и экспериментов. Это не быстрый путь к любой дизайнерской работе, это медленный путь к большой карьере.
Подходит ли мне этот курс?
Я создал Мастер-курс по дизайну цифровых продуктов, чтобы заполнить многие дыры в других курсах по дизайну продуктов, по этой причине я считаю, что он будет полезен для опытного дизайнера. Я также создал его для новичков, поэтому, если вы никогда ничего не проектировали, вы будете просто дома (а все что-то проектировали раньше, вы просто этого не знаете!).
Помимо дизайнеров, я имел в виду всех людей, которые занимаются проектами, управляют цифровыми продуктами, владеют ими или разрабатывают их. Я считаю, что есть много интересных материалов, которые помогут всему бизнесу по-другому взглянуть на создание цифровых продуктов.
target_audience: Младший или начинающий дизайнер продукта
Владельцы продуктов или менеджеры
Дизайнеры пользовательского опыта
Дизайнеры пользовательского интерфейса
Студенты

courses.description:
Are you keen to get into the world of AR/VR UX Design, but you don't know where to start?
This Course will allow you to add AR/VR UX designer to your CV & start getting paid for new skills. AR/VR Designing is one of the highest-paying jobs.
Hi! My name is Kritika Sharma and I'm an AR/VR UX designer. I'm here to help to get started with AR/VR UX Design efficiently and comprehensively. This course offers a nice amalgamation of Practical and theoretical knowledge for designing high quality & functional prototypes with examples from SpaceX, Disney, Oculus, Microsoft and Apple.
By the end of this course, you will be able to produce practical and effective User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI) designs for Augmented and Virtual reality using Adobe Photoshop & Adobe Aero.
along with:
Fundamentals and types of AR/VR
UX processes for AR/VR
Imagineering
Why 30 seconds of storytelling is so important?
Tools & devices
Field of view for AR/VR
Presence, agency and affordance
Degree of control
The difference in Designing for 2D & 3D interfaces
Gesture, gaze and voice control
User testing & research methods
Getting familiar with AR UIs.
Challenges of 3D interaction design
Why choose this Course?
There is no other course available online that provides practical & theoretical knowledge on how to get started with UX Design for AR/VR, In this course, you will learn step by step process for making an Augmented Reality Prototype. My experience as an AR/VR UX Designer didn't start with a course, I had to dig a lot because the information was scattered so I don't want you to waste any more of your time and provide you with an organised lesson plan for everything you need to get started with. In this course, we are not going to rush and design a quick cool design but start with basics first. I am going to show you a real project I worked on and we will be making it again together.
You can work and create an AR prototype along with me or after the course, it is totally up to you. You can complete this course at your time and at your own pace. This will help develop your skills and will give you something for your portfolio.
It is now time to upgrade your skills.
Reviews from others
"Short, Practical and very useful course. This course has everything for a beginner, this course gave me a kick start. I literally got frustrated with the amount of overwhelming knowledge there is on the internet but thank god that I found this course which has everything organised in a lesson plan making it totally simple to understand." - Vidit Arora
"Kritika was a very good teacher articulate with steady speed, the videos were to the point and very informative." - Diksha Jain
"Amazing course, a lot of content gets covered with interesting videos and images making it easy to understand as terms of AR/VR are pretty hard. I also like the way Kritika teaches, good job!." - Jatin Agarwal
Sign up for this course and you can start right away!


Language
English


Suggested playback speed 1.25
target_audience: UI/UX designer who are curious about Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality.
Anyone who wants to start their career in Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality design and get paid for their user experience design skills.
This course is for beginners, newbies & amateurs in the field of Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality design.

UX is most growing demand skills now, most companies are looking for the right talent to help them succeed. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
____________________________________________________________________
Have you ever feel frustrated that you are not getting called after sending so many resume?
Have you ever feel disappointed and rejected after doing so many job design interviews?

____________________________________________________________________


Hello, this is Deby - I am an Award Winning VP UX Designer with 12 years of experience in the industry. I am here to help you ace your UX interviews, show UX portfolio and land you dream job! From the beginning until the end, whether you are a junior, senior, expert, or even high-level UX Designers - you will learn how to ace real-world job-interviews and land your dream job!


Have You Heard This Story...
You went to university, paid very expensive bootcamp, spent a lot of time and energy to get certification - BUT very difficult to get a job because lack of skills / experiences / weak portfolio / couldn't answers UX interview and many more...
This is the common frustration of traditional education... Most of the teacher are not real-world practitioner, only learning by theory. I really understand your frustrations, I have done many job interviews, and see many types of UX portfolio - more or less the same quality.


THAT'S WHY, I build this course to help you build your UX career!


In this online course you will learn:

courses.description:
Hai una landing page da progettare. Forse è quella del tuo cliente, forse quella di un tuo progetto personale. In ogni caso, una landing page ha sempre un obiettivo di business che si deve tradurre in scelte di design, di copywriting e più in generale, di comunicazione.
Ma se Google Analytics non ci dà tutti i dati di cui avremmo bisogno, come facciamo ad ottimizzare la pagina web in modo tale da "convertire" il maggior numero di utenti possibili in clienti? O iscritti alla newsletter? O iscritti alla prova gratuita del software che stiamo offrendo?
Capire i meccanismi di come funziona il nostro cervello una volta atterrato in una pagina web è una conoscenza fondamentale non solo per capire cos'è il neuromarketing, ma per chiunque si occupi in qualche modo di comunicazione o che stia studiando copywriting o UX design.

courses.title: 产品设计的情感因素与企业文化
courses.bio: 精准戳中消费者情感触动点，优化产品设计
objectives: 1.了解品牌、视觉与产品的情感因素
2.理解产品要有属于自己的独特设计趋向
3.掌握可以提升产品视觉传达效果的简单方法
4.掌握定位产品情感因素的方法
5.理解和把握企业文化与产品设计之间的关系

课程内容: 1.品牌、视觉与产品的情感因素

requirements: 1年+产品工作经验，了解产品设计
courses.description:
产品是为了满足人的需要而诞生的。随着人类需求层次不断提高，也在不断地改进，产品与人的关系也越来越密切，它们既是人类情感的表达者，又是人类情感交流的朋友。
产品的情感化设计在设计理念中变得日益重要，情感化设计让产品与消费者有情感的交流，提高消费者的购买欲望和对产品的使用热情。产品的情感化设计要打动消费者就要找到设计的情感触动点，找到影响情感触动点的文化因素，研究他们的生长经历、情景元素，探讨他们的人文情怀背景及其文化底蕴。
本节课程主要从三方面进行探讨与思考:1、品牌、视觉与产品的情感因素；2、如何定位产品的情感因素；3、企业文化与产品设计
本节课程是由授课老师与三节课合作制作的。在此，要特别感谢老师的辛苦付出！经历了课程立项、设计、开发中的众多环节，我们才能最终为你呈现现在的这门课程。无论是授课老师还是三节课团队，都希望这门课程能够让你有所收获，希望同学们结合个人工作情况，学以致用。

requirements: 前提条件は特ありません。Mac / Windowsマシンがあれば大丈夫です。
最新のWebブラウザが動作すればOKです。
courses.description:
ーーーーーーーーーーー
＼ 新UI（UI3）に対応 ／
2024年10月31日、すべての動画をリニューアルしました！
AI機能などの最新情報も取り込んでいます。
※ 現在受講中の方のために、旧バージョンも引き続き公開中です。
ーーーーーーーーーーー
この講座をきっかけに著書『Figma for UIデザイン（翔泳社）』が発売されました。
Figmaは誰でも気軽に使えるデザインツールであり、プロの現場でも使われる素晴らしいソフトウェアです。Mac / Windows / Webブラウザを使って誰でもデザインを始められ、その柔軟さと機能性でユーザー数を伸ばしていますが、日本語の体系的な教材がまだ少ない印象です。
この講座では、Appleのデザインを題材に本格的なUIデザインを学習します。
また、Figmaの強力なインタラクション機能とプラグインを使って、ハイレベルなプロトタイプを作成します（プロトタイプとは、できるだけ早い段階でデザインに欠陥がないかをテストする手法です）。
モバイルアプリをデザインする際のルール、一貫性のあるデザインの大切さ、感覚に頼らないデザインなど、デザイナーの思考法を解説しながら一緒にUIを作り上げていきますので、初学者はもちろん、エンジニアやマネージャーなど、普段デザインに関わらない方にもお勧めです！
学習した知識とテクニックは、Webデザイン制作にも活かすことができます。また、最終的なデザインは公開されており、自由に確認、編集することができます。
UIデザインのノウハウを習得しましょう！
target_audience: モバイルアプリのデザインを始めたい方
ハイレベルなプロトタイピングを作りたい方

デザインに興味のあるエンジニア

courses.title: Mastering UI/UX Design with Figma: From Beginner to Advanced
courses.bio: Become a Pro UI/UX Designer with Figma: Hands-On Projects and Real-World Applications (Hindi)
objectives: Students will become proficient in using Figma's interface, tools, and features to create professional-quality designs.
Students will learn the fundamentals of UI/UX design, including color theory, typography, and layout, and how to apply these principles to create visually appea
Students will be able to design and build interactive prototypes for both mobile and web applications, allowing them to visualize and test their designs effecti
Students will compile a portfolio of their design projects, showcasing their skills and creativity, and preparing them for job opportunities in the UI/UX design
requirements: Basic Computer Skills
Internet Access
Figma Account
No Prior Design Experience Needed
courses.description:
Welcome to "Mastering UI/UX Design with Figma: From Beginner to Advanced" – your comprehensive guide to becoming a proficient UI/UX designer using Figma, all delivered in Hindi!
Are you looking to build a career in UI/UX design? Or perhaps you want to enhance your design skills to create stunning and user-friendly interfaces? This course is designed to take you from the basics to advanced concepts of UI/UX design using Figma, one of the most powerful and popular design tools available today.
What You'll Learn:
Introduction to UI/UX Design: Understand the fundamentals of UI/UX design and the key principles that make a great user experience.
Getting Started with Figma: Learn the basics of Figma, from setting up your workspace to mastering the interface and essential tools.
Wireframing and Prototyping: Discover how to create effective wireframes and interactive prototypes that bring your ideas to life.
Design Systems and Components: Build and manage design systems and reusable components to streamline your design process.
User Research and Testing: Conduct user research and usability testing to gather insights and improve your designs.
Advanced Techniques: Explore advanced features of Figma, including auto-layout, animations, and collaboration tools.
Real-World Projects: Apply your skills to real-world projects and case studies to build a strong portfolio.
Who This Course Is For:
Aspiring UI/UX designers looking to start a career in the field.
Graphic designers wanting to transition into UI/UX design.
Product managers and developers seeking to understand the design process.
Anyone interested in learning how to create beautiful and functional interfaces.
Why Choose This Course:
Comprehensive Curriculum: Covering everything from basic principles to advanced techniques, this course ensures you gain a thorough understanding of UI/UX design.
Hands-On Learning: With practical exercises and real-world projects, you'll apply what you learn and build a portfolio to showcase your skills.
Experienced Instructor: Learn from a seasoned UI/UX designer with years of industry experience and a passion for teaching.
Community Support: Join a community of like-minded learners to share ideas, get feedback, and grow together.
Enroll now and take the first step towards mastering UI/UX design with Figma. Let's embark on this creative journey together!
target_audience: Beginners in UI/UX Design
Aspiring UI/UX Designers
Graphic Designers
Product Managers and Developers
Entrepreneurs and Startup Founders

courses.title: Wireframing Essentials: Save time with Balsamiq
courses.bio: Build apps and user interfaces faster than ever with Balsamiq
objectives: High level strategy of how to use wireframing to save time
The essentials of how to use Balsamiq
Why Balsamiq is the best tool for wireframing
Build a small real-world wireframe, step by step
Extract a data model from a wireframe
Use wireframing as a general purpose thinking tool
requirements: No wireframing experience needed
courses.description:
If you haven't done wireframing before, you might see it as a bit of a waste of time.
"Why do all that when I can just jump right into building?"

I used to think the same, but now wireframing is my biggest time saver in the building process. A couple hours in wireframing can reliably save you a dozen hours in the building process.


And a little preparation with good wireframes makes everything else more clear and easy. You'll enjoy the work more and get better results.

This course will dispel misconceptions about wireframing so that you can use it for what it's good for - saving time!


You'll learn why Balsamiq is the best tool for the job and how to use it.


We'll wireframe a real-world app idea from scratch, so you can see the practical step by step process.


And then we'll extract even more value from our wireframe by using it to plan a data-model.


Finally, I'll show you bunch of different real-world examples of wireframes I've used at work, and in personal projects.


This course is meant for people with busy schedules - it moves fast, giving you just enough practical tips and mental models to get going on your own.


It's going to give you a new tool in your toolbelt to build faster, plan better, and communicate clearer.
target_audience: Designers who want to build UIs faster
Entrepreneurs who want to flesh out app ideas
Developers who want to build more efficiently

courses.title: ユーザーの真のニーズを引き出す！デザイン思考による問題発見トレーニング
courses.bio: DX（デジタルトランスフォーメーション）の本質は、デジタルの力で「新しいサービスを創造する」ことにあります。そのために必要な考え方として「デザイン思考」が注目されています。この講座で、デザイン思考の基本を学び、ビジネスの場で活用しましょう。
objectives: デザイン思考が必要な背景と基本的な考え方が分かる
デザイン思考をビジネスに活かすためのステップが分かる
デザイン思考の流れを理解してもらえるワークショップを体感できる
デザイン思考を実際のビジネスで活用していくための基礎的スキルを取得できる

はじめに: コースの概要
自己紹介
デザイン思考とは何か: 課題解決のためのデザイン思考
消費構造の変容によるビジネス環境変化
デジタルイノベーションによるビジネス環境変化
ワークショップを体験しよう: デザイン思考の全体像
ワークショップの進め方
ワーク１：プレゼント体験を思い出そう
ワーク２：相手のプレゼント体験についてインタビューをしよう
【ポイント解説①】相手に共感するためのインタビューのコツ
ワーク３＆４：課題を考え、アイデアを出してみよう
【ポイント解説②】アイデア創出のコツ
ワーク５：アイデアを形に！プロトタイプを作ろう
【ポイント解説③】プロトタイプを作るコツ
おわりに: デザイン思考を身に着けるために
「デザイン思考」の実践的活用に向けて: デザイン思考をうまく活用するために　- なぜうまくいかないのか -

requirements: 特に事前に必要な知識等はありません。
courses.description:
本コースは、「デザイン思考」について学び、
実際に新しいサービスアイディアを創出できるようになることを目指します。


最近日本でデザイン思考が注目を集めているのには２つの理由があります。
既存のモノを改良したりコスパをよくしたりすることよりも、
「全く新しいコト（体験）」が提供されることをユーザーが望み始めているから。


「How to make（どうやってつくるか）」の価値よりも、
「What/Why to make（何を/なぜつくるか）」の価値が重要になってきているから。


このような社会的な変化についても、ぜひこのコースで学んで頂ければと思います。


とはいえ、デザイン思考は知識だけでなく、実践が何よりも重要です。
本コースの後半では、実際の企業研修でも行われている、
”新規サービス創造に向けたワークショップ”を疑似体験してもらうコンテンツもご用意しています。


ぜひ「デザイン思考」の世界に飛び込み、クリエイティブな力を、楽しみながら身に着けてください！


―――――――――――――――――――――――――
＜受講条件＞
受講に際して必要な知識、準備は特にありません。「デザイン思考」についての理解度も問いません。
デザイン思考を全く知らないが体得したい方
デザイン思考を少し勉強してみたがよく理解できなかった方
デザイン思考は何となく理解できたが、実際にどのようにこれを活用していいかわからない方
こういった方にこそ、受けて頂きたい講座です。


※注意
本コースでは以下のテーマをメインに扱っているわけではありませんのでご注意ください。
WebデザインにおけるUI/UXを学びたい方
ワークショップの設計やファシリテーションスキルを学びたい方


―――――――――――――――――――――――――
＜コンテンツを追加しました　2022.8.25＞
「デザイン思考をうまく活用するために　- なぜうまくいかないのか -」を追加しました。
デザイン思考の基本を学び、実際に活用しようとするときに、よく見られる二つの「落とし穴」についてまとめてみました。
target_audience: 良いサービス・商品を作っているはずなのに、なぜかユーザーの購買行動に結びつかず悩んでいる人
新規事業を進めるうえでなかなかブレイクスルーできないと悩んでいる人
これまでのやり方で商品・サービスを作っているのに、良い成果が出なくて悩んでいる人
デザイン思考について勉強したいという気持ちはあっても具体的な一歩を踏み出せていない人
デザイン思考について勉強してみたけど、実践的な内容まで深めきれていない人

courses.title: Prototipagem rápida de interface [ 3 Métodos + Componentes ]
courses.bio: Aprenda a criar protótipo de Apps e Sites no FIGMA, bom para apresentação, validação de ideia e workshop(DESIGN SPRINT)
objectives: 3 métodos de prototipagem rápida para utilizar durante dinâmicas como Design Sprints ou até para desenvolver seu próprio protótipo para apresentações.
Criar protótipos interativos de baixa e alta fidelidade.
Criar um protótipo navegável apenas com papel, caneta e um celular.
Como usar seu protótipo para realizar teste de usabilidade e validação de propostas.
Você receberá uma biblioteca com mais de 2 mil itens de alta fidelidade para você utilizar em seus protótipos.
Você receberá templates para prototipação no papel durante dinâmicas.
A trabalhar com a ferramenta mais popular do mercado profissional de prototipação, o Figma
Como criar uma conta no Figma.
Conceitos de design de interface e usabilidade.
Desenhar a interface de um App (replicável para sites e softwares).
Criar componentes reutilizáveis.

Método 1: Criando a navegação do nosso protótipo
Método 3: Componentes, navegações e animações no Figma

requirements: Computador com boa internet.
Não é necessário ter conhecimento prévio de design.
courses.description:
Você está precisando tirar suas ideias de software do papel ou pensando em entrar para o mundo de UI/UX design? Esse curso vai te ensinar de maneira bem objetiva, como criar protótipos de forma rápida mesmo nos seus primeiros dias dentro desse novo mundo.


Protótipos para validações de ideias devem ser algo rápido de ser construído para não se tornar um prejuízo caso seu cliente reprove sua proposta!
____


Meu nome é Douglas Nonato, e nesse curso vou te ensinar como desenvolver protótipos navegáveis, mesmo que você não saiba nada sobre design. Vou te mostrar como criar protótipos de forma rápida para você aplicar durante dinâmicas de grupos como Design Sprint, ou mesmo para validar suas próprias ideias.
Uma vez que metodologias ágeis como design sprint tem se tornado comum para o desenvolvimento de soluções dentro das empresas, saber prototipar se tornou o novo básico para quem trabalha com inovação e tecnologia.


Assista o vídeo de apresentação e ementa e descubra todo o conteúdo programático das aulas.


Vamos aprender 3 métodos
- Como criar um protótipo NAVEGÁVEL a partir de um desenho feito com papel e caneta.
- Como desenhar uma interface navegável no Figma, suficientes para validar uma ideia com seus clientes.
- Como criar uma interface completa de alta fidelidade utilizando uma biblioteca de componentes no Figma.


VOCÊ TAMBÉM TERÁ ACESSO A UMA BIBLIOTECA COM MAIS DE 2 MIL ITENS EDITÁVEIS E EM ALTA FIDELIDADE, QUE ESTARÁ DISPONÍVEL PARA VOCÊ BAIXAR E UTILIZAR TANTO NAS AULAS QUANTO EM QUALQUER PROJETO SEU.

Eu tenho mais de 12 anos de experiência com desenhos de interfaces de produtos digitais e nesse curso vou te apresentar alguns truques que aprendi nessa jornada, especialmente para quem está iniciando no mundo das interfaces. Busquei fazer esse curso de forma bem simplificada e objetiva, para ajudar principalmente quem conhece pouco sobre ferramentas de prototipação a tirar suas ideias do papel. E a ideia aqui é te dar uma ferramenta qual você consiga criar uma representação visual da sua ideia.
target_audience: Pessoas interessadas em tirar suas ideias de software do papel.
Profissionais que precisam realizar teste de usabilidade e validações com clientes.
Profissionais que trabalhem com produtos digitais, como Softwares, Sites ou Apps.
Profissionais que trabalhe com tecnologia e inovação.
Profissionais interessados em aprimorar suas apresentações.
Facilitadores de workshops e oficinas.
Designer interessado em migrar para a área de UI e UX.
Desenvolvedores front-end interessado em expandir sua área de conhecimento dentro dos projetos.
UX e UI designers.

courses.title: 设计师如何避免低效改稿
courses.bio: 让设计方案轻松落地的工作心法
objectives: 获取一套完整的规避低效改稿的思路
掌握需求拆解方法，有理有据回复需求方
掌握核心原理，输出效果更佳的设计方案
掌握与开发高效沟通的3种方式，让方案顺利落地

课程内容: 造成设计频繁改稿的3个原因
如何避免设计频繁改稿

requirements: 0基础学员适用
courses.description:
随着人们日益增长的高标准需求和对“高大上”“独特体验感”“风格化”的追求，也使得产品视觉设计得到更加重视，产品页面不再仅仅是作为传达信息的工具，更要求达到有品牌感、有内涵、有格调的视觉效果。那么，负责互联网产品视觉设计工作的你，是否正陷入频繁改稿的困境？为助你摆脱困境，三节课邀请到拥有7年＋设计经验的雨桥老师，与你分享她的工作心法。通过本次课程的学习，你将能够：掌握需求拆解方法，有理有据回复需求方；掌握核心原理，输出效果更佳的设计方案；掌握与开发高效沟通的3种方式，让方案顺利落地
本节课程是由授课老师与三节课合作制作的。在此，要特别感谢老师的辛苦付出！经历了课程立项、设计、开发中的众多环节，我们才能最终为你呈现现在的这门课程。无论是授课老师还是三节课团队，都希望这门课程能够让你有所收获，希望同学们结合个人工作情况，学以致用。

courses.title: Menguasai Fundamental UI Design
courses.bio: Belajar membuat desain antarmuka aplikasi untuk menunjang pengalaman pengguna yang memuaskan.
objectives: Dasar-dasar UI Design
Cara membuat wireframe untuk projek
Membuat Hi-Fi Prototype dengan Figma
Membuat deisgn sebuah design aplikasi dari nol
Membuat sebuah prototype sebuah produk yang interactive
Membuat Portofolio Onlinemu
requirements: Tidak perlu pengalaman design. Cocok untuk Pemula
courses.description:
Dilansir dari katadata pada Maret 2019, Indonesia termasuk negara yang banyak mencetak perusahaan rintisan (startup). Perusahaan-perusahaan baru ini biasanya bergerak di bidang teknologi berbasiskan internet. Pada Maret 2019, data Startup Ranking menyebutkan, jumlah perusahaan rintisan di Indonesia mencapai 2.074 perusahaan. Hal ini menempatkan Indonesia di posisi kedua setelah India yang paling banyak melahirkan startup di kawasan Asia. Dukungan pemerintah dengan adanya program 1000 startup turut menambah angka kelahiran startup di Indonesia dan menjadikan UI/UX Designer sebagai pekerjaan yang sangat potensial untuk beberapa tahun kedepan.
Dengan perkembangan tren teknologi dan desain yang terus berubah, kebutuhan UI Designer yang adaptif juga semakin meningkat. Pada kursus ini, kamu akan belajar bagaimana tahap-tahap membuat desain antarmuka yang baik dengan berbagai tools yang umum digunakan oleh perusahaan-perusahaan papan atas, yang akan membantumu membuat desain terbaik untuk meraih mimpimu sebagai UI Designer.
Tahukah kamu bahwa profesi desainer UI/UX dibutuhkan di mana saja? Contoh paling mudah bisa kamu cek langsung di situs lamaran kerja atau LinkedIn, di mana selalu ada ribuan lowongan pekerjaan untuk posisi desainer UI/UX.
Salah satunya adalah perusahaan-perusahaan IT raksasa seperti Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google, dan Microsoft yang selalu berkembang setiap hari. Oleh karena itu, perusahaan-perusahaan tersebut akan selalu membutuhkan desainer UI/UX baru.
Apabila salah satu impianmu adalah bekerja untuk perusahaan raksasa berskala global, profesi desainer UI/UX jelas merupakan pilihan yang sangat layak untuk kamu pertimbangkan. Dan kamu bisa memulainya dengan membekali dirimu agar kamu memiliki semua skillset yang tepat lewat program kursus UI UX.
Keunggulan lainnya yang bisa kamu nikmati dengan menjadi seorang desainer UI/UX adalah potensi pendapatan atau gaji yang tinggi. Angka yang kamu terima nantinya juga akan terus meningkat seiring dengan bertambahnya pengalaman dan tahunnya.
Dihimpun dari berbagai sumber, gaji rata-rata desainer UI adalah Rp80.250 per jam, atau sekitar Rp8.175.000 per bulan. Angka tersebut masih belum termasuk insentif yang bisa kamu dapatkan apabila kamu sudah berhasil mencapai target proyek, atau sebagai bonus prestasi. Besarnya insentif tersebut rata-rata bisa mencapai Rp20.015.000.
Sedangkan untuk desainer UX, angkanya bisa mencapai Rp106.124.600 per tahun, alias sekitar Rp8.850.000 per bulan. Sedangkan untuk insetif bonusnya bisa mencapai angka Rp36.000.000, ditambah pembagian keuntungan dalam kondisi tertentu yang besarnya bisa menyentuh angka Rp16.000.000.


Kenapa Harus Belajar UI Desain?
Prospek karir yang fleksibel, dimana kamu dapat bekerja di perusahaan maupun bekerja sendiri.
Kebutuhan UI Designer yang tinggi karena banyak perusahaan mulai membuat produk digitalnya masing-masing dan terus berkembang sesuai tren saat ini.
Mengasah kreativitas dan kemampuan analisis untuk menyelesaikan masalah.

courses.title: Designing Usable and Effective Business Dashboards
courses.bio: A User Experience (UX) Perspective
objectives: You will be able to add "Dashboard Design Expert" in your profile.
You will be able to execute "dashboard design" projects from scratch to delivery.
You will be able to articulate and "ask right questions" to your clients / stakeholders strenthening their confidence in your expertise.
You will be able to prove that "you are capable" of driving design projects in right direction.
Identify type of dashboard needed for your clients requirement.
Apply UX methodology step by step in a real world business situation from user research to dashboard delivery.
Secret to Dashboard Success: Convert raw data into actionable insights.
Basics of User Centered Design (UCD) and difference between UX and UCD.
Real life design exercise as a warm-up session. You can send your designs for feedback & comments.
Creating Design Strategy which will provide design directions for dashboard.
How to take User Interviews and eliciting insights from it.
How to create user persona from user research.
Working with wireframing and interactive prototyping software "Axure RP". (It is used by more than 25,000 organizations around the world including 87 of the Fortune 100)
Designing quick concept sketches for ideation.
Designing high - fidelity interactive business dashboard prototypes in Axure.
Understanding information visualization and its impact on dashboard design.
Improving dashboard presentation by working on Layout, Color, Font and Icons.
Test dashboards with your users (Usability Testing) to check if it really works!
Bundling your design deliverables and presenting it to your client.
Impress your client by showing systematic translation of user research into intuitive dashboards.
45 well-structured lectures with step by step content.
Free downloadable templates on Design Strategy, User Persona, Visualization Selection, Dashboard Layouts etc.
Dashboard Presentation PRO Tips.
Detailed "User Interview Protocol" to help you kick start user interviews.
Last but not the least, full time proactive support from myside to ensure that you get value for money :-)

Course Introduction: Dashboard challenges in current scenario & course structure
Who all can take this course?
Sample Exercise: Let's start with a real life story!
Design Strategy: Sales Dashboard Design - A case study
User Research: Sales Dashboard Case Study: Research Analysis
Sales Dashboard Case Study: Design Strategy Revisited
Information Visualization: How to avoid selecting wrong visualization ?
Journey from raw data to actionable insight
Information Visualization - Sales Dashboard Case Study

requirements: Axure RP (30 days free trial version available)
No previous design experience needed but willingness to learn is a must.
courses.description:
Can you improve something without measuring it? No. Right?


This is why we need business dashboards to measure and improve business performance, producing real business ROI.


For most of the people, more often than not, aesthetic beauty takes the front seat and becomes the only parameter to justify better designs. Thanks to Steve Jobs who shattered this myth by quoting - "Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works!"


Business dashboards are not foreign to this concept. We have many sophisticated tools which let us create business dashboards in minutes, but rarely we think about it's usefulness in business context. We forget that developer who is building the dashboard is not the person who is actually going to consume it. We neglect User Centered Design process while designing business dashboards.


And the result? We end up designing "Instinct Based Subjective Design" which hardly provides any value. This course takes you on a journey of creating "Research Based User Centric Objective Design" which provides true ROI to your client.


This course will teach you everything you need to know about user research, design strategy, design conceptualization, wire framing, prototyping and testing it with your end users to make sure it really works! You will learn all this from scratch so it doesn't matter how much experience you have when you take up this course.


In this 64 well-structured video lecture series, we will start with understanding a real life business challenge. I will give you an opportunity to perform a design exercise and I can provide you the feedback on the same. This will help you understand what I mean by "Instinct based subjective design". Then we will proceed on with learning how to take user interviews effectively and how to elicit design key pointers from it. We will create a systematic design strategy to achieve our business goal. We will create user persona to better understand our user and feed all these research insights practically onto paper to create concept sketches for dashboard. We will refine concept sketch step by step focusing on visualizations, layout, font, color, icons etc. until we reach our close to perfect dashboard. (Because in reality, there is nothing like perfect design :-)


Hey, we are not going to stop yet! We will test our dashboard with real users to understand if it really works! And in last, we are to show you how to bundle your deliverables and help your team members consume all this stuff along the way.


This course will help you in converting raw business data into actionable insights.
This course will help you in analyzing and communicating business information effectively for quality decision making.


So what are you waiting for? Join me in this exciting and rewarding journey of effective business dashboard design!
target_audience: New or established business owners who want to track various aspects of their business performance.
UX designers who want to enhance their scope of expertise.
Developers who work with Tableau, Power BI, or any other analytics platform and would want to bring User Centered Design aspect in their work.
Business Analysts who want to know how User Centered Design method can help them create usable business dashboards.
Students / beginners who want to learn UX, its process, and want to implement research into design practically in real life business situation.
Freelancers who are dealing with “dashboard” projects and aim to bring more ROI for their client.

courses.title: Microcopy & UX Writing: The Complete Course
courses.bio: Learn to write great microcopy, define a unique brand voice, and create an optimal user experience through words
objectives: How to write great microcopy for common UI components, using easy-to-understand conversational language
How to help users AND achieve your business goals with words
How to create an optimal user experience through your writing
How to engage users with real value
How to define your own unique brand voice

Getting Started: Getting Started

requirements: A love for writing, tech and humans
courses.description:
WELCOME TO THE MICROCOPY & UX WRITING COURSE, CREATED BY KINNERET YIFRAH, THE AUTHOR OF THE BESTSELLER "MICROCOPY: THE COMPLETE GUIDE".
Kinneret is a thought leader in the UX writing field and a world-renowned microcopy expert.
In this course - designed for beginners and designers seeking an additional skill - you will discover invaluable tips, golden guidelines, and best practices on how to write for common UI components (buttons, error messages, success messages, sign-up pages, empty states, forms, and more), define a unique brand voice, write in a conversational language, and boost engagement.


GET REAL PRACTICAL TOOLS
This course will NOT be presenting theoretical or abstract ideas.
Instead, you'll learn step-by-step, super-practical methods that empower you to write great microcopy for real digital products, with dozens of real screenshots to learn from.
With this knowledge and tools, you'll be able to:
Land your first job as a UX writer
Write great microcopy on your mockups or wireframes
Take your digital product a huge step forward


EXERCISE WHAT YOU LEARN
Each chapter is accompanied by an exercise designed to help you practice and perfect your new abilities, right there and then.
The solution to each exercise is also provided.
Please note: There is no feedback provided other than the solutions.
In some chapters, a printable tool can be downloaded for future use.


TRIED, TESTED & PROVEN TO DRIVE SUCCESS
- "You helped me find the right words for our customers, and give them better UX by strictly trusting your methods" {Eugen Styrz, Information architect, Germany}
- "It was CRUCIAL in landing me my first UX writing job. Forever grateful" {Anieca}
- "Your book was a life-saving reference for me when I was the first to pilot the role of UX Writer at my company" {Anne}


ABOUT THE PRESENTER
The course is presented in English by Merav Levkowitz, content strategist, copywriter, and UX writer extraordinaire.
The course was written and produced by Kinneret Yifrah.


THE FULL PROGRAM


Chapter 1: Getting started
You will learn how to get the most out of this NEW course.


Chapter 2: Introduction to the brand voice
You will learn how to create your own unique writing style.
- What is a brand voice and how will it help achieve businesses’ and users’ goals
- Defining a brand or product’s personality
- How personality influences writing style
- How language helps differentiate the brand/product
- Finding the right messages that are unique to your brand/product
- Maintaining a brand’s voice when addressing different target groups
- Writing for a brand with a widely diverse target audience
- Designing your own brand voice in 4 steps


Chapter 3: Conversational writing
You will learn how to communicate clearly and write in a way that users easily understand.
- How and why to let go of academic and legal jargon
- Writing in simple and natural language
- Writing clearly about serious topics in official settings


Chapter 4: Engagement
You will learn how to create engagement and effectively motivate users.
- 4 important tools for boosting engagement
- Tips for writing engaging sign-up forms for websites and apps
- Tips for writing engaging newsletter sign-ups


Chapter 5: Buttons
You will learn how to write convincing and effective copy for buttons.
- How to write a button copy that provides value and increases conversions
- The difference between functional buttons and sales-focused buttons
- What to write next to a button to give users an extra-nudge
- Tips for online store buttons


Chapter 6: Error messages
You will learn how to write error messages that prevent user abandonment.
- How to minimize the need for error messages altogether
- The two most important components every error message must contain
- Words that should never be used in error messages
- When and how to use humor in error messages


Chapter 7: Forms and complex tasks
You will learn how to write assistive copy that empowers users to complete tasks independently and with ease.
- How to minimize the load of copy in a form and still give users all the information and help they need
- How good microcopy reduces calls to customer support (with a case study)
- How to answer any question before it’s even been asked
- How to alleviate potential concerns, for example concerning payment security and free trials
- How to ask for personal details and encourage sign-ups with a social media account
- How to write clear instructions presented as tooltips, assistive copy, placeholders, and ghost text


Chapter 8: Success messages
You will learn how to create an experience that delights users and adds value to the usual “Action completed successfully” message.
- Why success messages are so important
- Writing concise success messages for recurring actions
- Writing engaging success messages for meaningful actions
- The 4 most important elements of any success message
- How a success message can lead users to the next step and increase in-product traffic


Chapter 9: Empty states
You will learn how to engage users in never-before thought of instances.
- The 3 types of empty states
- How empty states can reduce app abandonment rates
- Why a blank empty state is a wasted traffic
- Using empty states to engage users, educate them about the system, and sell more


Chapter 10: Loading times
You will learn how to transform frustrating waiting times into delightful surprises.
- Making users feel like time is flying by
- Making users appreciate what they’re getting even more
- How you can creatively fill the short and long periods of time users spend waiting for pages to load


Chapter 11: 404 pages
You will learn how to write 404 pages that are friendly and help you win over even the most reluctant of clients.
- Why 404 pages are overrated
- Why 404 pages DO matter
- How to write 404 pages designed to help users and businesses alike
- The three must-haves for every 404 page
target_audience: Writers who want to break into a new and exciting field - UX writing
UX and UI designers who want to improve the microcopy of their mockups
UX writers and content strategists who want to sharpen their microcopy skills
Product managers
Technical writers
Website and app owners
Digital marketing professionals

requirements: This course is an introduction to service design and doesn't require any prior knowledge.
courses.description:
Why service design?
Because Service design helps companies to create a strong competitive advantage and thus stay successful.
In a rapidly changing world, companies are forced to constantly adapt if they don't want to be disrupted. Here are the 3 main challenges that companies need to overcome:
First, customers are more demanding than ever.
Second, continuous innovation has gone from being a luxury to a necessity.
And third, companies don't have the right organizational structure to support omnichannel customer journeys.
Applying service Service Design Fundamentals and Techniques, will enable companies to address each of these challenges. Here's how:
By building a strong competitive advantage that’s hard to copy.
By focusing on solving the right problem and is very research based.
By improving collaboration and breaking down silos within organizations.
By offering a toolbox filled with techniques which facilitate quick, affordable and low risk innovations.
By taking a holistic approach and reviewing the entire customer experience.
And finally, by being flexible and offering a broad spectrum of applications.
This course is an introduction to service design and doesn't require any prior knowledge.


Who is this course for?
Recent graduates looking to start a position as a service designer, a business analyst, business consultant, product manager, product owner or even a UX designer.
Junior service designers wanting to strengthen their knowledge.
Senior service designers looking to brush up their skills.
All professionals who are actively doing service design in their field of expertise and wanting to formalize their way of working.


What else can I offer you?
You will have access to:
The slides of the course which you can use at your own convenience.
Fun assignments to make things more tangible.
Handouts and templates to help you in your day-to-day service design activities.
Access to an industry expert. In case you have questions feel free to contact me and I will do my absolute best to guide you.


What did others think?
“Content is authoritative, rigorous, comprehensive and accessible. The delivery is professional, well-paced and easy to listen too. The presentation is personable, learning is scaffolded with no cognitive overload.” – Will
“Interesting no nonsense course, well given. Fully meets expectations.” – Eva


Now it's your turn!
Do you want to improve the customer experience in a fail-safe way? Then this course has everything you need and more!
target_audience: Recent graduates looking to start a position as a service designer, a business analyst, a UX designer, a product manager, etc.
Junior service designers wanting to strengthen their knowledge.
Senior service designers looking to brush up their skills.
All professionals who are actively doing service design in their field of expertise and wanting to formalize their way of working.

courses.description:
Embark on a dynamic journey into the world of rapid product design with our comprehensive course focused on the creation of automatic shrimp feeders. As a seasoned product designer, I will guide you through an in-depth case study, offering invaluable insights into the entire design process – from conception to the realization of a functional and innovative product.
Key Benefits of this Course:
Product Design Case Study Mastery:
Gain a profound understanding of the intricacies involved in a real-world product design case study centered around automatic shrimp feeders. Explore every stage of the process, from initial ideas to the final, fully-realized concept.
Accelerated Ideation Techniques:
Develop the essential skills needed for fast-paced ideation, a critical aspect in smaller design studios. Learn to efficiently navigate 3-D modeling, rendering, prototyping, and engage in effective customer interactions within short timeframes.
Effective Handling of Constraints:
Navigate the challenges presented by manufacturing constraints, including limitations in materials, tight budgets, and project timelines. Acquire the strategic prowess needed to ensure successful execution in the face of limitations.
Strategic Benchmarking Studies:
Understand the significance of strategic benchmarking studies within compressed timeframes. Learn how to make informed decisions and derive innovative design solutions through efficient comparative analyses.
Evolution of Ideas into Final Concepts:
Witness the iterative process of idea evolution, observing how diverse concepts transform and converge into finalized product designs. Understand the art of refining and perfecting ideas efficiently.
Customer-Centric Communication Skills:
Develop effective communication skills tailored for swift and empathetic interactions with customers. Learn to understand and address their needs rapidly, ensuring a customer-centric approach throughout the design process.
Practical Application through Class Project:
Engage in a hands-on class project that challenges you to apply the learned skills in a real-world scenario. Measure your effectiveness in generating ideas within constrained timeframes, fostering practical application of the acquired knowledge.
Course Goals:
By the conclusion of this course, you will have acquired the skills and knowledge essential for excelling in the dynamic field of rapid product design. Master the intricacies of small studio challenges and deliver innovative solutions efficiently, setting the stage for a successful career in product design.


Courtesy,
Dr. FAK Noble Ai Researcher, Scientists, Product Developer, Innovator & Pure Consciousness Expert
Founder of Noble Transformation Hub TM

courses.title: How to carry out a usability expert review
courses.bio: Learn how to find and fix usability and user experience bloopers in web, software and mobile user interfaces.
objectives: Appreciate the difference between a usability inspection and someone’s personal opinion.
Learn and practice some quick techniques for carrying out usability reviews of prototypes and finished products.
Apply Jakob Nielsen’s “heuristic evaluation” technique to software, products and web sites.
Compare Nielsen's heuristics with other sets of guidelines, like ISO’s 7 dialogue principles, Shniederman’s 8 golden rules of dialog design and Tog’s 16 principles of interaction design
Uncover the elements of your design that lead new users to make errors, using the task-based “cognitive walkthrough” method.

Heuristic Evaluation: Heuristic #2: Match between system and the real world
Heuristic #5: Help users recognize, diagnose, and recover from errors
Heuristic #8: Flexibility and efficiency of use
Shniederman’s 8 golden rules of dialog design
How do you think the different guidelines match up?
Quick activity: Match up the ISO and Nielsen guidelines
Quick activity: Match up the Shneiderman and Nielsen guidelines
How I think the different sets of guidelines match up
From usability guidelines to usability checklists
Why you need more than one evaluator
The Cognitive Walkthrough: Q1: Will the user realistically be trying to do this action?
Q2: Is the control for the action visible?
Q3: Is there a strong link between the control and the action?
Practical activity: Do a cognitive walkthrough
Presenting results from an Expert Review: The three factors to consider when defining severity
How do you tell people their baby is ugly?
Report templates for an expert review
Wrap up: Please give me your feedback on this course

requirements: You should have an interest in and an enthusiasm for user interface design.
courses.description:
Learn how to carry out one of the most in-demand user experience techniques — the Usability Expert Review.
Knowing how to competently carry out an expert review is a skill that should be in every UX consultant's toolbox.
Expert reviews are a great way to identify "usability bloopers" with a product or web site. They are quick, cost-effective and provide an immediate sanity check for the design. Expert reviews are also an ideal way to ensure that a product or web site will meet usability standards.
But many people find it difficult to identify specific usability issues from generic usability heuristics. Beginners also find it hard to derive action-oriented recommendations that can be passed to the design team.
This seminar reveals the practitioner secrets behind expert reviews and will teach you how to think like a usability expert.
Appreciate the difference between a usability inspection and someone’s personal opinion.
Learn and practice some quick techniques for carrying out usability reviews of prototypes and finished products.
Apply Jakob Nielsen’s heuristic evaluation technique to software, products and web sites.
Compare Nielsen's heuristics with other sets of guidelines, like ISO’s 7 dialogue principles, Shniederman’s 8 golden rules of dialog design and Tog’s 16 principles of interaction design
Uncover the elements of your design that lead new users to make errors, using the task-based cognitive walkthrough method.
As well as a set of comprehensive notes, you'll download detailed usability checklists and workbooks to help you carry out the most valuable techniques: the Heuristic Evaluation and the Cognitive Walkthrough.
You'll also download an expert review reporting template in PowerPoint and Keynote format that you can re-brand and use to report back the results of your own expert reviews.
- All of the video lectures and worksheets are download-enabled. If you have a slow internet connection, or want to take this course with you on your laptop, smartphone or other portable device, sign up and download all the videos and other course materials now.
- Every lecture has been fully transcribed as a text document. This is useful if English isn’t your native language or if you just want a readable and searchable version of the course.
- On completion of the training, you will receive a certificate of completion and be eligible for free, e-mail-based, refresher training.
target_audience: This seminar is for you if you are looking for practical, cost-effective methods to evaluate designs.
This is an in-depth course in one area of user experience and is most effective for delegates who have day-to-day responsibility for ensuring usability within their organisation.
Common job titles include web designer, software designer, user interface designer, user experience designer and usability practitioner.

Why choose this Course?
There is no other course available online that provides practical & theoretical knowledge on how to get started with UX Design for AR/VR, In this course, you will learn step by step process for making an Augmented Reality Prototype. My experience as an AR/VR UX Designer didn't start with a course, I had to dig a lot because the information was scattered so I don't want you to waste any more of your time and provide you with an organised lesson plan for everything you need to get started with. courses.description:
Figma is a very powerful application that runs online. There are virtually no platform boundaries when it comes to using figma because you can design within a web browser or using their desktop application made for windows and macs. Figma is similar to Sketch and Adobe XD but is the more powerful of the three when it comes to team collaboration and responsive, fast paced design.
This course will cover user interface designing using the powerful tools within Figma. In the first section, I'll cover the Figma interface and where you can find powerful tools like constraints to make your designs responsive, and components to build a library of design elements to use throughout your projects. I'll also go over real-time team collaboration and how you can use figma to work closely with others in the same project.
Later on I will guide you through designing and prototyping a "Chef's Recipes" App which will include multiple artboards, custom icon designs, editing images and text, and everything else you need to create a polished realistic design.
Please join me as a beginner in design or as a seasoned UI/UX designer wanting to switch from other tools like Sketch or Adobe XD

courses.description:
Figma Prototyping: A deep dive for UX, UI Designer
Bring your design alive with Figma prototyping. In this deep dive, we will learn everything about creating basic prototypes, smart animating in Figma, re-usable interactive components, stunning interactions with variables, expressions and conditional statements and how to share and document.
We'll start with the basics and learn how to connect our screens, add different scrolling behaviours, and preview our design, as well as some tips and tricks to present your prototypes.
We will explore the different triggers, animation types and how to create a stateful design with the help of Figma sections.
We will move on to smart animate the magic part prototyping in Figma. I'm going to show you all of smart animates superpowers and we're also going to talk about their limitations and do some troubleshooting.
Then we will learn how to set up micro-interactions with interactive components in Figma. This will save you a lot of time when it comes to adding standard behaviour to instances across your design. And that's also where Figma unleashes its truly impressive potential, namely when combining auto layout, smart animate and interactive components.
Finally, I'll show you tips and techniques for documenting and sharing your prototypes for handoff, and we'll take a look at interactive component documentation in Figma as well as external design systems.
I will provide you with a Figma file that lets you follow alongside me during the videos or return to exercises with detailed instructions in your own time.
This course is for you if you have a basic knowledge of Figma or if you are an advanced Figma user and want to improve your prototyping skills.

courses.description:
Sumérgete en el emocionante universo del Diseño de Interfaces de Usuario (UI) con nuestro curso "Diseño de UI con FlutterFlow - Tienda Virtual". Este curso está diseñado para aquellos apasionados por el diseño tanto en aplicaciones como en web y la creación de experiencias de usuario impactantes, sin importar su nivel de experiencia previa.
En este curso nos enfocaremos solo en la parte del Front-End, te guiaremos a través de un viaje de aprendizaje completo, comenzando desde los fundamentos de FlutterFlow hasta la creación de una tienda virtual completamente funcional y estéticamente atractiva. Aprenderás a utilizar las herramientas básicas de FlutterFlow de manera efectiva, permitiéndote diseñar interfaces intuitivas y coherentes.
Pero eso no es todo, el diseño no se trata solo de estética; también es crucial ofrecer una experiencia de usuario fluida y agradable. Por eso, te enseñaremos a implementar transiciones y animaciones atractivas que mejorarán significativamente la navegación y la interacción del usuario con tu tienda virtual.
Además, el curso se enfocará en cómo integrar elementos visuales como imágenes, fuentes y colores de manera coherente y profesional, garantizando una identidad de marca sólida y una experiencia visualmente agradable para tus usuarios.
Con instrucciones paso a paso, ejemplos prácticos y proyectos reales, este curso te proporcionará las habilidades y conocimientos necesarios para diseñar y desarrollar interfaces de usuario de alta calidad con FlutterFlow.
¡No pierdas la oportunidad de dar el salto en tu carrera de diseño y crear interfaces de usuario impactantes y funcionales para tus proyectos de tienda virtual!
target_audience: Este curso está diseñado especialmente para personas apasionadas por el diseño UI y la creación de experiencias de usuario, y lo mejor de todo, ¡no se requiere experiencia previa en programación! Si eres un principiante curioso o un profesional del diseño buscando expandir sus habilidades, este curso es perfecto para ti

courses.title: ACCESSIBILITY FOR ALL DESIGNERS
courses.bio: Design-minded individuals who want to the basics of inclusive design
objectives: IT , Design, essential to anyone in technology space as a UX- UI Design

Subject Matter: Accessibility and Inclusiveness in Design
This course is for anyone who loves to create a better user experience in the realm of creating outstanding accessible and inclusive design

courses.description:
THIS COURSE - 15+ hours of @ Medium articles and video links
What You’ll Learn
How design decisions impact accessibility and usability
The accessibility standards you should be following
The types of disabilities you should design and optimize for
How to proactively incorporate accessibility into your design and development processes
The best tools and techniques for validating your accessibility efforts
How to build an accessibility program and use it to increase your organization’s maturity
Good accessibility is crucial to making your website or app a success. Not only is designing for accessibility required by law in many countries—if you fail to consider accessibility, but you are also excluding millions of people from using your product.
That being said, you’ll learn how to approach accessibility from all angles. You’ll gain practical, hands-on skills that’ll enable you to assess and optimize for common accessibility issues, as well as show you how to place an emphasis on the quality of the user experience by avoiding classic mistakes.
You will gain access to multiple real-world examples of websites and apps where you can demonstrate your skills through analysis and accessibility tests. Not only will this give you a more practical view of accessibility, but you’ll also be able to optimize your websites and mobile apps in an expert manner—avoiding key mistakes that are commonly made when designing for accessibility.
What’s more, you’ll also come away with the knowledge to conduct effective accessibility testing by having the correct knowledge to work and design with users with disabilities, from minority demographics in all aspects of design.


What are you waiting for?
Enroll Now
I'll see you in class!
target_audience: Designer
Junior to Senior Professionals

courses.title: GenAI Fundamentals for UX Designers + Researchers
courses.bio: Learn the key concepts and components to harness GenAI for UX design — and lead AI product innovation efforts.
objectives: Learn core principles of responsible GenAI design that ensure our products serve all users equally + equitably.
Success factors unique to Machine Learning (ML) products that UX + Product Designers and their teams should adopt
Guidance on research to determine what kinds of problems are best solved by AI, and where human control should remain central.
Determining when AI features are appropriate for users — and when they aren't
Identifying when Automation (AI does the task for users) or Augmentation (help them do it better) is more appropriate.
Designing the reward function and appropriately considering the balance between false positives and false negatives.
Essential factors to consider when evaluating the reward function.
How to weigh necessary, unavoidable tradeoffs between precision and recall, which is key to shaping an AI user experience.
Designing for fairness and inclusion, from objectives to datasets to guidance on bias testing.
Designing for generative variability: how do we present multiple, varied outputs to users — and how do we guide them in selecting the best one?
Designing for multiple outputs: how do we help users filter and highlight differences between outputs?
Designing for imperfections: how do we empower users to manage + mitigate imperfections and designing with contextual sensitivity?
Designing for confidence: how do we design confidence scoring to properly evaluate output quality and increase user trust?
Rules and examples for applying confidence scores.
Designing for co-creation: how to we design co-creation processes where both the user and the AI can make adjustments?
Designing for generic controls: using "temperature" to control the number of outputs and the degree of variability in those outputs.
Designing for domain-specific controls, such as encoder-decoder models, semantic sliders and prompt engineering.
Designing for prompt engineering: enabling and guiding users to effectively use multiple types of conversational prompts.
Designing for exploration: incorporating flexibility, feedback, transparency and error handling/expectation management.
Designing for choice, feedback, transparency + safety: centering users as active, empowered participants in the creation process.
Designing for mental models: orienting users to generative variability, teaching effective use and teaching the AI about the user.
Designing for explanation, understanding + trust: providing clear rationales for outputs, using friction to curb over-reliance and showing imperfections.
Designing against harm: understanding the critical ways irresponsible AI design can harm people.
Designing against hazardous outputs: discrimination, exclusion, toxicity, misinformation, deep fakes, IP theft and more.
Mitigating harm with a Value-Sensitive Design (VSD) process, integrated with an Agile or Lean development process.

Principles, Practices + Possibilities: Understanding the challenge: the UX of variability
Principles to adopt for UXers, Designers and Product Teams
Responsible best practices for Gen AI UX + Design
Context of Use: Investigation + Research: Who What + When: core areas of investigation
When AI is appropriate for users (and when it's not)
Automation vs. Assistance: determining when each is appropriate for users
Making Smart Tradeoffs: Precision vs. Recall
Design principles for Gen AI models + ap: Designing for Choice, Feedback, Transparency + Safety
The Future of Gen AI UX is Yours (No, Re: The Power (and the Responsibility) Is Yours: 5 Things to Remember

requirements: None. GenAI is stil extremely new to the world of UX, so this fundamentals course is meant to get you on solid ground fast, no matter your experience.
courses.description:
Protect and grow your career: Learn to design GenAI-enabled products
The UX and Product design landscape is evolving—and AI is leading the charge. If you're a designer, UXer, or product developer, you can't afford to be left behind. Generative AI is not just a buzzword; it's becoming the backbone of the next generation of user experiences. And without a deep understanding of how to design AI-powered products, your skill set risks becoming obsolete.
This course is for you if you want to:

Stay relevant in an industry that’s rapidly integrating AI into every aspect of product development and feature sets.
Be the asset your employer relies on—not the UXer or designer left off key projects because you lack the necessary skills.
Lead the future of UX and design rather than have it dictated to you by engineers and product managers.
Why you must start learning the fundamentals of GenAI product design now
AI isn’t just an optional add-on anymore. It’s the next fundamental shift in product design—just like when UX and UI became indispensable. Here’s the reality:

Employers want designers who understand how to design user-centered GenAI experiences that are useful, usable, valuable, and trustworthy. Without this skill, your job security and opportunities will shrink.
Product improvement initiatives and AI integration projects are happening in every major company, from simple voice and chatbot interfaces to workflow-based conversational experiences. The people who know how to design these experiences are the ones who will be chosen for leadership roles.
AI is the new frontier in UX and product design. Just as front-end coding knowledge became essential for UXers, understanding emerging design trends for GenAI — and how to design and evaluate AI-enabled products — is the next career progression.
If you don’t understand AI-enabled design, you won’t be part of these key projects. Your value will diminish—both to your current employer and in the eyes of potential future employers.
What you’ll learn in this course

Master the fundamentals of designing AI-powered products

Learn the principles that guide effective, responsible design for AI. I’ll teach you the fundamental principles and approaches behind experiences that blend the power of AI with intuitive, human-centered design. From initial investigation and research to designing features, functionality and evaluation metrics to gauge usability and measure trust, I'll tackle all the core areas you need to know about.
Why it matters: AI is about more than automation. It’s about delivering useful and valuable user experiences that meet both user needs and business goals.

Create ethical, trustworthy AI-driven products

I’ll show you how to build AI products that users trust—and that won’t perpetuate bias or misinformation. You’ll learn the ethical considerations you need to think through and how to design with fairness and transparency in mind.
Why it matters: Building trust is crucial in AI. Companies are investing in AI solutions that don’t just work but are ethical and inclusive. Your ability to design these systems will set you apart.

Understand the basics of designing for key GenAI attributes like generative variability and tradeoffs between precision and recall.

Generative variability is the heart of GenAI. I'll walk you through two critical questions we, as UXers and designers, have to answer: (1) how do we present multiple, varied outputs to users and (2) how do we guide them in selecting the best one?
As a UX or product designer, one of the key decisions you’ll face when working with AI systems is how to balance precision and recall. I'll dig intot both concepts and walk you through how to design that balance appropriately.
Why it matters: Generative variability is the heart of GenAI, and designing for it requires an approach that's very different from the products we typically tackle. In particular, precision and recall define how accurate and thorough your AI’s results will be — and getting the balance right directly impacts UX and user trust.

Turn AI into a business asset for your clients or employers

Design AI systems that do more than just function—they deliver real business value. I’ll teach you how to align AI-driven products with business objectives, ensuring that the user experience drives results.
Why it matters: Your ability to create AI-enabled products that solve real business challenges will make you a valuable asset to your employer.

Be a leader in AI-enabled UX and product design

As AI continues to reshape the design industry, you’ll be equipped to lead AI-focused design projects, taking your career to the next level. No more waiting on engineers to explain AI to you. You’ll be the one leading the collaborative charge to determine how AI best fits into product design.
Why it matters: Leaders in this field don’t wait for opportunities—they create them. Position yourself as a forward-thinking designer who is driving AI adoption and innovation.
Who this course is for:

New UX and Product Designers: If you’re starting out and want to make your career trajectory more stable and secure, this course will give you the foundation to be an asset to your employer from day one.
Experienced UXers, Product Designers and Product Developers: If you’re already working in the industry and want to stay competitive and lead the next wave of innovation, this course will teach you how to begin integrating AI product design into your current design skill set — and to have informed, productive conversations with software engineers and data scientists on GenAI projects.
I've included a massive GenAI UX workbook you can use on real-world projects.
You can download and use this 164-page companion workbook to use both as practice and to help you through the process of designing for GenAI in your daily work as well. Use the guidance and 89 exercises across 22 mission-critical topics in GenAI design for any real-world GenAI projects that come your way — the exercises here are designed to help you through the process, from concept to execution.
target_audience: New UX and Product Designers: If you’re starting out and want to make your career trajectory more stable and secure, this course will give you the foundation to be an asset to your employer from day one.

Experienced UXers, Product Designers and Product Developers: If you’re already working in the industry and want to stay competitive and lead the next wave of innovation, this course will teach you how to begin integrating AI product design into your current design skill set — and to have informed, productive conversations with software engineers and data scientists on GenAI projects.
UX Researchers, UX Writers, Product Managers and anyone wondering what they need to know in order to play a role in designing GenAI-driven products.
Practitioners of all kinds who are new to the world of GenAI — and don't know where to start learning about it.

courses.title: เรียน UX/UI Design Professional และ Miro & Figma Workshops
courses.bio: เรียน UX/UI Design Professional และ Miro & Figma Workshops Zero to Hero
objectives: ผู้เรียนจะได้รับความเข้าใจอย่างถี่ถ้วนเกี่ยวกับเนื้อหาของ UX และ UI
ผู้เรียนจะเข้าใจกระบวนการออกแบบ UX ว่ามีขั้นตอนและวิธีการอย่างไรบ้าง
ผู้เรียนสามารถนำหลักการปฏิบัติและเครื่องมือที่ใช้ในกระบวนการออกแบบ UX ไปใช้ในการทำงานจริงได้
ผู้เรียนสามารถใช้โปรแกรม Miro มาช่วยในการทำงานของอาชีพ UX Designer ได้
ผู้เรียนสามารถใช้โปรแกรม Figma มาช่วยออกแบบและสร้าง Wireframe และ Prototype ของ Applications ได้
ผู้เรียนสามารถนำความรู้ที่ได้ไปประยุกต์ใช้การประกอบอาชีพ UX Designers และ UX/UI Devleopers ได้
ผู้เรียนสามารถนำความรู้ที่ได้ไปต่อยอดการทำ Project ต่าง ๆ ในการเรียนและการทำงานจริงได้
