requirements: Dostęp do komputera nie jest wymagany na początku kursu, tylko kartka i ołówek!
Jeżeli chcesz pracować na tablecie zalecany dowolny tablet np. wacom i dowolny program do rysunku takie jak Photoshop lub Procreate
Możesz również pracować na tablecie wacom czy huion z ekranem.
courses.description:
Co oferuje unikalnego ten kurs? Praktyczne ćwiczenia bez potrzeby instalowania żadnego software! Wystarczy kartka papieru i ołówek. W tym kursie rysowania zobaczysz od czego najlepiej zacząć rysować i jakie ćwiczenia możesz wykonywać żeby rysować jeszcze lepiej.
Żeby nauczyć się rysować trzeba zacząć od podstaw. Takie podstawy możesz zobaczyć w praktyce i ćwiczyć oglądając ten kurs. Jest to świetny sposób na uczenie się czegoś co można zawsze wykorzystać - gdziekolwiek jesteś.  Poznaj ten nowy cykl szkoleń, w którym przedstawiamy: Rysunek jako podstawowe narzędzie projektanta.
Rysowanie ołówkiem odręczne lub długopisem swoich pomysłów czy wizualizacji jest umiejętnością, która można ćwiczyć wszędzie! Taka natura kartki papieru i Twojej ręki, nie potrzebujesz niczego więcej. Musisz tylko zacząć. Dlatego kurs ten zawiera nagrania profesjonalnej projektantki, która na co dzień maj styczność z rysunkiem. Oprócz praktycznych rad kurs zawiera szereg ćwiczeń posługiwania się narzędziem do rysowania. Nie wiesz od czego zacząć? Ten materiał to świetny start na to żeby zacząć swoją przygodę z rysowaniem na tablecie w photoshopie.
To czego się nauczę po tym kursie?
Ćwiczenia ręki wykonywać żeby rysować pewnej, lepiej i efektywniej
Jakie są najważniejsze narzędzia do Digital Paintingu?
Jak rozstawić interface w programach Photoshop?
Jak używać i ustawiać potrzebne kolory w Photoshopie?
Jak zacząć nowy rysunek od zera?
W jaki sposób rysować cienie oraz prześwietlenia?
Jak mieszać ze sobą różne kolory?
i wiele innych umiejętności, które możesz wykorzystać do własnych projektów!


Muszę umieć rysować by korzystać z tego kursu rysunku?
Nie, nie potrzeba umiejętności rysowania. Kurs będzie pomocny dla osób, które potrafią rysować wspaniałe rysunki na kartce ale niechętnie podchodzą do tego kiedy pojawia się komputer zamiast kartki. Po przejściu tego kursu osoby te będą mogły przenieść swoje umiejętności na ekran komputera. Jeżeli chodzi o osoby, które nie potrafią rysować, to również znajdą tutaj wszystko czego im potrzeba żeby zacząć robić to lepiej. Rozpoczniemy od omówienia narzędzi i następnie pokażemy krok po kroku jak zrobić prosty szkic. Każde umiejętności rysowania będą przydatne ale nie są konieczne.
Kurs prowadzony jest krok po kroku dzięki temu pozwala podejrzeć co jest istotne w treningu i jak najlepiej do tego podchodzić. Swoimi rysunkami możesz podzielić się na forum kursu i zobaczyć jak każdy ma różne style i może ćwiczyć umiejętność przenikania między nimi według potrzeb. To świetna inicjatywa, która pomoże ci chwycić za ołówek! Rysowaniu krok po kroku pomagają rysunki szkice i są załączone jako źródła do tego kursu.
Kto tutaj uczy? Więcej o autorze
Michalina Bloch
To praktyczna kompilacja - krótkie treningi jak rysować proste linie, jak rysować używając wyobraźni (bez komputera!), oraz podstawy rysowania w perspektywie i cieniowania (z pomocą komputera!). To na co czekasz? Dołącz już dzisiaj i zacznij rysować!
target_audience: Początkujący rysownicy, którzy chcą rozwinąć swoje umiejętności rysunku.
Każda osoba z branży kreatywnej, UX designer, Projektanci, Grafik 3D a nawet informatycy, którzy mogą poznać nowy język (rysunku!)
Każdy kto chcę nauczyć się digital painting, rysunku cyfrowego, rysowania na komputerze

courses.title: FIGMA ULTIMATE MEGA COURSE
courses.bio: Low and High Fidelity ,Animations, Multi-Dimentional Variables, Colors, Text, Icons and Plugins with Prototyping
objectives: With Figma, you can create fully interactive prototypes, work with UX personas, and design simple wireframes.
You'll also learn how to implement colors and images properly, choose appropriate fonts for web and mobile apps, and create your own icons, buttons, and other U
You will learn how to use photopea to enhance your design
Whether you want to design websites or mobile phone apps, this course will teach you everything you need to know about working with fonts and colors.
collaborating with team members and exporting the appropriate files for your developer or software engineer.
You'll even learn how to create your first UX brief and persona, and pick up professional workflow tricks and shortcuts.
You will learn how to create various UI/UX design effects including Glasmorphism, Neomorphism and Skeuomorphism .you will receive a comprehensive guide on
Best of all, you'll be able to add "UX designer" to your CV with confidence, knowing that you have the skills and knowledge to succeed in this exciting field.
Throughout the course, you'll build a UX project from beginning to end, and learn what clients expect from a UX designer.
You'll also learn how to create a simple style guide for client handoff, and make both simple and advanced micro interactions, page transitions, and animations.
With videos of detailed Figma and UX/UI design content, you'll have all the techniques used by UX professionals at your fingertips.
requirements: To get started, all you'll need is a copy of Figma, which you can download for free from Figma website.
Whether you're a beginner or an experienced designer, Figma is accessible to all skill levels.
This course is designed for anyone who wants to learn UX/UI design with Figma, regardless of their prior design or software skills.
Figma is easy to learn and use, even if you have no prior design or software experience.
You don't need any previous design or Figma experience to take this course - just an interest in learning UX/UI design.
Don't worry if you're new to UX/UI design or Figma - this course assumes no previous experience.
courses.description:
Hello and welcome to  complete UI/UX Mega Course using Figma for Beginners, my name is Elisha Nanyong and I am glad to be your instructor in this journey to become a UI/UX Designer using Figma. This design tool will help us create stunning interfaces and engaging prototypes.
In this course, we are specifically catering to beginners who are new to design and the field of user experience design. Even if you're unsure about what UI UX design is all about, don't worry, we will start from the basics and work our way up step by step.


We will begin by discussing the brief and how to work with a UX persona. Then we will dive into creating simple wireframes. We will learn about incorporating colors and images into high fidelity mockups as we progress. You will also learn about the dos and don'ts of choosing fonts for web and mobile apps.


Moreover, we will cover topics such as creating icons, buttons and other UI components, as well as advanced concepts like component sets, constraints, and multi-dimensional variants that are easier to understand the moment we start getting our hands dirty. To make our workflow smoother, we will also be using free UI kits and plugins in Figma.


By the end of this course, you will have a complete understanding of how to create simple and advanced micro-interactions, page transitions, and animations. You will be able to build fully interactive prototypes ready for user testing, collaborate with other team members, and export the right files for handoff to your developer or software engineer.


Throughout the course, I will set assignments to help you practice and develop your skills, and by the end of it, you will have something unique to showcase in your portfolio. So let's upgrade ourselves and go from Figma novice to Figma Professional. Sign up today and I will see you in class.
target_audience: This course is designed for individuals who are looking to incorporate Figma into their career and get paid for their user experience design skills.
It is specifically tailored to beginners, newbies, and amateurs in the field of UX design who are new to the world of design and user experience.
If you need to add "UX Design" to your portfolio or are interested in learning the essentials of UI and UX design, this course is for you.

courses.title: Ứng dụng ChatGPT trong tư duy thiết kế (design thinking)
courses.bio: Mọi thách thức đều có lời giải khi chúng ta đặt mình vào vị trí của người khác.
objectives: Hiểu rõ và vận dụng hiệu quả quy trình Design Thinking để giải quyết vấn đề thực tế một cách sáng tạo.
Phát triển khả năng thấu cảm sâu sắc với người dùng, từ đó tạo ra những giải pháp đáp ứng đúng nhu cầu thực sự.
Thành thạo sử dụng Custom GPT để nhanh chóng hiểu rõ người dùng, mô phỏng ý tưởng và thử nghiệm giải pháp hiệu quả.
Tự tin triển khai các giải pháp sáng tạo và thực tiễn vào công việc và cuộc sống, tiết kiệm thời gian, chi phí.
Hình thành tư duy lấy người dùng làm trung tâm, tạo ra lợi thế cạnh tranh rõ rệt và nâng cao hiệu quả công việc.
Nắm rõ cách đánh giá và cải tiến liên tục các giải pháp, đảm bảo tính bền vững và hiệu quả cao trong dài hạn.
Gia tăng khả năng đổi mới sáng tạo, vượt qua rào cản tư duy truyền thống, sẵn sàng thích nghi với các thách thức mới trong tương lai.
Khóa học này sẽ là hành trình tuyệt vời giúp bạn giải quyết những thách thức phức tạp bằng tư duy sáng tạo và sức mạnh của AI!

Giới thiệu - Tầm quan trọng của tư du: Giới thiệu mục đích của khóa học
Tầm quan trọng của tư duy thiết kế
Các kiến thức nền tảng về tư duy t: Các kiến thức nền tảng về tư duy thiết kế
Hướng dẫn tương tác custom GPT để ứ: Hướng dẫn tương tác custom GPT để ứng dụng tư duy thiết kế
Tổng kết - Capstone project - kiểm tr: Đồ án cuối khóa - capstone project

requirements: Không cần kinh nghiệm.
courses.description:
Bạn đã từng đau đầu với những vấn đề phức tạp trong công việc hay cuộc sống nhưng không biết bắt đầu từ đâu?
Đã đến lúc bạn tiếp cận chúng bằng một cách hoàn toàn mới – thông qua góc nhìn đầy cảm xúc và sự sáng tạo của Design Thinking (Tư duy thiết kế), kết hợp với sức mạnh đột phá từ công nghệ trí tuệ nhân tạo ChatGPT.
Khóa học "Ứng dụng ChatGPT trong tư duy thiết kế (Design Thinking)" sẽ trang bị cho bạn kỹ năng đặt bản thân vào vị trí của người khác, hiểu sâu sắc vấn đề và tạo ra các giải pháp sáng tạo. Với sự hỗ trợ từ Custom GPT, bạn không chỉ học lý thuyết mà còn có thể nhanh chóng mô phỏng, thử nghiệm và tìm ra lời giải hiệu quả nhất cho những thách thức mà bạn đang đối mặt.
Sau khóa học này, bạn sẽ:
Hiểu rõ về quy trình Design Thinking và cách nó giúp giải quyết các vấn đề phức tạp.
Sử dụng thành thạo ChatGPT và các công cụ AI để nhanh chóng thấu hiểu người dùng.
Tự tin mô phỏng và kiểm thử các giải pháp trước khi triển khai thực tế.
Tiết kiệm thời gian và chi phí nhờ áp dụng quy trình nhanh gọn, hiệu quả.
“Mọi thách thức đều có lời giải khi chúng ta đặt mình vào vị trí của người khác.”
Khám phá ngay hôm nay!
Hành trình thay đổi góc nhìn – khi trí tuệ nhân tạo gặp Tư duy thiết kế
Trước đây, mỗi khi đối diện với một thử thách phức tạp, tôi thường xuyên rơi vào tình trạng mệt mỏi và loay hoay trong việc tìm giải pháp. Tôi nghĩ rằng một số vấn đề dường như không có lối thoát, cho đến khi tôi tham gia khóa học tuyệt vời này: "Ứng dụng ChatGPT trong tư duy thiết kế (Design Thinking)".
Điều làm tôi ấn tượng nhất ngay từ đầu khóa học chính là câu nói đầy cảm hứng:
"Mọi thách thức đều có lời giải khi chúng ta đặt mình vào vị trí của người khác."
Thật vậy, khóa học đã mở ra một thế giới hoàn toàn mới, nơi tôi được học cách thấu cảm sâu sắc với người dùng, thay đổi góc nhìn của mình và tiếp cận vấn đề bằng trái tim, chứ không chỉ bằng lý trí như trước đây. Chưa bao giờ tôi nghĩ rằng việc đặt mình vào vị trí của khách hàng hay đồng nghiệp lại mang đến những insight mạnh mẽ và rõ ràng đến thế.
Nhưng điều khiến tôi thật sự bất ngờ chính là sự kết hợp kỳ diệu giữa phương pháp Design Thinking và sức mạnh của ChatGPT. Thay vì mất hàng giờ để phân tích, tìm kiếm và phỏng đoán cảm xúc của người dùng, tôi được hướng dẫn sử dụng Custom GPT để nhanh chóng đóng vai khách hàng, hiểu sâu sắc các "nỗi đau" mà người dùng gặp phải. Custom GPT không chỉ giúp tôi thấu cảm một cách nhanh chóng, mà còn đưa ra các giải pháp mang tính thực tế cao và sẵn sàng để áp dụng ngay lập tức.
Tôi vẫn nhớ rõ một bài thực hành thú vị của khóa học: giải quyết vấn đề giảm khách hàng tại một quán cà phê địa phương. Chỉ trong vòng chưa đến 30 phút, nhờ quy trình rõ ràng, tôi đã có thể tạo ra một kế hoạch cải tiến trải nghiệm khách hàng vô cùng khả thi. Cảm giác khi có thể giải quyết vấn đề lớn một cách nhanh chóng và hiệu quả như vậy thật sự tuyệt vời!
Sau khóa học, tôi như được truyền cảm hứng để nhìn nhận mọi vấn đề theo một cách hoàn toàn khác. Tôi nhận ra rằng, những thách thức tưởng chừng không thể vượt qua trước đây, nay đều trở nên khả thi khi tôi thực sự đặt mình vào vị trí người khác và khai thác tốt sức mạnh từ trí tuệ nhân tạo.
Nếu bạn vẫn đang băn khoăn về khả năng giải quyết vấn đề của bản thân, tôi rất khuyến khích bạn trải nghiệm khóa học này. Bạn sẽ không chỉ nắm vững kỹ năng quan trọng của tương lai – Design Thinking và sử dụng ChatGPT hiệu quả – mà còn nhận ra rằng bạn luôn có thể trở thành người đưa ra giải pháp, thay vì đứng yên trước những khó khăn.
Hãy thử một lần đặt mình vào vị trí người khác, sử dụng công cụ mạnh mẽ của AI để nhìn vấn đề theo góc nhìn hoàn toàn mới. Tôi tin chắc rằng, giống như tôi, bạn sẽ hoàn toàn thay đổi suy nghĩ, tràn đầy cảm hứng, và sẵn sàng chinh phục mọi thử thách phía trước!
Đừng bỏ lỡ cơ hội tuyệt vời này – Hãy bắt đầu hành trình của bạn ngay hôm nay!
target_audience: Các nhà lãnh đạo, quản lý, CEO và cấp quản lý trung-cao cấp muốn xây dựng kỹ năng sáng tạo và đổi mới để giải quyết các vấn đề phức tạp.
Chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ và vừa (SME) đang tìm kiếm các giải pháp đổi mới thực tế và khả thi, nâng cao trải nghiệm khách hàng và năng lực cạnh tranh.
Chuyên viên phát triển sản phẩm, marketing, và bán hàng muốn hiểu sâu sắc nhu cầu khách hàng để tạo ra những sản phẩm/dịch vụ vượt trội.
Các nhà giáo dục và giảng viên muốn áp dụng tư duy sáng tạo vào giảng dạy, thiết kế bài giảng, và tạo ra các chương trình đào tạo hấp dẫn hơn.
Những cá nhân mong muốn cải thiện khả năng giải quyết vấn đề, tăng cường tư duy sáng tạo, và khai thác tốt sức mạnh trí tuệ nhân tạo để gia tăng hiệu suất làm việc.

courses.title: UX Design de A a Z: tudo sobre experiência do usuário
courses.bio: Crie um produto digital de ponta a ponta e receba dezenas de ferramentas, templates, cases e entrevistas exclusivas!
objectives: Projetar as melhores experiências em serviços e produtos digitais
Planejar um projeto de produto digital (app, site) de ponta a ponta
Aplicar mais de 60 ferramentas de design utilizadas em etapas de criação, organização e validação de projetos digitais
Desenvolver e monitorar produtos digitais com base em métricas e indicadores chave de performance (KPIs) para a área de UX Design
Criar wireframes baseados em técnicas e princípios mais utilizados em UX e como se comunicar com eles
Criar protótipos de todos os níveis: de baixa fidelidade até alta fidelidade navegáveis
Conhecer dezenas cases de empresas e exemplos de aplicação de ferramentas e técnicas em projetos de design
Aplicar na prática os conhecimentos adquiridos à medida que o curso vai avançando
Assistir entrevistas exclusivas com profissionais renomados na área de UX
requirements: Não há requisitos. Se você já atua na área de produto digital e/ou está migrando para a área de UX, este é um curso ideal para você.
courses.description:
QUER SABER TUDO SOBRE UX DESIGN E DESENVOLVER UM PROJETO DIGITAL DE PONTA A PONTA?
ENTÃO VOCÊ ESTÁ NO LUGAR CERTO!


POR QUE ESTE CURSO É COMPLETO?
Com o curso, você tem acesso a:
- Mais de 60 ferramentas de UX Design
- Dezenas de cases e exemplos práticos da área
- Acesso a diversas entrevistas exclusivas de profissionais UX do mundo inteiro
- Dezenas de recursos extras (templates, eBook e muito mais)
- E, ainda, praticar desenvolvendo um projeto digital de ponta a ponta


COMO VOCÊ IRÁ APRENDER?
As aulas estão divididas em seções que trazem exemplos práticos e sem enrolação! Aqui, você aprende por meio de aulas diretas e com o conteúdo atual de UX! Ao final de cada seção, você poderá colocar o conteúdo em prática através de tarefas optativas que iniciam no começo do curso e vão até o final das aulas!


QUAIS OS RECURSOS EXTRAS QUE O CURSO OFERECE?
- Links de vagas no mercado UX
- Os mais recentes artigos e livros da área
- Entrevistas exclusivas com profissionais da área
- Templates de todas as ferramentas apresentadas no curso
- eBook com conteúdo resumido


COMO UX DESIGN PODE AJUDAR NO DESENVOLVIMENTO DE PROJETOS DIGITAIS?
Projetar as melhores experiências em serviços e produtos digitais.
Desenvolver e monitorar produtos digitais com base em métricas e indicadores chave de performance (KPIs) para a área de UX Design.
Criar wireframes baseados em técnicas e princípios mais utilizados em UX e como se comunicar com eles.
Criar protótipos de todos os níveis: de baixa fidelidade até alta fidelidade navegáveis.
E muito mais!


QUEM SÃO OS PROFISSIONAIS QUE ESTÃO NO CURSO?

INSTRUTORAS
Bruna Ruschel (Doutora e Mestre em Design) e Chaiane Bitelo (Doutora e Mestre em Design).

PROFISSIONAIS CONVIDADOS
Ao se inscrever neste curso, você terá acesso a entrevistas exclusivas com profissionais renomados do mercado de UX Design. Conheça alguns deles:

Augusto Lohmann, do Viajar é Demais (Rio de Janeiro)
Bruno Rodrigues, autor do livro "Boas práticas de UX Writing"
Daniel Furtado, do canal Wezen e UXNOW (Campinas)
Deyse Daneze, da Talent Rocket (Berlim, Alemanha)
Diego Schmitt, das Lojas Renner (Porto Alegre)
Gabriela Pessoa, do Descomplica (Rio de Janeiro)
Guilhermo Reis, da Globocom (Rio de Janeiro)
Paola Sales, do Descomplica (Rio de Janeiro)
Patrícia Prado, da Ideativo Design (Florianópolis)
Taihana Araujo, da Camp Pacific (Vancouver, Canadá)
Ubiratan Silva, da Online UX Team (Florianópolis)

QUAL O CONTEÚDO RESUMIDO DO CURSO?

target_audience: Estudantes e entusiastas das áreas de design, comunicação digital, publicidade, jornalismo, jogos digitais, informática, ciência da computação e áreas afins
Designers, estudantes e profissionais de desenho industrial
Gerentes de projeto, líderes de projetos, P.O.s (product owners), desenvolvedores front-end e back-end, testadores, analistas de SEO, analistas de redes sociais
Empreendedores que buscam conhecimento para validar e melhorar seus negócios
Startupeiros e profissionais que fazem mentoria em incubadoras de negócios

courses.title: Design for Humanity: A New Perspective on User Experience
courses.bio: Design for inclusiveness by learning to challenge your vision, testing through stress cases, and analyzing real design
objectives: Understand the basic principles of user experience design
Challenge your own vision using new methodologies
Improve your ability to interview users
Stress test your work for potential flaws early

Challenge Your Vision: What Would a Human Do? Exercise

requirements: An interest in design is helpful, but no background in design is required.
No special materials or software are required to complete the practical exercises in this course.
courses.description:
Designing for humans is tough. We design for millions, but every interaction between our work and a user is personal, and we aren’t taught to take care with those interactions. I created this course because I want everything we design to meet the real needs and wants of real people.
This course draws from my recent book with Sara Wachter-Boettcher, Design for Real Life and is best for learners who are new to design or looking to strengthen their emerging user experience design skillset.  And since design is everywhere, a wide range of professionals will benefit from this course.
If you want a set of tools for stress-testing your work to make sure it’s as human-centered, compassionate, and inclusive as possible, this is the course for you.
By the end of the course, you will have gone through practical exercises around how to challenge your vision and design a compassionate user research process; seen how to improve interviews and talk to real people about their user experiences with your product; explored new ways to think outside as well as inside the box; and practiced ways to avoid the tunnel vision we all too often develop about our own work.
target_audience: This course is not only for designers; it is targeted at a wide range of professionals.
This course is designed for individuals who are new to design or looking to strengthen an emerging skillset.

courses.title: Experiencia de Cliente y Experiencia de Usuario ( CX / UX )
courses.bio: Cómo mejorar Webs, Apps, Software y E-commerces mediante la Experiencia de Usuario y la Experiencia de Cliente
objectives: Comprender qué es CX y UX, la importancia que tienen para los usuarios y como pueden ayudarnos a mejorar
Identificar los puntos a mejorar en una Tienda Online, App, Software,...
Comprender la importancia de analizar, evaluar, diseñar y gestionar nuestra web desde el punto de vista del usuario y para el usuario
Analizar y mejorar en materia de UX y CX una Web, Software, E-Commerce o App de forma profesional
Técnicas y herramientas de análisis y mejoras de CX/UX
Obtener los conocimientos necesarios de CX y UX para ejercer de Especialista
requirements: No es necesario un requisito especial, solo tener interés en UX Y CX, mejorar Webs, Tiendas Online, Software y Apps
courses.description:
Hoy en día, el mundo de Internet, Software, Apps, y venta Online es cada vez más duro y competitivo; los usuarios tienen muchas opciones donde elegir y cada vez son más exigentes; ya no solo buscan buenos precios, también quieren buen servicio, buena atención, confianza,... en resumen, quieren que su experiencia antes, durante y después de interactuar con la empresa sea lo mejor posible.
Para que nuestra Web, Tienda, Software, etc. sea efectiva, atraiga a los usuarios y destaque sobre las demás debemos ofrecer una excelente Experiencia de Usuario (UX) y/o Experiencia de Cliente (CX).
Tanto la CX como la UX son aspectos que cada vez cobran mayor importancia para los usuarios.
En el curso Experiencia de Cliente y Experiencia de Usuario ( CX / UX ) descubriremos la relevancia que tienen la CX y la UX en el éxito de nuestra herramienta.
Aprenderemos a mejorar Webs, Tiendas Online, Apps o Software para hacerlas más efectivas y atractivas para nuestros usuarios.
Dado que la UX es una de las partes que engloba la CX vamos a centrarnos en CX, siendo casi todos los puntos que veamos aplicables también a la UX
Aprenderemos a analizar una Tienda Online basándonos en el punto de vista del cliente; veremos cómo se tiene que diseñar, gestionar y dirigir una Tienda Online para cubrir todas las necesidades y expectativas de nuestros clientes, descubrir los puntos clave que podemos mejorar para que sus sentimientos, percepciones y experiencias sean positivas.
En definitiva:  aprenderemos a mejorar y optimizar nuestra herramienta ( Web, App, Software o E-Commerce ) a través tanto de la Experiencia de Cliente como de la Experiencia de Usuario.
target_audience: Cualquier persona interesada en la Experiencia de Usuario y la Experiencia de Cliente
Todos aquellos que quieran aprender a mejorar Webs, Apps,...

courses.title: Figma UI UX Design Advanced
courses.bio: Become a Figma Pro with our in-depth Advanced Figma tutorial course. Discover advanced design strategies & so much more!
objectives: Workflow techniques, managing design assets, styles, components, grid and column layouts like true virtuosos.
How to use Variables and put them to work creating even more complete prototypes.
Use variables to make Light & Dark Modes + Compact & Comfortable spacing versions of your components.
You’ll then take your new knowledge of variables to understand and create your own Design Tokens.
Unleashing the magic of advanced animation techniques, captivating users with animated background gradients and Houdini Text.
Harness the power of Lottie animation files, breathing life into your designs.
Crafting responsive elements that effortlessly adapt to any device, proving your design prowess knows no bounds.
Unleashing the full potential of powerful images & video masking techniques, amplifying the visual impact of your creations.
Mastering advanced typography features, transforming words into captivating works of art.
Embracing the realm of AI, infusing your process with its genius to elevate your skills as a UX designer.
Elevate your prototyping game, conducting user tests with finesse using advanced techniques.
Unveiling sticky scroll buttons that stack, animated anchor points and booleans, and a host of other captivating effects.
Creating enchanting dropdown menus, hover grow effects for images, and expanding search bars.
Discovering the right accessibility tools & techniques, ensuring inclusivity and usability for all users.
Becoming a variant boss, expertly taming unwieldy variants to just 1 or 2.
Unveiling the secrets of seamless collaboration with designers, developers, and stakeholders.
Mastering the art of exporting production-ready assets, bringing your designs to life beyond the realm of Figma.
Unearthing professional workflow tricks & shortcuts, saving you precious time and skyrocketing your efficiency.
Plus much more exciting advanced Figma goodness along the way!
requirements: A copy of Figma (a free plan is available on the Figma website).
Basic knowledge of Figma is required. I recommend watching my Figma Essentials course prior to embarking on this epic adventure.
courses.description:
Hi there, aspiring Figma enthusiasts! Are you ready to embark on an exhilarating journey with me, Dan Scott, as we unlock the full potential of our Figma skills in the dazzling realm of UX/UI Design using Figma Advanced?
This course is tailor-made for those who have already mastered the fundamental principles of UI/UX Design using Figma. If you've triumphed over my Figma Essentials course or have a sneaking suspicion that there's a treasure trove of unexplored tools, tips, workflows, and updates awaiting your discovery, then look no further! This course is your golden ticket to taking your UI/UX prowess to the next level.
Together, we'll start by delving into the depths of multilevel nested autolayouts, and unravel the secrets used by UX professionals by learning:
Workflow techniques, managing design assets, styles, components, grid and column layouts like true virtuosos.
Learn how to use Variables and put them to work creating even more complete prototypes.
Use variables to make Light & Dark Modes + Compact & Comfortable spacing versions of your components.
You’ll then take your new knowledge of variables to understand and create your own Design Tokens.
Unleashing the magic of advanced animation techniques, captivating users with animated background gradients and Houdini Text.
Harness the power of Lottie animation files, breathing life into your designs.
Crafting responsive elements that effortlessly adapt to any device, proving your design prowess knows no bounds.
Unleashing the full potential of powerful images & video masking techniques, amplifying the visual impact of your creations.
Mastering advanced typography features, transforming words into captivating works of art.
Embracing the realm of AI, infusing your process with its genius to elevate your skills as a UX designer.
Elevate your prototyping game, conducting user tests with finesse using advanced techniques.
Unveiling sticky scroll buttons that stack, animated anchor points and booleans, and a host of other captivating effects.
Creating enchanting dropdown menus, hover grow effects for images, and expanding search bars.
Discovering the right accessibility tools & techniques, ensuring inclusivity and usability for all users.
Becoming a variant boss, expertly taming unwieldy variants to just 1 or 2.
Unveiling the secrets of seamless collaboration with designers, developers, and stakeholders.
Mastering the art of exporting production-ready assets, bringing your designs to life beyond the realm of Figma.
Unearthing professional workflow tricks & shortcuts, saving you precious time and skyrocketing your efficiency.
Plus much more exciting advanced Figma goodness along the way!
As you journey through this course, you'll acquire the skills wielded by UX professionals, gaining a profound understanding of the UX Design industry. From concept to a highly polished finish, you'll confidently manage your own UX projects ideal for your portfolio.
Throughout the course, I'll assign assignments and projects that nurture your skills and empower you to create your very own unique UX design masterpiece for your portfolio. Don’t worry if this all seems overwhelmingly advanced right now, because the BYOL crew stands ready to support and guide you, ensuring your questions get answered.
It's time to embrace the call to upgrade yourself and transcend from being a good UX Designer to a bona fide Figma UX Superhero! Unlock your potential, save the day, and let your design prowess soar!
Requirements
A copy of Figma (a free plan is available on the Figma website).
Basic knowledge of Figma is required. I recommend watching my Figma Essentials course prior to embarking on this epic adventure.
Who this course is for:
UX/UI adventurers who already have a basic understanding of Figma..
Self-taught Figma enthusiasts yearning for structured guidance.
Graduates of my Figma Essentials Course, hungry for more knowledge and skills.
Visionaries who have developed their own unique Figma approach but crave exploration of the vast universe of tools, updates, and time-saving techniques.

Adding interaction: Understanding trigger event case and action

courses.description:
Start learning prototyping with 10 hours online, video training of Axure RP 9 course.
Fundamental part is common for the creation of a website or mobile prototype.
Advance section is to learn mobile interaction in detail
All the interaction that has created in this course works in both Android or iOS mobile device. Therefore, no matter what device type you have, you can keep on applying knowledge that you learn as you master the course today. The course have used Android mobile device for demonstration purpose.


In this course you will get practical experience in -
Learning Axure RP 9 new interface and its practical usage.
Getting hands on guides, grids, snapping and managing pages.
Exploring widgets, shapes, using of images and styling
Working with dynamic panel, master and repeaters as you advance the course.
Taking control of your project.
Creating interaction using Math, Functions, Expression and Variables.
Drag and drop.
Contact form for mobile device.
Customizing sample UI patterns.
Managing multiple screen size for different mobile device using "Adaptive view".
This course will teach you everything you need to know to start prototyping. Because, prototyping will help you to  see if the solutions and decisions made about the product are efficient or not.
Axure RP 9 is the tool for creating wireframes that to quickly, easily and efficiently with completely new interface for your organization. Taking early feedback in design, so that you don't need to run at the end. Showcase your client how their design transform as the project go ahead.
Why Axure RP 9 ?
Whether you’re creating diagrams, customer journeys, or wireframes, Axure RP helps you understand the issues and get everyone on the same page.
Create prototypes to test a design and validate it with others, is invaluable for making better design decisions.
Quickly make rich, functional prototypes to make informed choices even on your most urgent projects.
Sharing your prototype to your anyone with just click's of buttons.
Bridge the gap with development.
Streamline your product design workflow with Axure Cloud.
target_audience: UX Professional who want to take their skills to next level in prototyping
An organization who want to make the UX team member more efficient in prototyping
Individual who want to learn prototyping or make a step ahead towards UX career
Individual who want to move from Axure RP 8 to Axure RP 9

courses.title: User experience research: How to ask the right questions?
courses.bio: Deep Dive user understanding & customer centricity for UX Researchers | UX Designers | Product managers
objectives: Learn how to ask the right questions in qualitative interviews with users and customers.
Successfully run a qualitative research process from the beginning to the end.
Work with a fictional research case to apply your skills in exercises
Learn about the sequence any research process needs to follow in order to be successful
Understand how to successfully pitch your research project and persuade potential naysayers
Build up knowledge on the three basic types of qualitative research approaches.
Learn how to spell out your business and research objectives to make sure you are always on the right track with your research and don’t get lost
Achieve clarity about the number of interviews you need to conduct for reliable results and to whom one should speak
Master the task of crafting the tailormade guideline you need for your interviews by following the steps given in the course.
Raise the feeling of security in the actual interview situation with the numerous tips & tricks given
Gain knowledge on how to proceed with the analysis of your interview including vivid examples

Theory and background: Importance of research for the success of your business
Preparation of research: Exercise: from business to research objectives
Recap exercise from business to research objectives
Recap exercise setting up a research plan
Setting up the guideline for the interview | step 1
Recap exercise 1st step to an interview guideline
Setting up the guideline for the interview | step 2
Recap exercise 2nd step to an interview guideline
The actual interview situation: How to ask the right questions?
The analysis: How to proceed in an analysis

requirements: Interest in how to craft five-star-research
You just need to have a curious mindset and be passionate about user and customer centricity
You don't need to know anything about research, this introduction will provide you with the information you need to get started
courses.description:
No matter whether you are new to the research scene or already have some experience, this course will help you excel in future research challenges and bring your project, product and start-up to a success.
Regardless which approach to innovation you or your company adopted, all approaches are based on the deep understanding of the wishes, needs and desires of the user. Entering a dialog with your present and future consumers is essential for any development or relaunch of products, applications and services. Consumer centricity is crucial for an economic deployment of your resources.
During this course, you will learn how to become an ‘insight gold miner’ via qualitative interviews and unveil hidden truths. With accurate preparation and execution of user interviews, your research challenge will become a success.
Crafting the right questions for your interview is always a tailormade task. This course helps you to reach the goal of asking the right questions by helping you prepare properly.
The course is practice oriented. To increase the learning impact, the sessions include exercises as well as theoretical background.


The course takes you through the following topics:
Importance of research for the success of your business
Short introduction to qualitative methods
Mindset, researcher and research team
Business vs. research objectives
Setting up a research plan (To how many people should one speak and how to define it?)
Preparing the guideline for the interviews
The actual interview situation with what to look out for
5 golden tips on how to ask the right questions
What is an analysis?
How to proceed in an analysis?
NOTE: this course focusses on qualitative research (e.g. interviews, in-depths), not on quantitative research (e.g. surveys)!
target_audience: Design Thinkers, Service Designers, UX Designers or Product managers who do have a research challenge coming up and want to bring it to a success
People who want to make sure that their product developments and (re-) launches are a success by hitting the heart of users’ / customers’ needs, wishes and desires.
Everyone who wants to dive deeply into customer understanding and customer centricity
Everyone who feels that human-centered approaches for solving problems is the only way to go
Everyone who wants to understand how to set-up and conduct face-to-face interviews

courses.title: Intro to Product Design for Drones
courses.bio: Learn UI/UX for the Drone Industry
objectives: Learn UI/ UX Design for the Drone industry
Breakdown of different drones, their design, and functions.
Foundation in common UI elements in drone interfaces
Foundation in common UX patterns in drone products
Overview of control systems and common terminology.
A strong foundation understanding the drone industry
Foundational understanding of the FAA regulatory environment
Learn how to design for autonomous products that face public acceptance and criticism.
Overview of the Part 107 License
Learn how to work with Hardware Departments
requirements: No prior experience required, however you will get the most out of the course with some visual design and research understanding.
courses.description:
This course is geared towards anyone interested in learning how to work as a UI/UX/ Product Designer in the drone industry. Transitioning into a new industry can be stressful, the goal of this course is to support designers interested in working in the drone industry- whether you know where to start or not. This e-course covers everything you need to know to feel confident in creating portfolio pieces and applying for jobs at drone companies.
What You'll Learn
A strong foundation understanding the drone industry.
Breakdown of different types of drones, how they are controlled, and common terminology.
UI standards for drone operations.
UX standards for drone use cases.
Overview of the FAA’s Part 107 License.
Learn how to design for autonomous products that face public acceptance and criticism.
I transitioned from being a developer for 8+ years in the video game industry to working in UI/UX Design for drone products. My hope for this e-course is to support other designers who are interested in working the drone industry and make transitioning smoother for you.
I've shipped both numerous software applications and hardware products for drones for a myriad of customers - from professional photographers and athletes to defense and public safety agencies. Over the years I've spoken on Game UX for VR, Product Design for Drones, responsible design for emerging technologies, and social impact at GDC, AUVSI Xponential, AIAA SciTech, NASAO, and the Lesbians Who Tech & Allies Summit.
I hope you enjoy the course and please do not hesitate to reach out to me with questions!
Lastly, this course does not cover the basics of mobile/web visual design nor how to conduct research- that would need to be a separate course.
- Mira Marquez
target_audience: Designers of any level who are interested in learning how to be a Product Designer in the drone industry.

courses.title: Autolayout en Figma
courses.bio: Domina Auto Layout en Figma y crea diseños que se adaptan a cualquier pantalla.
objectives: Comprender Propiedades Fundamentales de Auto Layout: Aprender orientación, posicionamiento y padding para diseñar de manera eficaz en Figma.
Distinguir Grupo y Auto Layout: Entender la diferencia entre ambos para crear diseños adaptables y responsivos.
Explorar Versatilidad de Auto Layout: Utilizarlo en distintos dispositivos y tamaños de pantalla para mejorar la experiencia del usuario.
Practicar Creación de Componentes: Dominar la creación de botones, breadcrumbs, search bars, etc., para aplicarlo en proyectos reales.

Explorando Auto Layout en Figma: Fundame: Definición de Auto Layout y analogía en la vida real.
Cómo crear un botón en Figma utilizando Auto Layout y evitando errores comunes
Explorando los Paneles de Figma: Orientación, Posicionamiento y Padding
Diferencias y Aplicaciones: Auto Layout vs. Grupos y Diseño Responsivo
Propiedades avanzadas de Auto Layout y p: Desafío Final: Creación de Footer adaptativo (responsive)

requirements: Los requisitos previos para el curso son: conocimientos básicos de Figma y familiaridad con principios de diseño UX/UI.
courses.description:
¿Por qué surge este curso?
Este curso responde a una demanda identificada en profesionales del diseño y la tecnología que carecen de habilidades en Auto Layout o tienen un conocimiento básico que les frustra al utilizarlo incorrectamente.
Perfiles como UX Writing o UX Research están familiarizados con Figma, pero no con esta función en particular. Aprender Auto Layout les permitirá integrarse mejor en flujos de trabajo con diseñadores UX/UI que ya utilizan esta funcionalidad. El uso de Auto Layout permite la creación de diseños adaptables, donde el contenido puede variar en longitud o complejidad sin comprometer la integridad del diseño. Comprender cómo funciona Auto Layout y sus ventajas impulsará el crecimiento profesional del alumno y aumentará su confianza en la herramienta Figma.
Contribuir al aprendizaje de Figma y sus funciones principales puede ser fundamental para ayudar a las personas a conseguir un nuevo empleo y/o avanzar en su carrera profesional.
Se proporcionarán consejos y buenas prácticas para optimizar el flujo de trabajo y mejorar la eficiencia en el uso de Auto Layout . El enfoque práctico y orientado a resultados del curso asegura que los estudiantes no solo adquieran conocimientos teóricos, sino que también desarrollen habilidades prácticas que puedan aplicar de inmediato en sus proyectos profesionales.
¿Qué no incluye este curso?
Este curso se enfoca exclusivamente en Auto Layout y no incluye temas como la creación de componentes, UI Kits o sistemas de diseño.
target_audience: UX/ UI designers
UX Writers / Contenidistas
UX Researchers
Desarrolladores
Product designers
Estudiantes de diseño
Diseñadores gráficos

courses.title: 什么是产品的商业化设计

了解狭义的商业化设计流程

courses.description:
“商业化”这个词在工作中多多少少都会接触到，那么到底什么是商业化？商业化对公司有什么意义？又应当如何着手为产品设计商业化的机制或运转流程呢。三节课邀请到具有6年+商业化运营经验的四把剪刀老师，为大家呈现这门有关商业化设计的小课，学完这门课，相信你能更加胜任商业化的产品或者运营的工作。
本节课程是由授课老师与三节课合作制作的。在此，要特别感谢老师的辛苦付出！经历了课程立项、设计、开发中的众多环节，我们才能最终为你呈现现在的这门课程。无论是授课老师还是三节课团队，都希望这门课程能够让你有所收获，希望同学们结合个人工作情况，学以致用。

courses.title: Adobe XD - UX UI design For beginners
courses.bio: Adobe XD - UX UI Basics
objectives: How to start with Adobe XD
How to become a UI & UX Designer
How to draw
How to choose the appropriate format
How to use your ideas
How to make an application everything from your pure design

Introduction: lesson 1 - Your first design in Adobe XD
Lesson 3 - Design second page for your app or design
Lesson 5 - Designing buttons and icons for third page
Lesson 6 - Using Prototype and testing the design
Extra Section, how to draw in Adobe XD 2: How to draw in Adobe XD 2022

requirements: It does NOT require experience
courses.description:
Hi there, I am Zakariya Zaki,
In this course, you will learn  how to use Adobe Xd, and the Basics of UX and UI.
Also will learn together drawing skills, and how to choose the right things.

You can download the project file before start !!


About Adobe XD, is the Adobe prototyping tool for user experience and interaction designers. Adobe XD features are used for creating wireframes, prototypes, and screen designs for digital products such as websites and mobile apps.


Web designs come in all shapes and sizes, from multi-paned web apps, to spacious mobile-first websites, and fixed-width to full-width. ... Thankfully with features like Content Aware Layout, and Responsive Resize, Adobe XD can help you craft, and explore, the layout that is right for you.
So if you're a Windows user and want to create UI's, XD would be a fine fit. If you're a Adobe Cloud subscriber and thinking of adding UI to your skill set, XD can take your fairly far.

Adobe XD is a good choice for creating websites and app mockups. Improvements to its responsive design capabilities make it a good choice for modern web and app development. ... Developers will need to code the design functions manually, although they can get sizes, colors, and other specs from the shared files.


Let's Start..
target_audience: UX and UI designer
For those with a passion to work in the field of web design and applications
For anyone interested in finding a job as a UI and UX designer with a high salary

courses.title: Figma ile Sıfırdan Responsive Tasarım Eğitimi
courses.bio: Figma'da Masaüstü, tablet ve mobil cihazlara uygun tasarım yapmayı tüm detaylarıyla öğrenin!
objectives: Figma ile tüm ekran çözünürlüklerine uygun tasarım oluşturma
Responsive grid yapısı oluşturma
Masaüstü, tablet ve mobile cihazlara uygun tasarımlar oluşturma
Responsive tasarımda design system öğelerinin kullanımı

Giriş: Responsive Tasarımın Önemi ve Avantajları Nelerdir?
Sıfırdan Responsive Web Sitesi Tasarımı: İletişim Formu ve Sıkça Sorulan Sorular Modülünün Tamamlanması

requirements: Temel Figma bilgisine sahip olmak
courses.description:
Merhaba sevgili tasarım sever arkadaşlar,
Eğitim setinin ilk bölümünde responsive tasarım ilkeleri, constraints, auto layout ve grid yapısı gibi temel bilgilere sahip olacağız. Böylece ölçeklenebilir (esnek) bir tasarımın nasıl oluşturulacağına dair temel bilgiyi edineceğiz. Ayrıca bu özellikleri oluştururken dikkat etmemiz gereken önemli ipuçlarını da keşfedeceğiz. Tasarım sürecinde elde ettiğiniz verilerinizi farklı boyutlardaki cihazlarda kullanıcıya sunabilirsiniz.
Grid sistem kullanarak mobil, tablet ve masaüstü versiyonlar olmak üzere dijital ortamda Figma ile one page bir web siteyi  responsive olarak tamamlayacağız.
* Bu işlemleri tamamlarken önceden hazırladığımız ui elemanlarını kullanacağız. İlerleyen aşamalarda componentlerimizi ve bazı diğer ui elemanlarımızı birlikte oluşturuyor olacağız.
Kursu belirtilen ders sırasına göre izlemeniz faydalı olacaktır.
Herhangi bir sorunuz olduğunda soru cevap kısmından veya özel durumlar için mesaj atarak benden cevap alabileceksiniz. Temel düzeyde Figma bilgisi bu eğitimi almanın ön şartlarından birisidir.


GENEL İÇERİK
Responsive design nedir?
- Responsive tasarıma giriş
- Google Chrome üzerinde responsive bir sayfanın farklı çözünürlüklerde incelenmesi
Responsive Tasarımın Önemi ve Avantajları Nelerdir?
- Responsive tasarımın sağladığı faydalar
- Responsive olmayan tasarımlarda karşılaşılan zorluklar
Detaylı Constraints Kullanımı
- Uygulama üzerinde constraints (kısıtlamaların) kullanımı
- Scale ve Left and Right arasındaki farklar
- Horizontal and Vertical constraints
Tüm detaylarıyla Auto Layout
- Auto Layout ve Flexbox yapısının kullanımı
- Fill Container - Hug Content
- Fixed width, Fixed Height
- Absolute Position kullanımı
- Responsive UI Card Yapımı
Responsive Layout Grid Kullanımı
- Fixed ve Fluid Yapının Kullanımı
- Masaüstü, Tablet ve Mobile için grid yapısı
- Container kullanımı
- Gutter, stretch ve side margin kullanımı
Layout Grid Offset Kullanımı
- Grid yapısında offset kullanımı
- Verilen offset değerine göre matematiksel olarak grid genişliğinin hesaplanması
4'lü ve 8'li Boşluk Sistemlerinin Kullanımı
- 4'lü ve 8'li boşlukların örnek üzerinde uygulanması
- Hard ve Soft Spacing nedir?
Responsive Text Kullanımı
- Başlık etiketlerinin tanımlanması
- Font size değerlerinin farklı cihazlar için belirlenmesi
- EM kullanımı
- Tipofrafik öğelerin design system için eklenmesi
Responsify Eklentisinin Kullanımı
Figma'da Responsify eklentisinin kullanımı
Sıfırdan Responsive Web Tasarım Projesine Giriş
- Projeye giriş
- Design system öğelerinin incelenmesi
Design System Öğelerini Tanımlama
- Grid Yapısı

本节课程，将首先与你分享什么是互联网思维，让你了解互联网思维大框架，并进一步对用户思维展开讲解，从“用户”这个基础概念讲起，帮你逐步建立起互联网用户思维。

courses.description:
Learn the popular UI/UX and Web Design Tool Figma!
Do you want to learn the popular Design Tool Figma? Then you're at the right place.
In this Course I'm going to teach you all the Fundamentals you need to start working on your very own Design Projects in Figma.
This is what we will cover!
You're going to learn everything piece by piece. Starting with the creation of simple Shapes, we quickly move on to more complex topics such as the usage of the Pen Tool.
We're going to be working extensively with Colors and all sorts of Gradients. You will also learn how to make changes quickly by uisng Global Color Styles.
You will learn how to work with Text and the different Alignment Options.
Later on, we'll be working with Images and Masks as well.
Of course we will also take a look at creating interactive prototypes of our designs.
The Course for complete Beginners
This Course was made for complete beginners in mind, so there is no prior knowledge required!
While watching the individual Lessons you will be working alongside me using the Excercise Files provided to you.
All you need to get started is a PC or MAC and a working internet connection.

requirements: None
courses.description:
Do you want to easily design accessible interfaces for digital products?
But maybe you’ve been overwhelmed by the amount of information out there about accessibility, or don’t know where to start for just the design side of things?
As a seasoned User Experience (UX) designer, experienced with Accessibility, I'm here to solve these issues for you! (Also, if you need to learn about WCAG 2.1 / 2.2 or your country's legal requirements this course has you covered! E.g. the U.S.'s Section 508 and Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), India's Guidelines for Indian Government Websites (GIGW) and Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act (RPwD Act), the European Union's Web Accessibility Directive (EN 301 549) Web Accessibility Directive (2016/2102) and European Accessibility Act (2019/882), the United Kingdom's Equality Act (2010), or any others that are based on/reference the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines)


The Problem:
One of the big problems UX and Product Designers have is that, if we want to design accessible digital products, we have to dig through a HUGE stack of accessibility guidelines, and they tell us things like:
For accessibility compliance, “a mechanism is available to allow the purpose of each link to be identified from link text alone, except where the purpose of the link would be ambiguous to users in general.”
Or “Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.”
Does that give you clarity on how to specifically design an accessible interface and still look aesthetic? Not so much!


The Solution:
The solution, taught in this course, is a set of 51 essential best practices for designing accessible interfaces. And they are just the aspects of accessibility that apply to a designer’s job, which as a designer you are responsible for and have control over; we won’t get into the code.
This course is based on the latest WCAG 2.1 and 2.2 Guidelines, so you’re getting the freshest information. Whenever new guidelines are released this course is promptly updated.


10 things you will get out of this course:
Whether you design digital products yourself, or you oversee their design, with these best practices added to your toolbelt:
You will have a superior design process that enables you to design more accessible (and user-friendly) interfaces from the start.
You will be able to identify accessibility violations just by looking at an interface design!
You will stand out as an impressive, top-tier designer to your boss and clients (since few designers are well-versed in accessible design and accessibility for UX).
You will be loved by your developers for sending them mockups they don’t have to make accessibility changes to.
Your team will save time, and your client will save money, because there will be fewer changes needed at the end to meet accessibility compliance.
Your team and the client will be more safeguarded from lawsuits if and when your team has made a fully accessible digital product (because some groups can be sued for discrimination if their digital products do not meet accessibility and WCAG compliance).
You will receive an Accessibility certification. It certifies your completion of this training. Post your certification to your LinkedIn, list it on your resume or website, hang it next to your desk, and bask in your well-earned professional bragging rights!
You will be able to speak about Design Accessibility with confidence.
You will be prepared for any job that requires knowledge of designing for Accessibility.
You will be able to add this to your CV (put it under Professional Development as Accessibility for UX Designers, Udemy, and the year of completion). This will help you land a job!
This course is perfect for beginners!
Before starting, you don’t need any foreknowledge of accessibility (or WCAG, ADA, or usability).


If you've made up your mind about taking this course, just click the "Buy this course" button at the top. If not, keep reading :)




By the end of this course you will know:
The 51 best practices that fall within the TOP 3 areas of accessibility.
The first area is about color contrast, where you will learn 4 powerful best practices, including things like:
Do disabled elements need to have a certain level of color contrast (for accessibility compliance)?
How about button borders, logos, or UI controls (like toggle switches, checkboxes, and pagination)?
The second area is color independence which holds 10 best practices. Like:
How to design the display of error messages.
How to make color-coded data visualizations (like charts and graphs) accessible for people who can't see color, or tell the difference between certain colors.
And the third area is all about interactive elements. You’ll learn 37 awesome best practices, along with things like:
Why using links that say “read more” or “details” are a big mistake for accessibility, usability, and SEO; and what wording to use instead.
What’s the best shape for buttons, the optimal corner radius, and whether or not you should use shadows.
How the word “affordances” refers to the visual cues that indicate how to use physical objects, not digital ones. I’ll teach you the term you should be using instead.
Opportunities to apply what you're learning:
There will be activities, quizzes for you to test your own knowledge, downloadable resources, AND you will have me to answer any accessibility or usability questions you have along the way.


What's different about this course:
This course is a compilation of concrete how-tos that you simply will not find in other online accessibility courses. I made the course I wish I had when I was first learning how to design for accessibility (and comply with WCAG, ADA, and Section 508).
It’s highly practical. I’m going to SHOW you exactly how to design for accessibility. With specific UI designs, that come from real-world situations. Not a bunch of theory, or high-level generalizations like “To achieve accessible designs make them: poignant, precise, and simple. Now go forth and good luck!” None of that.
The use cases are from my many years of doing UX design in the world of corporations, governments, small businesses, and nonprofits. And designing Section 508 compliant web applications and websites.
The best practices are backed by expert sources. The design advice has been heavily-researched for accuracy and peer-reviewed by seasoned accessibility specialists.
A lot of work has gone into this course, it was over 10 months in the making (and counting, as enhancements are continually being added), and it’s all because I want you to get the maximum out of it. You’ll be paying hard-earned money for this accessibility course so I want to give you more not less.


Who this course is for:
This course is for people who are responsible for the design of digital interfaces, who want to make them more accessible and user-friendly (and still aesthetic), but struggle with knowing exactly what to do to make their UI designs accessible.


Money-Back Guarantee:
This course comes with a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you are unsatisfied for any reason, you can get your money back, no questions asked.


I invite you to watch some of the free preview videos.
And if you are ready, I'm going to teach you THE 51 essential best practices you need to know to design accessible interfaces!


If you've made a decision about taking this course, just click the "Buy this course" button at the top. If not, keep reading :)




DEFINITIONS -
What is Accessibility / Digital Accessibility / Web Accessibility?
Accessibility is usability for all.
“Web accessibility means that people with disabilities can equally perceive, understand, navigate, and interact with websites and tools. It also means that they can contribute equally without barriers.” – Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI). Simply put, digital accessibility is when a digital product* is designed to be usable for as many different people as possible, with a focus on those with disabilities.
*And for context, when I say “digital product”, that’s the umbrella term for: websites, mobile apps, web/desktop applications, software, wearable interfaces (like smart watches), Extended Reality experiences (like Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality), voice experiences, touchless experiences, and many others.
When I say “accessibility” -
I’m talking about inclusive design.
I’m talking about learning which design practices could inadvertently lead to discrimination, so we can avoid them.
I’m talking about designing our interfaces in a way that makes them user-friendly for people with disabilities.
Whether those are permanent disabilities, like being born with a vision impairment,
or temporary disabilities, like temporarily having to make do with a glasses prescription that’s slightly off,
or situational disabilities, like being in bright sunlight and not being able to see your screen very well.
As designers, it’s up to us, not the programmers, not our manager, not our clients, but us to design interfaces that can accommodate as many people as possible, of all abilities and disabilities. Accessibility is essential for some, but useful for all.
What is Usability?
When I say “usability”, which is part of UX (User Experience), I'm talking about designing a digital product to be user-friendly. Meaning, intuitive, efficient, delightful, easy to understand, and free of frustrations!
And of course, aesthetic and modern looking! Because an aesthetic, well-laid out, and cohesively branded interface also plays a big role in improving not only usability but also accessibility!
One thing to note here, “Accessibility will not force you to make a product that is ugly, boring, or cluttered. It will give you design constraints that will lead to better products for all of your users.” - Jesse Hausler, Principal Accessibility Specialist at Salesforce
Talking about both accessibility and usability: Usability on its own “often does not sufficiently address the needs of people with disabilities.” – WAI
That’s why we have to focus on it specifically and design for accessibility, not just usability.
Who is the Instructor?
My name is Liz Brown and as a User Experience Designer, I improve the usability, accessibility, and overall glamour of websites, apps, and software. And I do this for a living. My job is to make outdated, ugly, accessibility and usability messes into seamlessly flowing, inclusively-designed, user-friendly beauties.
During my many years of designing digital products for the U.S. government and various official agencies, I was also responsible for designing interfaces that were not just “accessible” but Section 508 compliant. (Section 508 is the part of the U.S. law that legally mandates certain digital products be accessible.)
My team and I worked agile and lean, both of which are ways of working that require the team to be able to move quickly and flexibly. And in those types of fast-paced work environments, there is no time to go back and fix a ton of things.
Accessibility had to become an integrated part of my full-stack design process, not something I left for the end.
I learned how to efficiently bake-in accessibility from the very beginning and all the way through.
And with that, I will teach you how to seamlessly make accessibility part of your design process as well!
From the big company names of today to the household names of tomorrow, they all need successful digital tools that are designed inclusively for people of all abilities, and that's what I offer them, inclusive design as part of a quality UX design process.
I’ve designed countless interfaces for:
Giant agencies like the US Department of Defense, the Centers for Disease Control, and secret groups I wasn’t allowed to know the name of.
Medics needing to be out in the field during war with highly-mobile tech.
Digital tools for The Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard.
As well as private-sector products for small businesses, nonprofits, and entrepreneurs.
Some companies take accessibility seriously, and devote the time and resources to make it happen, and other companies don’t.
We see so many businesses and organizations with websites, apps, or software that unknowingly discriminate against people with disabilities.
This could be because:
these companies are oblivious to what accessible design is, or
because at some point someone told them they should make the investment to improve the accessibility (and usability) of their digital product, but they decided not to do it.
No matter the circumstances, what makes some designers able to bring accessibility to their client’s projects or their own companies, and other designers not able to?
I’ll tell you, one huge difference: having an Accessible UX Design process.
This means the designer knows exactly what to do and when during their default UX design process to make interfaces accessible as they’re designing them.
And that is the kind of designer YOU are going to be after completing this course.
Accessibility won’t be seen as an a la carte option, instead it will be seamlessly integrated into your regular UX process.
target_audience: UX Designers, Product Designers, UI Designers
Aspiring Designers
UX/Product Team Managers
Developers who design

requirements: You should have basic knowledge of UX Writing because in this course, you will not learn about UX Writing as a skill but only about how to use this skill as a freelancer.
courses.description:
UX Writing is one of the top disciplines of the century – no tech company, big or small, can go without UX Writing. While many companies start staffing their teams with UX Writers, others prefer working with freelance UX Writers, which is an exciting opportunity for many UX Writers.


But how can UX Writing freelancers make sure that they're both successful and happy?


After all, freelancing in UX Writing is an attractive option for many UX Writers, but: there are various pitfalls throughout the freelance process that UX Writers can and should avoided in order to make the most out of this exciting career step.


Who should join
This course is the perfect match for UX Writers who think about working as a freelancer, but also for product managers, project managers, and HR managers who want to hire a freelance UX Writer.


What you will learn
In this course, you will learn
how a freelance UX Writer works
about the upsides and downsides of freelancing in UX Writing
how to land a gig as a UX Writing freelancer
how to start and complete a client project in UX Writing freelancing
which skills a freelance UX Writer needs


Sounds good? Then join me in this class and start your career as a freelancer in UX Writing!


If you want to take all of my UX Writing courses, here is the order recommend:
1 Introduction To UX Writing
2 Transitioning To UX Writing
3 Accessible UX Writing
4 UX Writing: Finding Your Voice and Tone
5 UX Writing in Practice: Documentation & Processes
6 User Research And Testing For UX Writing
7 Inclusive UX Writing: Physical Abilities & Neurodivergence
8 Inclusive UX Writing: Gender, Race & Age
9 Culture-Based UX Writing
10 Localization in UX Writing
11 Fighting „Dark“ UX Writing: How To Write Kind UX Copy
12 Building Your UX Writing Portfolio
13 Freelancing in UX Writing


Please note that all courses stand for themselves and that you don't need to take any course as a prerequisite for taking another one. You don’t have to follow this order. This is only my very own suggestion, which is especially helpful when you need guidance on which course to pick next.
target_audience: UX Writers
Everybody who wants to transition into UX Writing and isn't sure about whether to work as a full-time employee or a freelancer
Freelance copywriters and writers of other disciplines who would like to transition into UX Writing
Project managers and product manager who want to work with a UX Writer
Everybody who is interested in this topic!

courses.description:
Penting bagi perusahaan untuk mengetahui apa yang dibutuhkan customer agar dapat memberikan inovasi layanan ataupun produk sesuai. Tentunya, data ini tidak didapatkan begitu saja. Perusahaan butuh riset untuk mengetahui dan mengkompilasi informasi tersebut agar bisa dijadikan acuan dalam menjalankan bisnis.


Dalam dunia bisnis, ini dikenal dengan istilah UX research atau user experience research. Riset yang dilakukan oleh UX researcher akan sangat membantu perusahaan untuk meningkatkan kepuasan pengguna.


Di kelas ini kamu akan mengenal apa UX research lengkap dengan dasar-dasar yang harus kamu ketahui sebelum mendalami karier menjadi UX researcher.
Pembelajar di kelas ini meliputi:
Sejarah dan perkembangan UX research
Konsep dasar UX research
Flow bekerja sebagai UX researcher
Tahapan pekerjaan UX researcher (mulai dari research brief, perencanaan, pelaksanaan, analisa data, hingga membuat laporan project)
Membangun portofolio UX research


Kamu akan mendapatkan pembelajaran awal yang komprehensif mengenai UX research didampingi mentor ahli di kelas ini. Setelah menyelesaikan semua modul di kelas ini, kamu pastinya akan mendapatkan sertifikat dan akses lifetime untuk semua video pembelajaran dengan total durasi 2 jam.
Jangan lupa siapkan beberapa hal berikut sebelum memulai pembelajaran:
- Jaringan internet yang stabil
- Laptop atau HP untuk menonton video pembelajaran


Kelas ini cocok bila kamu merupakan:

- Mahasiswa dan pelajar yang ingin mempelajari dan meningkatkan skill UX researcher

requirements: The primary prerequisite is a willingness to learn how to create outstanding user experiences!
courses.description:
Imagine being the architect of an online experience that feels intuitive, natural, and even enjoyable. That's the power of user experience (UX) writing, and it's a skill you can master with this comprehensive course. Step into the world of UX writing, where every word is strategically designed to create compelling, user-focused copy for digital products. This course takes you beyond the basics, plunging you deep into the core aspects of UX writing, complemented by practical exercises and real-world examples that will sharpen your skills.


First, we'll demystify UX writing. You'll understand its distinct nature, setting it apart from other forms of writing. Ponder this - have you ever effortlessly navigated a new app, guided by helpful hints and prompts? That's the magic of UX writing in action, a seamless blend of words that subtly direct users through a product's interface. This course will equip you with the ability to shape such satisfying digital experiences.


Moving forward, we'll embark on a fascinating journey – the exploration of the user, the core of every digital product. Ever wondered why some apps 'just get you' while others leave you lost and frustrated? That's where User Research comes in. Through a series of techniques like User Interviews, Surveys, and Usability Testing, we'll illustrate how to tune your writing to resonate with user needs and preferences. You'll even gain hands-on experience in developing effective User Personas and User Journeys, your secret weapons in creating user-centered writing.


Ever chuckled at a witty error message or sighed in relief at a clear call-to-action button? That's the power of Microcopy – the unsung hero of many successful digital products, and a skill you'll master in this course. We'll dissect and learn from examples of Button Labels, Placeholder Text, Error Messages, Success Messages, Tooltips, System Messages, Navigation Labels, and more. Each word, each phrase, no matter how small, can enhance or hinder a user's experience, and we'll show you how to ensure yours does the former.


The course then takes you through the fine art of Tone and Voice in UX Writing. Think of your favorite brand - can you recognize its 'voice'? This unique identity resonates across their product and communication, creating familiarity and trust. You'll learn how to shape this consistent voice for your product while mastering techniques to adapt your content for diverse audiences and varying contexts. You'll also explore the important theme of Accessibility in Writing, and will be equipped with the tools and knowledge to create inclusive content that resonates with all users, regardless of their abilities.


Whether you're a seasoned writer looking for a career shift, a designer wanting to enhance your skillset, or a newbie curious about the field, this course, is your key to mastering the UX Writing discipline. With it, you will not only craft words that sound good but also work wonders for your users. So, don't just stand at the edge - dive in and embark on this exciting journey towards becoming a proficient UX Writer!


Enroll now and let's get started!
target_audience: Everyone with a passion for user-centered design and exceptional digital experiences will benefit from this course.
This course is best for students who are new to UX writing.

courses.description:
Today, we're going to learn about UX/UI Design Principles.
When looking at UI Design, we can usually tell which design works better, but when you start working on your own designs, it's suddenly not that easy anymore.


What is the secret behind a smooth process and perfect distribution that seems so pleasing to us?


In under two hours, I will show you the UX/UI Design principles and what, how, and why they make a difference.


In this course, I combine theory concepts, real-life examples, and final practical exercises to make sure it's not just theory but a skill you can apply to your wireframes web and app designs right away. However, please be aware that this is an overall theory class!


This course is divided into two parts:


Part 1: Principles of User Experience Design
In the first part, we will dive into UX Design principles, this will be loosely based on the Nielsen Heuristics:
Real-world references, mental models, and how to use them
Jakob's Law - why other pages are important to your own
Consistency is key
Hick's Law - working with choice and limitation
The magic number is 4 !
Common page positioning & scanning patterns
Feedback and system status
Error prevention
Error handling
A word on dopamine & ethical design
EXERCISE(+Figma File)--> We are building a wireframe with Figma!


Part 2: Principles of User Interface Design
In the second part, we will learn about UX Design Principles. This part is mainly based on Gestalt Theory:


Aesthetic-Usability Effect – Why even bother?
What is Visual Hierarchy?
Law of Prägnanz – Simplicity is key!
Law of Similarity – use colour, size, and shape to create a design system
A little more on text- and touch target size
Law of Proximity – Spacing systems and grids
Law of Common Region – Creating sections and adding structure to your layout
Von Restorff Effect – Drawing attention where you need it
Law of Common Fate – Behavioural prediction
Visceral reaction – Emotion in your design
EXERCISE(+Figma File)--> We are transforming a wireframe to UI Design with Figma.
Part 3: A few little extras
As a little gift, here are some extras from my other courses to dive a little deeper into some of the subjects we have touched. Enjoy!


This course is for you if you're new to UX design, want to brush up on your skills.


This is a class by moonlearning.
target_audience: This course is for you if you're new to UX/UI Design or simply want to brush up on your skills.
Graphic Designers transitioning to UX or UI Design

courses.description:
Look on any job posting for any User Experience (UX) position, and you'll see "Communicate", "Collaborate" or "Present" as part of the description.
Communication is a vital part of UX, whether it's interviewing stakeholders, getting them to approve your designs, or even getting hired as a UX designer.
But design communication is a skill that is different from every day conversations: you may be the newest member of a team, trying to convince people who have worked with a tool for 20 years that it needs to be changed.
So how do you communicate as a designer?
In this course, I'll teach you the best practices for design communication, in design, research, and even interviewing. I'll go over opportunities where you will be asked to communicate, including interviews, workshops, and meetings. I will then end with how you can leverage design communication to get a job as a UX professional.
I hope you'll join me in learning how to communicate your designs.
target_audience: People familiar with UX design that want to make it a career
UX researchers, designers, or Web designers who want to communicate more effectively
Business stakeholders who are interested in finding how to incorporate design into the business process

courses.title: 2주 완성 : 초보자도 프로가 되는 피그마 컴포넌트 mvp 앱 기획+디자인 (UI 라이브러리 템플릿 제공)
courses.bio: 피그마로 UXUI 기획과 디자인을 한 번에, 2배속 성장하는 애자일 MVP 앱 제작 실무 강의
objectives: 피그마로 MVP를 기획하고 디자인할 수 있게 돼요.
단순히 똑같이 따라하기가 아닌, 왜 그렇게 해야하는지 이유를 알 수 있어요.
피그마만의 기능을 100% 활용하고, 노가다는 그만해요.
UI 라이브러리 및 컴포넌트를 이해하고 활용할 수 있게 돼요.
애자일 서비스 기획 및 디자인 전 과정의 에센스를 빠르게 파악할 수 있어요.
디자이너가 아니더라도 와이어프레임을 피그마로 그릴 수 있게 돼요.

UX 설계하기: 디자이너도 반드시 이해해야 하는 비즈니스 모델 : 린 캔버스
UX와 UI를 자신있게 설명할 수 있나요?
피그잼으로 고객 경험 설계하기 : 유저/작업 스토리, 페르소나, 유저 져니맵
준비 : 피그마 세팅: 프로젝트 환경 및 조직 셋팅 & 요금제 관리
컴포넌트 디자인: 과제 2 : 라이브러리 만들고 컬러와 폰트 세팅하기
컴포넌트 만들기 및 네이밍 : 헤더, 네비게이션 바
과제 3 : 오토 레이아웃과 인스턴스 스왑으로 헤더와 네비게이션 바 만들기
좋은 무료 소스 고르는 팁과 충돌 없이 활용하기 : 아이콘
와이어프레임: UI 디자인 시작 전 반드시 해야하는 것
UI 디자인의 기본 단위 : flow의 이해
과제 6 : 피그잼으로 벤치마킹 / 개선 / 만들어 보고 싶은 앱의 메인 플로우차트 그려보기
UI 디자인과 프로토타이핑: UI 사용성을 결정 짓는 컬러 공식
디자인만 하고 끝이 아니다! 핸드오프: 이미지 추출 및 전달, 라이브러리 운영 팁
아웃트로: 데이터 기반 고도화 팁 : 가설 vs 디자인 vs 고객 경험

requirements: 새로운 영역을 개척하고 싶은 호기심과 열정만 가져오세요. 아, 인터넷이 되는 컴퓨터도요.
courses.description:
피그마는 쉽습니다.
하지만 의외로 제대로 사용하는 사람은 많지 않아요.
피그마는 설치도 필요 없고, 인터넷만 되면 어디서든 디자인 작업을 할 수 있어요.
메뉴도 단순해서 디자이너가 아닌 사람도 금방 사용할 수 있죠.
하지만 피그마의 진정한 핵심 기능을 제대로 활용하는 사람은 많지 않아요!
피그마의 핵심 기능은 반복 작업을 쉽게 해주는 거예요.
오토 레이아웃이나 컴포넌트의 체계적인 사용 방법이 궁금하다면 잘 오셨어요!
인터넷에 조각조각 잘려져 있는 정보로는 전체 그림을 파악하는것이 어렵거든요.
이 강의에서는 피그마 컴포넌트의 완전 기초부터 실무 활용법을 단계적으로 알려드릴거에요.
초보자도 단시간에 프로처럼 사용할 수 있도록 도와드릴게요.
피그마, 제대로 사용해 봅시다!




최저 시급도 못 받던 편집 디자이너에서
독학으로 디자이너 연봉 한계선 뚫기
저는 ppt 디자인 에이전시에서 편집 디자이너로 커리어를 시작했습니다.
최저 시급도 못 받으며 디자인에 대한 열정만으로 불 태우던 신입을 지나
편집 디자이너의 연봉은 잘 받아야 최대 4,000만원이겠구나를 깨달았어요.
스스로에게 질문을 했습니다.


0.1%의 슈퍼 디자이너가 될 수 있는가? NO
상위 1%의 기업에 들어갈 수 있는가? NO


제가 가지고 있는 무기는 여러 분야에 대한 호기심과 학습이었습니다.
그렇다면 상위 10%의 스킬 여러개를 갖자.
UIUX / BX / CX / UX 라이팅 / 노코드 개발 / 콘텐츠 마케팅 / 비즈니스 전략...
무엇이든 다 해 보는 쪽으로 마인드를 바꾸니
기획과 디자인을 동시에 하는 것이 당연하게 되었습니다.
그렇게 해서 제가 얻은 타이틀은 ‘대체 불가능함’ 이었어요.


현재는 대기업에 들어가야 받을 수 있는 연봉을 받으면서
시간과 공간의 제약 없이 자유롭게 일 하고 있어요.
최종 목표는 저만의 작은 앱 개발로 솔로프리너로 독립하는 것이에요.
여러분이 만약 0.1% 슈퍼 디자이너, 1% 회사에 입사하는 것이 현실적으로 어렵다면
기획과 디자인 스킬을 한 번에 익히는 것부터 추천합니다. 아이디어와 표현은 한 몸이니까요. :)




-
이 강의를 들으면 좋은 분들
디자이너/기획자 연봉 한계선을 뛰어넘고 싶은 분
mvp 기획과 디자인 과정을 빠르게 이해하고 싶은 개발자나 스타트업 대표
나만의 작은 프로덕트를 만들어보고 싶은 분
강의를 다 듣고 나면 이렇게 됩니다
기획을 할 수 있는 디자이너 / 디자인을 할 수 있는 기획자
mvp 기획+디자인 프로세스를 이해한 스타트업 종사자
피그마 커뮤니티의 컴포넌트 소스를 자유롭게 활용하는 사람




> 포인트 1
5시간 동안 린/애자일 mvp 개발 과정을
기획부터 디자인까지 빠르게 훝어봅니다.
본 강의에서는 가상의 mvp를 제작하는 실무 과정을 따라가면서,
피그마를 왜 배워야 하는지 너머에 있는 본질적인 질문 -
왜 이 프로덕트를 만들어야 하는지 -
문제 정의 (가설 수립)와 문제 해결의 형식 (가설 검증)을 학습합니다.
UI 디자인 전 반드시 해야 하는 UX 설계 프로세스를 배우고 기획 역량을 강화해 보세요.


> 포인트 2
피그마의 정수, 오토 레이아웃과 컴포넌트를 입문부터 응용까지
단계별로 학습하여 마스터합니다.
컴포넌트 디자인하는 과정을 기초부터 응용까지 단계별 예제로 보여드립니다.
1단계는 전통적인 방식의 레이어 베이스로 디자인하기
2단계는 오토 레이아웃으로 디자인하기
3단계는 배리언트와 불린을 활용해 활용도 높이기
4단계는 컴포넌트 안에 컴포넌트를 넣는 아토믹 디자인
100% 컴포넌트 베이스로 디자인할 수 있도록 꾸려봤어요.
컴포넌트 생성과 인스턴스의 활용 원리를 이해하면
피그마 커뮤니티에서 받은 소스를 자유자재로 활용할 수 있게 됩니다!


> 포인트 3
기획과 디자인을 한 번에
할 수 있는 스킬과 마인드셋을 배웁니다.
이제 한 가지 스킬만 깊숙히 배우고 숙련하는 시대는 지났습니다.
결국 ai 시대에 생존하는 사람들은 전문 분야를 넘나들며
통합적 사고를 할 수 있는 문제 해결자들일 것입니다.
여러분이 기획자인지 디자이너인지 개발자인지는 중요하지 않습니다.
기획과 디자인 전략에 대한 마인드셋을 바꾸고
연봉 한계선을 넘을 수 있는 기회를 꾸준히 만들어보세요!

> 포인트 4
어디든 써 먹을 수 있는 ui 템플릿 제공
강의 예제로 만든 기본 ui 템플릿을 제공합니다.
저 또한 이 템플릿을 활용하여 생산성이 200% 빨라졌어요.
앱 하나를 런칭할 때 디자인에 활용하는 시간은 최대 3주입니다.



수강생 대상 고민 상담 서비스 진행
10년차 프로덕트 디자이너에게 무엇이든 물어보세요.
강의 내용 질문 / 포트폴리오 리뷰 / 커리어 플랜 / 프리랜서 / 스타트업과 에이전시 / 직장 생활 내 어려움 등등.
사전 질문지의 답변을 토대로 구글 밋업에서 1시간 동안 커피챗을 진행합니다!! (오픈 카톡이나 이메일 상담도 가능해요!!)
*강사에게 메시지 보내기 기능을 활용해주세요!
target_audience: 피그마 및 컴포넌트 활용을 배우고 싶은 예비 / 현 UI 디자이너
프로덕트 제작 전 과정을 배우고 몸 값을 높이고 싶은 디자이너
초기 프로덕트 기획과 디자인을 한 번에 하고 싶은 UX 기획자
기획력을 키우고 싶은 디자이너
MVP 제작 과정이 알고 싶은 예비 / 현 스타트업 종사자
디자인 과정과 사고를 이해하고 개발에 적용하고 싶은 개발자

courses.title: 互聯網產品設計入門知識從事UI設計、交互設計、用戶體驗、User Interface，必備思維課程
courses.bio: UI/UI設計師、交互設計師、用戶體驗設計師提高綜合能力的思維課程
objectives: 瞭解互聯網產品經理工作特點
學習互聯網商業模式
學會繪製產品的商業模式畫布
互聯網產品的形態發展歷程
掌握產品經理三大文檔的撰寫
UI/UE UI design 必備的產品思維
運營思維
互聯網思維
數據分析思維

產品設計專業課入門常識-瞭解互聯網產品和產品經理: 互聯網產品設計和產品經理人格特點
產品設計互聯網產品設計行業必備常識和技能: 互聯網產品有哪些以及互聯網產品發展歷程
互聯網商業模式概念-商業模式本質解析

requirements: 零基礎喜歡互聯網行業的人群都可以學
courses.description:
這是一門零基礎入門互聯網產品設計的課程：我們將從課程中瞭解互聯網行業產品的基本常識，瞭解互聯網產品的形態和發展過程，學習互聯網商業模式，內容包括：什麼是產品設計以及互聯網產品經理角色特點，瞭解產品經理在產品設計團隊中的關健作用， 學習產品商業畫布的繪製，學習思維導圖，瞭解其作用，掌握產品設計關健要素，需求分析方法，和競品分析方法，資料分析等，產品設計的三大文檔撰寫：商業需求文檔BRD , 市場需求文檔MRD , 產品需求文檔PRD 的編寫內容。以及補步學習到產品的運營思維。
是UI/UE 設計師必備的思維課。
target_audience: UI/UI 設計師
User Interface 設計師
初級互聯網產品經理
