courses.title: Atuação do UX Designer e os benefícios em Produtos digitais
courses.bio: Entenda a atuação e os benefícios gerados por profissionais de experiência no desenvolvimento de produtos digitais.
objectives: Se você não tem clareza sobre a forma de trabalho dos profissionais de UX e os impactos que eles geram em produtos digitais, este treinamento é para você
Saiba de uma vez por todas quem são estes profissionais, o que realmente fazem e por que eles são tão importantes no processo de desenvolvimento de produtos
* Saiba qual a responsabilidade da experiência entre os pilares de produto;
* Veja como o desequilíbrio entre os pilares podem prejudicar um projeto;
* Saiba como deve ser a atuação do profissional responsável por tornar os produtos desejáveis;
* Entenda como é o trabalho do UX Designer em processos ágeis e como é dividido o tempo dedicado para as soluções criadas;
* Entenda como um profissional de Experiência do Usuário (UX) pode validar ou invalidar hipóteses, antes da empresa gastar com desenvolvimento;
* Conheça quais são os benefícios de negócio gerados com uma boa experiência;
* Aprenda sobre os impactos positivos gerados pelos UX Designers no processo de desenvolvimento de produtos digitais;
* Conheça também algumas das frentes de atuação que estes profissionais podem atuar para ajudar todas as áreas da sua instituição

Introdução: Para quem é feito este conteúdo
Os pilares de Produtos digitais: É preciso manter o equilíbrio entre os pilares de produto
Atuação: Somos o meio e não o final
O impacto em negócio e processos: Frentes de atuação dos profissionais de experiência do usuário

requirements: Ter um computador com requisitos básicos para acessar um curso na Udemy
target_audience: Gestores, coordenadores e líderes que desejam entender melhor o que é, como funciona e os benefícios da Experiência do usuário para área de tecnologia
Profissionais que querem aprender como um UX Designer trabalha no processo de produtos digitais
Profissionais que querem saber como é a atuação do UX Designer em processos ágeis no desenvolvimento de produtos e serviços
Pessoas que tem interesse na área de Experiência do usuário e tecnologia
Pessoas que querem saber sobre o impacto da experiência do usuário em produtos e serviços de uma empresa de tecnologia
Profissionais que querem migrar para TI na área de Experiência do Usuários
Profissionais que querem montar uma equipe ou contratar profissionais de UX para projetos digitais

courses.title: The 90-Minute UX Audit + UI Redesign
courses.bio: The faster, simpler way to quickly identify critical UX issues — just by looking at the UI.
objectives: I’ll start with rough UI sketches, explaining what I’m proposing and why it solves the problem at hand.
I’ll explain every design decision I make, from IA to Navigation to Screen Real Estate, Visual Hierarchy, Contrast, Color, Fonts, Negative Space and more.
You'll learn UX principles and UI design techniques that you can apply to anything you're designing or building.
You'll see how the specific visual decisions in the UI solve equally specific UX problems.
you’ll see the relationship between what’s on the screen and the underlying quality of the experience very clearly, and you’ll be able to apply what you’ve learned to anything you design or build.
You’ll also see how seemingly minute, inconsequential changes in the UI can make a world of difference in the depth of the user’s understanding and the quality of his/her experience.

Objectives: Organize, Economize and Comm: Overview: Design Isn't Pretty — It's Problem-Solving
Part One: The UX Audit — What's Wrong (a: The Blank State: What's Here, Where Can I Go and What Can I Do?
Navigation: How Do I Get From Here to There?
Core Content: Consistency, Hierarchy & Visual Communication
Part Two: UI Redesign — Solving Visual P: Anatomy of a Redesign: The Blank State
Anatomy of a Redesign: Navigation + Core Content

requirements: None.
courses.description:
"We really need to redesign this."
As I’m sure you know, that’s code for “users are pissed off, management is pissed off and we don’t really know what the hell is wrong with this in the first place.”
So you need a fast, efficient way to figure out what’s wrong and what needs to be redesigned, because you can’t do it all with the time, budget or resources you have available.
And nobody’s gonna sign off on 3 weeks of user research or a formal UX audit.
Been there, done that, bought the t-shirt. But guess what? None of that is really a problem for you, and I’ll tell you why:
The real cause of the biggest problems users have won’t be found by researching or testing.
They’ll be found by taking a more critical look at the UI.
Why? Because 80% of what people have trouble with is almost always the result of bad UI design choices. Solve those, and the usability problems go away as well.
And I’m not talking about aesthetics or styling here — I mean the quality and effectiveness of the visual language users are presented with. You need to evaluate what they see and figure out where, how and why it’s tripping them up.
I designed this course to show you exactly how to do that.


We rarely have time to do it right.
Every week I get email from UX designers and developers, tasked with a UI redesign, who tell me two things:
They don’t have enough time to figure out what’s really wrong — so they’re making an educated guess and hoping for the best.
They’re frustrated — because this means they’re stuck “making things pretty” instead of doing things that could improve UX.
Part of the problem here is that people on my side of the fence insist that UX audits have to be this massive undertaking, spanning weeks or months.
They don’t.
In a little over 40 minutes I’ll show you a huge list of common UX problems that show up in the product’s UI. They’re easy to spot, and you will find almost all of them in just about any customer-facing portal, website or B2B application you’re asked to redesign.
And after you’ve taken this course, you’ll be able to spot them easily in your next project.
What’s more, because I’m also going to walk you through the what and why of a UI redesign, you’ll know how to fix them.


The place to start is with what people see.
Here’s what we all forget: to most people, what they see on the screen IS the system. The UI is the sum total of their understanding about how this thing works.
So what users see — and whether or not it delivers what they expect in a way they can make sense of it — determines whether or not they find something easy to use. It also determines whether they bother to use it at all.
For almost 30 years now, it's been my experience that the majority of problems users encounter — the ones that cause them to make mistakes, abandon a task, or delete the app — come from bad design choices in the UI.


What you’ll learn applies to everything you’ll ever work on.
In just 90 minutes, I’m going to show you how to spot those bad choices, explain why they’re causing problems and show you the right way to redesign them.
That’s all the time it’s going to take to give you everything you need to do the same thing — in the same amount of time — on whatever you’re working on now or in the future.
What’s more, if you’re an independent business or freelancer, the things I’ll teach you here can help you land more work.


Lessons 01-04: UX Audit – What’s Wrong (and Why)
in the first part of the course we’ll walk through every screen in the portal's core workflow one-by-one, identifying opportunities for UX and UI design improvement. Things that move the needle in terms of delivering something useful, usable and valuable to users:
Which elements prevent them from finding what they came for?
Which prevent them from making sense of what they see?
Which prevent them from acting on what they see?
Which prevent them from trying, buying or simply using it efficiently?
Our task here isn’t to make the interface look pretty — it’s to make sure everything on the screen makes sense. It’s to make sure people can actually use what we build.
So before we jump to redesigning something, we’re going to identify what problems need to be solved in the first place — and determine whether they’re worth solving at all.


Lessons 05 - 08: Redesigning for Context of Use (What to Redesign and How to Redesign It)
Next, we’ll redesign three (3) core screens from the portal’s main workflow. You’ll see exactly how we solve the issues identified in the first part of the course, and you’ll understand precisely why we made those decisions.
By the time we’re done, you’ll see the relationship between what’s on the screen and the underlying quality of the experience very clearly, and you’ll be able to apply what you’ve learned to anything you design or build.
You’ll also see how seemingly minute, inconsequential changes in the UI can make a world of difference in the depth of the user’s understanding and the quality of his/her experience.
target_audience: UX and UI designers, developers, Product Managers and anyone under pressure for quick UX improvement — without the necessary time or budget to get it done.

courses.bio: What can your brand do with Voice Technology, Alexa Skills, and Google Actions? How can you design a Voice UX/UI?
objectives: Understand the importance of voice technology to brands, users and consumers
Learn what brands are doing with voice, Alexa, and Google Assistant
Find where voice UX and UI fit into your digital strategy using practical frameworks
Learn to design useful and delightful voice applications for your brand
Learn how to get senior level buy-in for voice projects and generate ROI
Find out what use-cases your brand should choose for a voice application

Introduction to Voice: Why is Voice important for brands, and what are brands doing with Voice?
What are the challenges with Voice? (discoverability, technology, ROI)
Guest Speaker: James Fletcher of BBC
Voice Strategy: What should you consider for a Voice Strategy?
What involvement level is your product/service?
Where does Voice fit into your consumer journey?
Which data-sets can you use for Voice?
How to get buy-in or investment for a Voice project?
Guest Speaker: Greg Hedges of RAIN
Voice Design: Why is Voice UX so important?
Guest Speaker: Jesus from Vueling Airlines
The Future of Voice: What will the future look like for Voice?

requirements: Just a smile 😊
courses.description:
Voice Technology is the fastest adopted technology in history. We find it in our homes, in our cars, in our ears, on our phones, and more.
Companies and brands want to know how they can use voice technology to create value for them and their customers, but where do they start and what do they need to consider? What can we learn from the first era of voice technology to make sure we produce useful conversational experiences? How do we even go about designing for this new interface?
Two experts in the field - along with guest speakers from Nestle, Audi, BBC, and more - will offer practical guidance to help create your voice strategy and voice design on platforms such as Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant. Starting from the basics, we will jump into what the technology is and what it can do, and then gradually prepare you to take a more micro view on what needs to be done to produce a successful voice strategy which will include voice design.
Find out how to distinguish the hype from the reality, and gain confidence in working with this new technology without fear of the unknown. Join our expert team by signing up now!

courses.description:
How to Make an Amazing Design Portfolio
Introduction
You need a design portfolio to get your first job, your second job, every design job, to get freelance work, to get admitted to the design school you dream about. Your portfolio speaks for you when you are not there to speak for yourself.
People love to look at great design ideas because great design changes our world for the better. That’s why you have chosen design as a career and your portfolio shows your great ideas.
Your portfolio is the most important design project you will ever work on. Your portfolio is your lifelong design project.
This course teaches students how to create a design portfolio that can be tailored for any design job or role you are applying for. This course teaches a simple step by step method for creating design portfolio projects with impact that will impress reviewers and interviewers.
What you will learn
· I will teach you about the different types of portfolios you will need.
· I will teach you how to create a professional portfolio project.
· I will teach you what reviewers are looking for in a design portfolio
· I will teach you the three questions every design project must answer.
· I will show you how to build a library of design projects that you can easily tailor for any design role.
· I will teach you how to avoid the common mistakes many designers make in their portfolios
Portfolio Questions
In this course we will answer the common questions designers have when making a portfolio
How many projects should I show?
How do I choose which projects to show?
Can I include Group projects? Personal projects? Projects I am still working on?
How long should my portfolio be? How many pages?
Is my website the same as my portfolio?
Can I use the same portfolio for every job application?
target_audience: College students looking for design jobs and internships
Professional designers looking to advance in their career
Designers applying for admission to graduate design programs
High school students applying to design schools

courses.title: Total ProtoPie - Learn advanced prototyping without code

objectives: This course will give you a total understanding of ProtoPie and its features which will enable you to build prototypes that look at work like real apps.

Introducing ProtoPie: A quick tour of ProtoPie Studio
Importing your graphics into ProtoPie: Importing graphics using the ProtoPie plugin
Scrolling and paging: Selecting tabs to move between pages
Navigation: Building the tab bar - the setup
Custom navigation to the detail screen
Motion design: Adding an animation to the tab bar
Creating a custom detail screen transition
Creating custom transitions using Reset and the Timeline
Conditions and Variables: Managing states with variables and conditions
Using hardware features: Adding a photo taken by the in-app camera
Saving a photo as a thumbnail
Adding haptic feedback with device sensors
Introducing Formulas: Creating a feature to accept friend requests
Introducing Components: Making the tab bar reusable in other projects

requirements: No previous experience necessary
courses.description:
An update on this course, please read
Hi everyone, this course was recorded with and older version of ProtoPie so some of the interface is going to look a bit different. I've update a couple of videos to version 6 such as the interface tour and the new ProtoPie importer. The rest of the course is still relevant and you shouldn't have a problem following along with the current version of ProtoPie. I am updating this course to the new version so If you do buy this course now you will have a resource that will be updated to version 6 early next year.


About this course
Hi, my name is Darren and I'm passionate about prototyping. ProtoPie is my tool of choice when it comes to prototyping and I've been using and teaching ProtoPie to designers within many organisations including NatWest, Sainsbury's, Channel 4 and currently Microsoft.
I work closely with the team who created ProtoPie through their ProtoPioneers programme, a small group of designers and educators who get to work closely with the ProtoPie team directly, contributing ideas and testing new yet to be released features.
If you want a tool that can enable you to create advanced prototypes without the need to have advanced knowledge then ProtoPie is for you!
ProtoPie is an interaction design tool which enables you to create prototypes that you can test on iOS, Android and the Web. Honestly you wont be able to tell the difference between your prototypes and real apps!
On this course, you need no prior knowledge or any coding experience because, well there isn't any code!
ProtoPie uses a simple easy to understand concept model and is designed for designers.
I will teach you what you need to make your app ideas come to life and put them to the test with users on real devices.
You’ll start your journey with ProtoPie by building a prototype of a photo-sharing app called Pieterest.
You’ll first learn how to import graphics from your favourite design tool such as Figma, Sketch and Adobe XD.
You’ll then learn how to create motion and interaction with ProtoPie’s simple concept model and a wide range of interaction features.
You'll learn how to test on real devices and share your prototypes with others. ProtoPie can be deployed on both iOS and Android platforms, in fact, its a must if you want to use those cool hardware features such as camera, haptics and more.
I’ll show you how easy it is to create popular interactions that you can use in real projects as well as how to structure and manage large prototypes so that you can create believable experiences.
You’ll learn how to create realistic transitions and custom micro-interactions to make your prototypes feel authentic and indistinguishable from a real app.
You’ll create personalised features such as favouriting images that really work, no need for linear 'on rails' prototypes here.
One of the things that is unique to ProtoPie are hardware integrations and we’ll be using the camera on your device to add a real photo to the Pieterest app.
We’ll dip our toes into formulas, ProtoPies way of creating amazingly advanced features that won't make your head explode!
Before you know it you’ll be creating prototypes that work like real apps without the complexity and overhead of learning to code. Things that would normally take days to build you’ll be able to create within hours.
I look forward to seeing you on the course
- Darren
target_audience: Anyone who wants to learn how to prototype apps without having to learn how to code. ProtoPie is a code free tool

requirements: A basic understanding of ProtoPie and UI Design
courses.description:
Welcome to ProtoPie Components Fundamentals. Here you'll begin your journey mastering ProtoPie components!
I'm super excited to finally kick this off. There's so much cool stuff you can do with components but before we get to that you need to get a few fundamentals under your belt!
In this course, I'm going to take you through the theoretical pillars of creating components. I'm not going to assume any prior knowledge of components, even at their conceptual level.
You'll learn everything you need to know about creating components to an advanced level.
I'll show you all my secrets, tips and tricks of how to create smart components that talk to each other and that are easy to configure.
This course isn't just about passive learning though. It's chock full of assignments and quizzes designed to make sure that what you learn stays in your head. I've applied several advanced higher-order thinking techniques to help cement the knowledge so you can walk away with confidence and the skill to create any component you can think of.
While this course doesn't assume any prior component knowledge, you'll get the best out of it if you have completed my previous two courses. To become a true component Ninja you'll need to understand ProtoPie Formulas so I would suggest you do that course first before this one. If you're completely new to ProtoPie start with my Total ProtoPie course which teaches you the absolute basics as well as a sneak peek into Formulas and Components.
If you want to create an interactive design system that you can use together with your Figma system this is the course for you.
target_audience: This course is for anyone who want to increase their Product Design skill level to advanced and be able to create realistic product designs

courses.description:
1. 본 강의는 chatGPT가 처음 출시된지 얼마 안 된 2023년 2월 기준으로 촬영된 강의임을 알려드립니다. 따라서 생성형 AI가 무엇인지 어떻게 활용을 할 수 있을지 처음 입문 하시는 분들께 추천드립니다.


2. 더 심도 깊은 내용(실무에서의 활용, 인공지능 윤리, 기획/리서치/프로토타입 생성 등 다양한 작업에서의 활용법)에 대해 궁금하신 분들은 'UXUI 디자이너가 생성형 AI를 활용해 포트폴리오를 쌓는 법 A to Z' 강의를 추천드립니다.


3. 만약, 이미 이 강의를 구매하신 분들 중 'UXUI 디자이너가 생성형 AI를 활용해 포트폴리오를 쌓는 법 A to Z' 강의를 들어보고 싶으신 분들이 있다면 메시지 부탁드립니다! 첫번째 강의를 구매하신 분들에 한하여 두번째 강의에 적용하실 수 있는 쿠폰을 발송해드리겠습니다.


4. 강의자료는 5강에서 다운로드 받으실 수 있습니다.




요즘 시대에 꼭 필요한, AI활용 역량을 갖춘 UI/UX 디자이너, 그게 여러분이 되실 수 있습니다!


이제까지는 ‘컴퓨터 활용 능력’ 자격증이 필수였다면, 이제 세상은 ‘AI 활용 능력’ 이 있는 사람들을 필요로 할 것입니다. 앞으로 3년에서 5년 안에 AI가 본격적으로 상용화되었을 때, 어떤 디자이너가 살아남을 수 있을까요? 지금부터 AI 활용 방법을 고민하는 디자이너 아닐까요?


현재, 취업준비생이신가요? 그럼 AI와의 협업 프로젝트를 통해 차별화된 포트폴리오를 만들어보세요!
이미 회사에서 UI/UX디자이너로 일을 하고 계신가요? 그럼 Generative AI를 활용하여 UI/UX 디자인 업무 생산성을 높여보세요!
target_audience: 요즘 시대에 꼭 필요한, AI활용 역량을 갖춘 UI/UX 디자이너가 되고 싶으신 분

ユーザビリティテストの概要: ユーザビリティテストの概要

【参考】その他のテスト映像: 被験者1 タスク後インタビュー
被験者2 タスク後インタビュー

requirements: PDFをダウンロードして印刷していただくことを想定しています。PDFを印刷できる環境が必要です。
courses.description:
UXやユーザビリティ、人間中心設計などに興味を持っている方でも、ユーザビリティテストを見る機会はなかなかないと思います。 本コースは、そんな方にユーザビリティテストのビデオ映像をご覧いただくという趣旨のものです。
被験者2名×1タスク分の映像を、タスク後のインタビューの様子も含めてご覧いただき、そこからどんな気づきが得られるかを解説つきで振り返ります。
また、解説はつきませんが、参考資料として同じ被験者2名×3タスクおよびインタビューの映像を公開しますので、ご自由に観察していただけます。
本コースを受講することにより、UX、ユーザビリティ、人間中心設計といった考え方がなぜ重要なのかを体験的に感じ取ることができ、本格的な概念や手法を学ぶきっかけとしていただけるはずです。
なお、本コースは概念や手法を詳細に解説するものではありません。UXデザインの基礎全般を学びたい場合は「UXデザイン講座 UXデザイン基礎入門」、ユーザビリティ評価について詳しく学びたい場合は「UXデザイン講座 ユーザビリティ評価入門」をご用意してありますので、そちらの受講をお勧めいたします。


【2021.07.20】
コースの内容を見直し、全面的にリニューアルしました。
本コース以外にUXデザインやユーザビリティ評価について詳しく解説したコースを作成したので、本コースはよりコンパクトなものとしました。
かねてからご意見をいただいていた音声については、以前よりはかなり聞き取りやすくなったのではないかと思います。
target_audience: ユーザーのニーズに合致した製品・アプリ・Webサービスなどを提供したいと思っている開発者、デザイナー、ディレクター
よりユーザビリティの高い製品・アプリ・Webサービスなどを目指している開発者、デザイナー、ディレクター
UX、ユーザビリティ、人間中心設計などに興味があるものの、まだ具体的な勉強を始めていない方
UXデザイン、ユーザビリティ、人間中心設計の活動として、すでにユーザーを観察した経験がある方は、本コースを受講しても得るものは少ないと思います

courses.description:
Curso de UX/UI + Figma 2025 – Aprende diseño de experiencia de usuario desde cero y transforma tu carrera
¿Quieres aprender a diseñar productos digitales útiles, funcionales y atractivos desde cero? Este es el curso más completo de UX/UI Design con Figma en español y está pensado para llevarte desde principiante absoluto hasta nivel profesional, guiándote paso a paso en cada etapa del proceso de diseño.
Más de 33.000 estudiantes ya lo eligieron, es uno de los cursos más vendidos de Udemy en lo que respecta a UX/UI en Latino América, y forma parte de Udemy for Business, lo que garantiza su calidad y profundidad.
Pero espera...
¿Eres desarrollador?
En caso de que sí, tenemos un curso ideal para ti, enfocado 100% en desarrolladores.
Visita nuestro sitio web de espacio UX y accede al curso especializado de UX/UI para desarrolladores.
Este curso que estás viendo está pensado para personas que quieren convertirse en diseñadores UX/UI profesionales y trabajar en productos digitales de principio a fin.


¿Qué vas a lograr con este curso?
Comprender todo el proceso de diseño centrado en el usuario: desde la investigación y definición del problema, hasta el diseño visual y pruebas de usabilidad.
Aprender a usar Figma desde cero, la herramienta más utilizada por equipos de producto y diseño.
Realizar un proyecto completo de diseño UX/UI para tu portafolio profesional.
Dominar técnicas y procesos reales que usan los diseñadores en la industria.
Obtener un certificado verificable al finalizar y mejorar tu perfil laboral.


¿Por qué elegir este curso?
Porque no es solo teoría. Acá aprendés haciendo.
Trabajarás con ejemplos reales, desafíos prácticos y vas a crear un proyecto propio para sumar a tu portafolio.
Porque no necesitás conocimientos previos ni venir de diseño. Está pensado para principiantes, autodidactas, creativos, comunicadores, marketers, psicólogos, sociólogos o cualquier persona interesada en diseñar mejores productos digitales.
Porque constantemente estamos trabajando y mejorándolo. A día de hoy seguimos haciéndolo en 2025.


¿Qué incluye el curso?
v Acceso inmediato y de por vida
- Más de 23 horas de contenido en video
- Certificado de finalización
- Curso introductorio a Figma incluido
- Comunidad online para compartir proyectos y hacer preguntas
- Actualizaciones permanentes
- Garantía de reembolso por 30 días


No esperes más. Este es el momento perfecto para aprender una de las habilidades más demandadas del mundo digital.
Comenzá hoy tu camino como diseñador UX/UI y creá experiencias que realmente marquen la diferencia.
¡Inscríbete ahora y da el primer paso!
target_audience: Este curso es ideal y está dirigido para programadores, diseñadores, emprendedores, comunicadores, sociólogos, psicólogos, analistas y todas las personas con ganas de aprender sobre el proceso de creación de productos y servicios desde cero.

requirements: Temel Figma kullanım bilgisine sahip olmak
courses.description:
Herkese Merhaba;
Figma İleri Düzey Prototype ve Animasyon Eğitimi'ne hoş geldiniz.

Figma prototipleme ile tasarımınızı canlandırın. Bu derinlemesine incelemede, temel prototipler oluşturma, Figma'da (Smart Animate) akıllı animasyon, yeniden kullanılabilir etkileşimli bileşenler, Variables (değişkenler) kullanarak çarpıcı etkileşimler, ifadeler ve koşullu ifadeler ile nasıl paylaşılacağı ve belgeleneceği hakkında her şeyi öğreneceğiz .
Temel bilgilerle başlayacağız ve ekranlarımızı nasıl bağlayacağımızı, farklı kaydırma davranışlarını nasıl ekleyeceğimizi ve tasarımımızın ön izlemesini nasıl yapacağımızı ve ayrıca prototiplerinizi sunmaya yönelik bazı ipuçları ve püf noktalarını öğreneceğiz.
Figma bölümlerinin yardımıyla farklı tetikleyicileri, animasyon türlerini ve durum bilgisi olan bir tasarımın nasıl oluşturulacağını keşfedeceğiz .
Figma'da sihirli parça prototiplemesini akıllı bir şekilde canlandırmaya geçeceğiz . Size tüm akıllı animasyonların süper güçlerini göstereceğim ve ayrıca bunların sınırlamaları hakkında konuşacağız ve bazı sorun giderme işlemleri yapacağız.
Daha sonra Figma'da etkileşimli bileşenlerle mikro etkileşimlerin nasıl kurulacağını öğreneceğiz . Bu, tasarımınızdaki örneklere standart davranış ekleme konusunda size çok zaman kazandıracaktır. Ve bu aynı zamanda Figma'nın gerçekten etkileyici potansiyelini, yani otomatik düzeni, akıllı animasyonu ve etkileşimli bileşenleri birleştirirken açığa çıkardığı yerdir .
Son olarak, devir için prototiplerinizi belgelemek ve paylaşmak için size ipuçları ve teknikler göstereceğim.
Eğitim sırasında benimle birlikte takip edebilmenizi veya uygun bir zamanda detaylı talimatlarla egzersizlere dönebilmenizi sağlayacak bir Figma dosyasını sizinle paylaşacağım.
Temel Figma bilgisine sahipseniz veya ileri düzeyde Figma kullanıcısıysanız ve prototip oluşturma becerilerinizi geliştirmek istiyorsanız bu kurs tam size göre.
Öğrendiğiniz yöntemlerle tasarımlarınıza göz alıcı etkileşimler katarak bunları sosyal medya hesaplarınızda ya da portfolyonuzda paylaşabilir ve sektörde bir adım öne geçebilirsiniz.

Kurs boyunca ve sonrasında soru cevap ya da mesaj kısmından size destek olmaya devam edeceğim. Kurs ile ilgili bir isteğiniz olduğunda lütfen bildirin.

Bu kursu tamamladığınızda;
Figma'da prototip konusuna tamamen hakim olacak
Tasarımlarınıza dikkat çekici efektler katabilecek
Geçiş animasyonları oluşturabilecek
Prototiplerinizi gelişmiş Figma özellikleri ile birlikte kullanabilecek
Prototiplerinizi sunum için paylaşabilecek ve daha bir çok yetkinlik edineceksiniz.
İlk deste görüşmek üzere :)
target_audience: Figma Prototype alanında detaylı bilgi sahibi olmak ve kendini geliştirmek isteyen mevcut Figma kullanıcıları
UI/UX Designerlar
Figma Tasarım ve Prototiplerini sunumlaştırmak isteyen tasarımcılar
Temel Figma bilgisine sahipseniz veya ileri düzeyde Figma kullanıcısıysanız ve prototip oluşturma becerilerinizi geliştirmek istiyorsanız bu kurs tam size göre.

courses.title: Basics to Advanced UI/UX Design Course in Hindi
courses.bio: Master Figma, wireframes, and mobile app design with 115+ video lessons and hands-on projects.
objectives: Learn the roles of UX and UI designers and how they collaborate to create effective digital products.
Design wireframes, user flows, and high-fidelity mockups using Figma and industry-standard tools.
Conduct user research, usability testing, and apply design thinking to improve user experiences.
Build a complete case study from research to final UI design to showcase in your professional portfolio.
Define the roles and responsibilities of a UI/UX designer in modern product teams.
Estimate project timelines and scope for UI/UX design tasks using real-world workflow examples.
requirements: There are no prerequisites for this course. It is designed for complete beginners with no prior experience in design or tech. All you need is a computer or laptop with internet access. We’ll be using Figma, a free and widely-used UI/UX design tool, and you’ll get step-by-step guidance on how to set it up. Most importantly, bring a willingness to learn, explore new ideas, and practice through hands-on design projects.
courses.description:
Welcome to the Complete Beginner + Advanced UI/UX Mobile App Design Course! This course is your ultimate guide to mastering the art of designing stunning, user-friendly mobile apps. Whether you’re a complete beginner or looking to level up your skills, this course has everything you need.


From Beginner to Pro – All in One Place
Here's what YOU GET INSIDE inside the course


Step 1: Figma Basics Unlocked
Dive into Figma’s essential tools, from shapes and the pen tool to typography and color fills. Strengthen your skills with hands-on challenges and practical exercises.


Step 2: Master UX design fundamentals
Learn the essentials of user research, wireframing, prototyping, and usability testing to design user-friendly experiences.


Step 3: Wireframe Design
Learn to create wireframes for splash screens, login pages, and dashboards. Design real-world user flows for signup, payment, and split bill processes.


Step 4: UI Design Basics & Design Systems
Master the fundamentals of UI design, including color theory, typography, and auto layout. Build reusable components and design systems for consistent, professional interfaces.


Step 5: Mobile App UI Design
Design stunning mobile app interfaces, from logos and onboarding screens to home pages and payment flows. Explore user-centered designs, including dark mode and seamless navigation.


Step 6: Prototyping and Final Testing
Bring everything together by applying UX laws, creating mood boards, and finalizing designs. Complete real-world projects to build a portfolio-ready showcase of your skills.
target_audience: This course is for anyone who wants to start a career in UI/UX design. It’s ideal for beginners, students, freelancers, and professionals switching to design. If you’re curious about how apps and websites are designed and want to learn Figma through hands-on projects, this course is a great starting point. No prior experience needed.

courses.title: Sketch von A bis Z: Werde App-Designer
courses.bio: Endlich eine umfassende Anleitung von Sketch zum Entwerfen von mobilen Anwendungen. App Design, UI und UX in Sketch 5.
objectives: Designe das User Interface einer App
Benutze die Best Practices des UI Designs
Benutze Tools um die besten Resultate in Sketch zu erzielen
Liefere ein fertiges Design, damit die Entwickler es umsetzen können.
requirements: Du solltest dir das Programm Sketch kaufen oder die kostenlose Testversion verwenden.
courses.description:
Sketch hat die Welt des mobilen Anwendungsdesigns revolutioniert, indem es Dir die Tools zur Verfügung stellt, mit denen Du dich innerhalb weniger Stunden in einen professionellen App-Designer verwandeln kannst. In diesem Kurs lernst Du, wie Du mit Sketch 5 dynamische, entwicklungsfähige UI für mobile Apps entwirfst, die Kunden beeindrucken und Nutzer ansprechen.
Lerne mit den leistungsstarken Tools und dem reibungslosen Workflow von Sketch eine schöne, qualitativ hochwertige Benutzeroberfläche für mobile Anwendungen zu entwickeln.
Beherrsche die wesentlichen Prinzipien und Werkzeuge von Sketch.

Entdecke Designtechniken, die Dein kreatives Potenzial steigern.
Lerne und implementiere UI Best Practices, um Qualität und Benutzerfreundlichkeit sicherzustellen.
Reise vom Konzept bis zur Fertigstellung, indem Sie eine mobile Beispielanwendung erstellen.
Finde heraus, warum Google, Apple und Facebook Designer Sketch verwenden.
Viele der am schnellsten wachsenden Unternehmen im Silicon Valley setzen auf Sketch, wenn sie UIs für mobile Anwendungen entwickeln, weil sie schnell und intuitiv sind und atemberaubende Endprodukte produzieren.
Eine Besonderheit von Sketch sind die booleschen Vektoroperationen, mit denen Du komplexe Formen und Ebenenstile erstellen kannst. In diesem Kurs lernst Du die Grundlagen der Booleschen Operationen sowie viele andere in Sketch verfügbare fortgeschrittene Designtechniken kennen.
Inhalt und Überblick
Egal, ob Du ein Anfänger oder ein erfahrener Designer mit Erfahrung in Photoshop und Illustrator bist, Du wirst diesen Kurs so wertvoll finden, dass er Schritt-für-Schritt-Anleitungen mit praktischen, anpassbaren Übungen kombiniert:
Mobiles App-Design von A bis Z: Mit über 5 Stunden Inhalt deckt dieser Kurs alles von Layern, Shapes und Styling über Textbearbeitung bis hin zum Export von fertigen Projekten ab.
Die besten Tools: Du lernst die besten Tools für professionelles App Design zu benutzen und es Entwicklern so einfach wie möglich zu machen, deine App zu programmieren.
Interaktives Design-Projekt: Zusammen mit dem Lehrer erstellst Du eine Beispiel-Benutzeroberfläche für eine Fitness-Mobility-App.
Nach Abschluss dieses Kurses wirst Du verstehen, wie Du mithilfe von Sketch eine qualitativ hochwertige Benutzeroberfläche für mobile Anwendungen entwirfst und auf die Anforderungen deiner Kunden und Entwickler besser vorbereitet bist.
target_audience: Dieser Kurs ist perfekt für Web- oder Printdesigner
Dieser Kurs eignet sich für Photoshop oder Illustrator Benutzer
Dieser Kurs benötigt keine Design-Erfahrung
In diesem Kurs lernt du nicht, eine komplette App zu entwickeln

courses.title: Product Validation 101: A Mix Method Approach
courses.bio: The Ultimate Guide to Validating Your Product Ideas with a Mix Method Approach

Sending out the Test: Send out the Test to the users

requirements: At least a year in the Product design field
courses.description:
In this course, "Product Validation 101: A Mix Method Approach," you'll learn how to use a mix of research methods to validate your product ideas and maximize their chances of success.
You'll discover how to build a customer community, conduct Google sprints, build product landing pages, and do remote testing and surveys to gather valuable feedback and insights about your target market and product concept. You'll also learn how to do in-person interviews with users to get a deeper understanding of their needs, wants, and behaviors.
Through a combination of lectures and case studies, you'll learn how to effectively use these research methods to validate your product ideas and make informed decisions about your product's viability.
By the end of this course, you'll have gained a proper insight into the overall skills and knowledge you need to validate your product ideas like a pro, increasing the chances of your product's success in the market.
This course is ideal for entrepreneurs, product managers, and anyone interested in learning how to validate their product ideas using a mix method approach. some prior knowledge or experience is required as the course might be touching upon certain concepts and terminologies that beginners might not be familiar with.
target_audience: Mid Level Product designers
Mid Level Ux Researchers

requirements: 「ユーザーに喜ばれる良いプロダクトを作りたい！」という強い思いさえあれば、他の事前知識は必要ありません。
courses.description:
「なぜユーザーは使ってくれないのか？」「どうしたらユーザーに喜んでもらえるのか？」こうした悩みはプロダクト開発や事業開発を行っている方なら誰しもが考えたことはあるはず。ユーザーに価値を理解してもらってこそのプロダクトやビジネスなのにも関わらず、そもそも「ユーザーを理解する」とはどういうことなのか、統一した理解がない、どこまでユーザーについて知れば「理解した」と言えるのか？その全体像とその解像度は人によってまちまちにされているのが現状です。ユーザーに使い続けてもらうプロダクトであるためには、ユーザーに対する適切な角度での理解なしには実現しえません。本講座ではその要諦を具体例を使って解説していきます。アメリカで広く読まれていて、かつ未翻訳のビジネス洋書を題材に使いますので、まだ日本に広まっていないビジネス感覚や視野を、ライバルに先駆けてアップグレードしていきましょう！

＜この講座でカバーすること＞
UXの基本的概念
ユーザーを深く理解するための考え方と、それを可能にするユーザーリサーチ手法
集まった定性情報からインサイトを導き出す方法


＜この講座でカバーしないこと＞
デザイン思考

プロトタイプの作り方
target_audience: せっかく作ったプロダクトが使われない、ユーザーがなかなか定着しないと悩んでいて、ユーザー体験のどこに問題があるか理解したい方
アイデアはあるが、どのようにユーザー体験を作り込めばユーザーに受け入れられるかわからない方
なぜ他社のプロダクトが自社よりも優れているか、ユーザー体験の観点から理解したい方

requirements: You should have some knowledge and experience with the design of a website, app, software, or other product that you want to do user testing on.
courses.description:
Are you launching a new website, software or app? Or maybe you have an existing product that is underperforming. Whether your target audience is complaining about your product, or just aren’t using it, user testing can help you get answers and solutions. Or maybe you have competing designs that the team can’t agree on, or you want to analyze your competitors. User testing helps you do all this and more. Even if you think you’ve designed it “just right”, you can’t afford to create a website, software product or app that hasn’t been tested by your actual audience. Don’t guess! Test! This course will teach you how to do quick, cost-effective user testing on early prototypes through to finished products.
Some examples of what's in the course:
How user testing differs from focus groups, quality assurance testing, and demos
The different types of user tests and when to use which
How to do quick and effective user tests
Different tools for user testing
How to decide what to test
How to decide who to test
How to recruit participants
How to set up and conduct a user test
When and how to do unmoderated and/or remote testing
How to analyze, interpret, and report on your test results
Quizzes throughout the course to test your knowledge
Exercises throughout the course to practice what you are learning
and much, much more
Get started right away. You don't want to delay learning how to create user tests. You want to improve your products right away.
Over 50,000 students have taken our online video courses.
target_audience: Designers, product managers, usability staff, user experience staff

courses.description:
다음은 구글 수석 UX 디자이너가 직접 꼽은, 이 시대 디자이너들에게 필요한 3가지 필수 역량입니다.


learnability 학습 능력
adaptability 적응력
Resilience 회복탄력성


혹시, 공통점을 찾으셨나요?
위의 세 가지는 모두 ‘급변하는 사회에서 살아남기 위한 역량’입니다.


매일매일 새로운 기술이 쏟아지는 세상에서 지식을 빠르게 습득하고, 어떤 상황이든 잘 적응하며, 변화에 유연하게 잘 대처하는 그런 디자이너가 필요하다는 말이에요.


그렇다고 회사에 가서 “저는 학습 능력과 적응력, 회복 탄력성이 강점입니다.”라고 외치기만 한다면, 하품하고 있는 면접관을 보게 될지도 몰라요.


우리가 이런 사람이라는 걸 어필할 수 있는 가장 좋은 방법은, 3가지 역량을 적용한 실제 프로젝트를 보여주는 것입니다. 그리고 그 프로젝트와 함께 이렇게 말한다면 어떨까요?


“저는 4차 산업 혁명의 핵심 기술인 생성형 AI 기술을 발 빠르게 습득하여, 직접 UI/UX 작업에 활용해보았습니다. 근미래에 생성형 AI가 상용화되었을 때, 빠르게 실무에 적응하여 대처할 수 있는 것은 물론, 새로운 기술을 놓치지않고 트래킹하며 항상 변화에 대비하고 있습니다.”


AI활용 포트폴리오를 통해 말로만 어떤 사람인지 이야기하는 ‘그냥 UI/UX디자이너’가 아닌, 진짜로 ‘AI를 활용할 수 있는 디자이너’임을 보여줌으로써 여러분의 학습 능력과 적응력, 회복 탄력성을 어필해보세요!

courses.title: UX Fundamentals: Practical Usability for Product Design
courses.bio: Avoid common mistakes in product design by learning usability principles and analysing tens of real-life examples.
objectives: What usability means in digital interfaces
Why understanding your users is crucial for your interface's success
The basic aspects of usable navigation, search, form or animation
The basics of cognitive psychology
Why it's important to avoid errors and overloading your users
How to check if what you designed is usable

Introduction: What is usability and why does it matter?
Understanding usability: Simplicity and focus of the interface

requirements: Only willingness to design digital products!
courses.description:
As a designer, no matter whether you’re working on UX or UI, you should always aim to design for the highest possible usability. It is something that all of your clients or team members will expect from every interface you design. A usable interface is easy to use, intuitive and does not require the users to think too much when using them. Knowledge of basic ergonomics and cognitive psychology is something that every designer should master and this course will help you start that journey, through learning:
What usability means in digital interfaces
The basics of cognitive psychology
Why understanding your users is crucial for your interface’s success
Why it’s important to avoid errors and overloading your users
The basic aspects of usable navigation, search, form or animation
How to check if what you designed is usable
Principles of usability
Learn what are the core components and principles of usability, through reviewing numerous real-life examples I prepared for you. Understanding these rules of thumb devised by the pioneers of the industry will help you analyse interfaces and look for aspects that could be refined to achieve a better usability. It will be a great starting point for learning about all aspects of usability.
The building blocks of interfaces
There are certain ground rules of usability in digital interface design and it’s important to understand what makes in interface simple and focused, as well as how to make basic decisions to avoid distressing your users. We will cover best practice in usability for common elements such as navigation, search, microcopy, forms or errors.
Validating the usability of your solutions
Creating an interface that seems usable to yourself is relatively easy. Problems often appear when other people try to understand it or when you “let it soak” for a couple of days and review it from the perspective of usability. Over a couple of lessons we will also explore how to validate interfaces for usability with the use of expert reviews, usability testing and analytics.
target_audience: UX Designers
UI Designers
Front-end developers
Product managers
Project managers
Startup founders, who want to build usable products

courses.description:
Are you ready to take your first step toward an amazing career in UX design? Look no further than Real-World UX Design Training! Our school is the perfect place to get practical, hands-on training in this exciting field.
We truly believe that UX design is the key to creating products and services that people will love, and we are passionate about helping our students develop the skills, knowledge, and experience they need to succeed in this industry.
Our comprehensive curriculum covers all the essential aspects of UX design, and you’ll finish our program with a top-notch portfolio that showcases your abilities and experience, ready to take on any UX design challenge that comes your way.
At Real-World UX Design Training, we’re all about creating a supportive and inclusive learning environment. We embrace diversity and welcome students from all backgrounds and experiences. We know that everyone brings something unique to the table, and we can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to our school.
So why wait? Come join our Real-World UX Design Training family and start your journey toward an awesome career in UX design! We’re excited to help you achieve your goals and launch your dream career. Thank you for considering us for your UX design education!

I really appreciate each of you taking my class, and as a token of gratitude, I’d love to share my books New Career in UX Design and Real UX: Practical Guide with you in PDF format for free. In these books, I share practical strategies, examples from real projects, and actionable tips to help you tackle UX problems effectively and confidently.

courses.title: UX: Introducción al diseño de Experiencia de Usuario
courses.bio: Construya una base poderosa de conocimientos de Experiencia de Usuario para convertirse en diseñador de UX.
objectives: Conocerás los conceptos fundamentales del diseño UX, sus funciones y objetivos.
Descubrirás métodos de evaluación y puesta en común de información para encontrar un cliente objetivo.
Analizarás páginas web en forma de proyecto de práctica para poner a prueba tus conocimientos.
Emprenderás tu propio camino como diseñador UX con las capacidades de hacer que una app, web o sistema tenga una experiencia satisfactoria para el usuario.

Interacciones del usuario: Estructura y separación de la Información

requirements: Una computadora
Es requisito contar con conexión wifi
courses.description:
¡Hola! ¿Cómo estás? Soy Sebastián Burgio, diseñador gráfico.
Hace muchos años que me dedico a trabajar en sitios webs y aplicaciones como diseñador de Experiencia de Usuario. Esto es lo que hace que todo cliente que entra a la página de una marca, se sienta atraído y llegue a realizar una acción.
Con el diseño UX cualquier empresa va a lograr multiplicar la conversión que produce su producto/servicio digital, ya que los informes generados por el diseñador van a incluir errores con soluciones posibles que incrementarán la productividad.
En este curso desde cero de diseño de Experiencia de Usuario para principiantes, tendrás acceso a múltiples clases que te ayudarán a dominar el tema para conseguir que los usuarios queden atónitos con la armonía del producto.
Empezaremos el curso aprendiendo los conceptos de UX desde lo más básico. Aprenderás a reconocer varias funciones y necesidades que el cliente debe encontrar en el servicio.
Poco después, descubrirás cómo encontrar un cliente objetivo, al que llamaremos "UX Persona". Con él, podremos definir datos que ayudarán a apuntar la web hacia un norte determinado.
Siguiendo, construiremos una sólida base de conocimiento sobre métodos de investigación para tener bien en claro cómo actuará nuestro cliente objetivo. Con esto realizado, pondrás en práctica los procedimientos vistos en clase.
En la próxima parte, entenderás qué es la interacción UX y por qué es fundamental a la hora de diseñar la experiencia de usuario en un sitio web. Conocerás qué fundamentos deben estar aplicados en el producto digital para que los usuarios lo compren en pocos segundos.
Finalizaremos el curso con un proyecto final. Les propondré un proyecto en el cual pondremos en práctica todo lo que hemos descubierto durante el curso, realizando el diseño UX para una página a elección. Pondrás a prueba tus conocimientos adquiridos durante las clases en un proyecto real. Tendrás que aplicar todos los conceptos vistos para lograr la mejor experiencia de usuario posible.
Este curso está dirigido a todas aquellas personas que quieran aprender a diseñar increíbles experiencias de usuario desde cero, destinado a aplicaciones y sitios web. ¡Nos vemos en clases!
target_audience: Todo aquel que quiera aprender fundamentos de UX para lograr poderosas experiencias de usuario.

requirements: Важны ежедневные короткие тренировки
courses.description:
Двенадцать дней десятиминутных тренировок для формирования дизайн мышления. Так же как в спорте, красивое здоровое тело формируется благодаря регулярным тренировкам.
Что мы слышим от наших заказчиков? "Почему здесь стоит именно эта ссылка? Как выбрать надпись на ключевой кнопке? Что должно быть на странице, чтобы клиент захотел купить?"
Это самые простые из множества вопросов, которые задаем мы себе при проектировании продуктов. Ответы на них лежат не в чек-листах по юзабилити и даже не на сайтах лучших игроков рынка. Любое решение в нашем продукте - это ответ на потребности и барьеры нашего покупателя. Для быстрого поиска лучших и обоснованных решений нам важно регулярно тренировать наш мозг на клиентоориентированность.


Курс состоит из трех блоков:
1. Проектирование через потребности клиентов
2. Проектирование через боли и страхи клиентов
3. Проектирование через эмоциональные состояния
В каждом из блоков мы будем тренироваться проектировать с учетом различных контекстных ситуаций и с особенностями разных персонажей наших продуктов.


Курс состоит из 12-ти десятиминутных роликов для ежедневных тренировок. Каждый ролик в себе содержит:
1. Пример из оффлайн среды (это наилучший способ переноса аналогий и тренировки ассоциативного мышления)
2. Пример из онлайна (легкие примеры из знакомых приложений для углубления понимания)
3. Задания для самостоятельной тренировки из онлайна и оффлайна.
Задача дня - это прослушать 10 минут разъясняющего нового материала и еще 5-10 минут посвятить самостоятельной тренировке.


Мы все стремимся создавать лучшие Customer Journey Map и наполнять их наилучшими решениями для наших клиентов. Первый этап моей программы - это тренировки по поиску потребностей, барьеров и соответствующих решений. Следующим этапом будет подготовлена программа по созданию Customer Journey Map, где мы сможем применить текущие знания. Но уже сегодня, начав тренировки по текущему курсу, ты услышишь ключевые вопросы, которые начнешь задавать себе при проектировании в рабочем процессе: "Почему именно эта ссылка и именно в этом месте?" И сможешь найти обоснованный ответ: "Потому что у моего клиента есть потребность X"


Эти же навыки важны и для проектирования Customer Experience. Это значит, что если у вас есть оффлайн бизнес, то вы легко применяете все тренировки и в своих оффлайн процессах.
target_audience: UX/CX дизайнеры, как начинающие, так и все, кто любит тренировать мышцы мозга
Маркетологи, которым важно научиться понимать потребности клиентов

courses.title: The User Researcher's guide to UX discoveries
courses.bio: Learn how to conduct your own discovery, find users and all the user research techniques you'll need to get going.
objectives: Understand what the agile delivery discovery phase is
Learn how your role as the UX researcher fits into discovery
Sell the benefits of conducting a discovery to your organisation
Explore a variety of channels to recruit research participants
Discover the different research methods open to you
Use the supplied templates to create compelling research findings
Confidently communicate your research findings back to stakeholders

Exploring the discovery phase: Who is involved in a discovery

requirements: A very basic understanding of User Experience (UX) to understand some of the concepts outlined
We'll talk about the discovery phase in agile delivery but you don't need to be an expert on agile
To access the templates, you'll need a tool capable of opening Microsoft Office documents
courses.description:
The discovery phase is the starting point for any agile User Experience (UX) project. More and more organisations are adopting agile project management when designing products and services and UX research is vital in supporting this.
But what does this mean for the User Researcher? In this class we'll explore what the discovery phase looks like, including:


What discovery really means
The reasons to conduct a discovery
What the discovery team looks like
Where to recruit users
The common research methods
...and how to bring it all together and present back to the team
At the end of the class, you'll be able to confidently guide your organisation or client through their first discovery.


Some questions you might have:
01 - Do I need to be a user experience expert to take this course?
Definitely not. You will need a basic understanding of user research, but I try to provide a simple guide to all the things that make up a discovery and the tasks you'll likely perform. Think of it as a tour of the flow of a discovery phase, with real-world ideas for getting it done and examples from my own experiences. I'll give you a list of avenues for recruiting users, a checklist of research techniques you can perform and a set of downloadable templates to get you going. My aim is to give you a blueprint for your own discovery phase.


02 - I'm not a user researcher so is this relevant to me?
Absolutely! Service design is rarely a 1-person event. This is for anyone wanting to understand what a UX discovery is. If you're a Product Owner, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Content Designer, UX Designer, Developer or similar, then you'll likely work on a discovery at some point. Anyone looking to build or redesign products and services will get something from this course. I've put this course together from the User Researchers point of view as that's the hat I wear but, ultimately, the same processes and end goals apply to all the team on a discovery.


03 - Why have I never heard of a discovery phase?
In the private sector, a discovery phase can be seen as a waste of time and money and are often avoided. I 100% believe this is a mistake and is exactly why I created this course. All UK government projects follow the government digital service standard. As part of that standard, teams are expected to follow the agile delivery approach. That starts with a discovery phase, before usually moving onto other phases such as Alpha, Beta and Live. That's where my experience comes from - I've conducted many discoveries across many different types of product and services, in both the public and private sector, and I want to show you how this intense period of research will almost certainly save time and money in the future and produce a happier end user!


04 - These are the templates I include:
Discovery / research plan
Sample interview framework
Interview write-up guide
Findings log with sample session write-up
Persona template
Service blueprint
Journey map
Empathy map
Research debt report
A research findings playback slide deck
You don't have to use these templates. If you're already researching and producing outputs then you'll likely have your own. I've included them to give you a feel for how I document the research when conducting discoveries myself. If you've not created some of these before then feel free to use them in your own research.
I hope that sounds exciting. I love discoveries and cannot wait to show you how fun and rewarding they are!
target_audience: User experience (UX) professionals wanting to understand the part UX research plays in the agile delivery model
User researchers looking to understand the importance of the discovery phase in UX research
Business Analysts looking to understand the role UX research plays in the discovery phase
Anyone looking to understand the part user research plays in designing products and services

courses.title: Fast-start Usability Testing and UX Research – Begin Today!

objectives: Capture actionable and measurable data

Save your team money by getting feedback from users fast

Introduction: About the instructor and this course
Usability testing vs UX research - what's the difference?
The Quiz on UX vs Usability
How to get hired: How to demonstrate experience when you don't have a UX research job
Before your first usability test: The benefits of usability testing and UX research
Is it hard? NO! You can do this
Recruiting testers - the most commonly asked question
Exercise: Who are your target users?
Preparing for your first usability test: Choose a question you want answered
The Quiz on Your First Usability Test
Exercise: What questions do you want answered?
Getting scientific: Top mistakes - or how to mess up a usability test if you really want to
Advanced methods: Remote usability testing - yes, do this!
Testing with prototypes and non-functional products
Gaining insights with card sorting and tree testing
Exercise: do a mock remote usability session

requirements: Anyone can learn this today and run usability tests tomorrow.
All product development team members will feel welcome and comfortable (developers, managers, designers, business analysts, project managers and general enthusiasts)
courses.description:
Your product won't be easy to use on accident. The only way to deliver products and services that delight users is to listen to them. If you want to learn how to do that, then this is the course for you.
Don't take chances when you deliver new products to market! Learn and use professional usability testing and UX research methods. Your team will make informed decisions when they know what end-users actually think. It's so easy, you can learn usability testing today and see results tomorrow.
Learn the basics of usability testing and UX research fast
Recruit the best users to participate in your studies
Uncover the real issues your users experience when they use your products
Use professional UX research methods that produce trustworthy results
Complete 5 exercises to help you master the fundamental usability testing techniques
Your users want you to build amazing products. That will tell you the features they need. They can show you if what you create is easy to use. They want to help you by giving you useful feedback. You need to know how to ask for the information. It’s called usability testing, which is a specific aspect of UX research.
I learned usability testing the hard way over years of trial and error in the field. I want to pass that hard-won knowledge to you. This course will save you time and boost your confidence. It will help you deliver the information your team needs. Don’t recruit the wrong users for your tests. Don’t bias your research with the wrong questions. Get amazing results when you do your UX research correct.
How do you know what kinds of users will give you the best feedback? Learn how to find the best usersfor your usability tests during the first 20 minutes of the course.
How do you convince users to give you accurate, actionable information? You will learn successful UX research methods within the first hour. Your usability test sessions will produce an abundance of data.
How can you and your team feel confident that the results you're getting are reliable? I'll show you the professional UX research methods that will build trust on your team.
How can you speed up the process of gaining feedback? How do you lower the cost of doing your user experience research? I'll explain my advanced techniques.
Sign up now! You get:
Lifetime access to video content
Five hands-on usability testing exercises
Downloadable UX resources to get you started today
target_audience: Do you want to learn what your end-users think of your products?
Would you like to collect actionable data on your product's usability?
Does your leadership team want reports showing the usability of your products?
Does your development team want fast feedback?
Stop struggling to find the right users
Write questions free of bias

courses.description:
Станьте востребованным UX/UI дизайнером и создавайте интерфейсы, которые любят пользователи
Этот курс — ваш путь от новичка до уверенного специалиста, способного создавать продукты, которые решают реальные задачи пользователей и приносят бизнес-результаты.
Что вас ждёт:
UX-исследования и проектирование Научитесь понимать пользователей на глубинном уровне. Освоите создание персон, customer journey maps и проведение UX-исследований. Узнаете, как превращать инсайты в работающие решения через каркасы и прототипы, которые повышают конверсию и удовлетворённость пользователей.
UI-дизайн и визуальная коммуникация Овладеете искусством создания интерфейсов, где эстетика встречается с функциональностью. Изучите психологию цвета, типографику, композицию и адаптивный дизайн для разных устройств. Ваши интерфейсы будут не просто красивыми — они будут работать.
Реальные навыки для карьеры Получите знания о работе в командах и на фрилансе: от коммуникации с разработчиками до поиска клиентов и ведения проектов. Научитесь презентовать свои решения и защищать дизайн-концепции.
Практика, практика и ещё раз практика Каждая тема закрепляется практическими заданиями: от мудбордов до полноценных интерактивных прототипов. К концу курса у вас будет портфолио с реальными кейсами.
Для кого этот курс:
Начинающих дизайнеров, которые хотят системных знаний
Самоучек, готовых структурировать свои навыки
Специалистов из смежных областей, планирующих переход в UX/UI
Независимо от стартовой точки, вы получите инструменты и уверенность для создания дизайна, который меняет опыт взаимодействия пользователей с продуктами.

requirements: No, you don’t need any technical knowledge beyond a general understanding of digital products like website, apps and software.
courses.description:
This course will teach you a faster way to design and test your software, web, app, and any digital product ideas. Within 5 days, you will have a prototype that has been validated by your users or target market. Based on the design sprint, it strips away all the fluff and fancy work that traditional method preaches to give you only the absolute necessary steps. This course is for you:


If you have an idea for a software, app, website or any digital product and are stuck on what to do next.
If you’re a first-time or seasoned entrepreneur who wants a quicker and better way to test the marketability and usability of your idea.
If you’re a product manager, assistant or product owner who is struggling with a long design and development time.
If you’re a product designer, UX or UI professional who wants to upskill and learn how to rapidly design and test prototypes.


My name is Alvin Hermanto and I run an award-winning digital design agency in Melbourne, Australia.
We use this method with established Australian brands in ecommerce, education, and technology. We've brought their software, website, and mobile app to market in less than half the time it usually takes.
As part of the Design Sprint, this Google Ventures approach is used by brands like Apple, IBM, Nike, P&G and Lego. After this course, you will have a solid user-validated prototype that’s prime for development and then market launch.
Ultimately, you will learn that rapid incremental progress will beat a long quest for perfection when it comes to building a product that customers will love.
target_audience: Anyone who is stuck on an idea to build a website, app, software and other digital products.
Product managers & product owners who need to simplify the product design process.
Entrepreneurs who want to quickly create a proven prototype from a simple idea.
Product designers, UX/UI professionals keen to learn about how to rapidly design and test a prototype.

objectives: Comprendere i principi fondamentali dell'intelligenza artificiale e dei modelli di linguaggio naturale, con un focus su ChatGPT

requirements: Familiarità con i concetti fondamentali del design dell'esperienza utente, come usabilità, ricerca utente, wireframing e prototipazione
Curiosità e interesse per l'intelligenza artificiale e il machine learning, anche senza conoscenze tecniche approfondite
courses.description:
Questo corso offre una panoramica completa su come l'intelligenza artificiale, in particolare ChatGPT, può trasformare il modo in cui progetti e implementi esperienze utente (UX) efficaci. Durante il corso, esplorerai le potenzialità di ChatGPT per migliorare l'interazione con gli utenti, rendendo le interfacce più intuitive e reattive.
Contenuti del Corso:
Introduzione a ChatGPT e AI:
Comprendi le basi dell'intelligenza artificiale e dei modelli di linguaggio naturale.
Scopri le capacità di ChatGPT e le sue applicazioni nel design UX.
Principi di UX Design:
Approfondisci i concetti fondamentali del design UX, inclusi usabilità, accessibilità e user-centered design.
Scopri come ChatGPT può essere integrato per migliorare questi principi.
Integrazione di ChatGPT nei Progetti UX:
Esamina casi di studio reali e best practice su come ChatGPT può essere utilizzato per migliorare l'interazione utente.
Impara a utilizzare strumenti e tecniche per incorporare ChatGPT nelle interfacce utente esistenti.
Prototipazione e Testing con ChatGPT:
Utilizza ChatGPT per creare prototipi rapidi e testare soluzioni UX.
Esplora metodologie di testing per valutare l'efficacia delle interazioni utente.
Ottimizzazione e Iterazione:
Analizza i dati e il feedback degli utenti per iterare e migliorare continuamente le esperienze utente.
Apprendi tecniche di ottimizzazione dell'UX basate sull'intelligenza artificiale.
Etica e Privacy:
Esamina le considerazioni etiche e le sfide relative alla privacy nell'utilizzo di ChatGPT nel design UX.
Scopri strategie per garantire un utilizzo responsabile e trasparente dell'IA.
Obiettivi del Corso:
Alla fine del corso, avrai acquisito una solida comprensione di come utilizzare ChatGPT per migliorare il design UX, rendendo le interazioni utente più coinvolgenti, personalizzate ed efficienti. Sarai in grado di integrare l'IA nei tuoi progetti, dalla prototipazione al testing e all'ottimizzazione, garantendo al contempo il rispetto delle normative etiche e sulla privacy.
Questo corso è ideale per designer UX, sviluppatori, product manager e chiunque sia interessato a esplorare l'innovazione nel campo del design UX attraverso l'uso dell'intelligenza artificiale. Unisciti a noi per scoprire come ChatGPT può trasformare le esperienze utente e portare i tuoi progetti al livello successivo.
target_audience: Designer UX/UI: Professionisti del design che vogliono approfondire l'integrazione dell'IA nei loro progetti per migliorare l'esperienza utente
Sviluppatori Web e App: Programmatori interessati a comprendere come l'IA può essere utilizzata per creare interfacce utente più interattive e personalizzate
Product Manager: Responsabili di prodotto che desiderano esplorare nuovi modi per migliorare l'interazione degli utenti con i loro prodotti tramite l'uso dell'IA
Ricercatori UX: Esperti in ricerca utente che vogliono utilizzare ChatGPT per analizzare e interpretare meglio i dati dei test utente
Studenti di Design e Informatica: Studenti universitari o di corsi professionali che desiderano acquisire competenze avanzate nel campo dell'UX design e dell'intelligenza artificiale
Imprenditori e Startup: Fondatori e team di startup che vogliono innovare le loro soluzioni digitali integrando l'IA per offrire un valore aggiunto agli utenti
Professionisti del Marketing Digitale: Esperti di marketing interessati a capire come l'IA può migliorare l'engagement degli utenti e personalizzare le esperienze di marketing

courses.description:
Learn the structure, tools and processes to create a UX Portfolio that helps you win jobs and stand out from other designers.
Enter The Ultimate UX Portfolio Course
This course teaches you how to build a robust UX portfolio from scratch. If you're in the UX job market, you know that having a solid portfolio is essential. No portfolio, no job - simple as that.
There’s a lot of confusion about what content should go into a UX portfolio, and how to build one without losing your mind. If you’ve burned hours searching for the perfect Wordpress theme or tried to fit your story within a Squarespace template, then this course will fast track you to a better portfolio in less time.
Most of the course is focused around writing and crafting UX case studies (individual UX design projects), with the option to package it all into one UX portfolio if applicable. Then we deep dive into several Advanced UX Portfolio topics.
Here are just some of the topics covered in the course:
Core Topics
The Content-First Strategy
The Portfolio Pyramid,  a 3 step process to structure UX portfolio
The Case Study Structure
Design Artifacts - selection and presentation
How to Build an Offline and Online portfolio simultaneously
Advanced Topics:
Handling NDAs and sensitive information in your portfolio
User Testing Your Portfolio
Portfolio Interview Questions
Who is this course for?
Because this course is structured to help you build a UX portfolio from the ground up, it’s especially beneficial for new UX designers creating their portfolio for the first time.
For anyone who wants to redo or update their portfolio with a systematic process, the knowledge outlined in this course is still highly relevant.
The course focuses on building your portfolio, meaning you should have at least 1 case study or project to which you can apply this knowledge.
What You Can Expect
Students from varying levels and backgrounds can benefit from The Ultimate UX Portfolio Course. Here's a sample of the estimated time requirements in which students can expect to complete portfolio work:
Building portfolio from scratch: 3-4 weeks
Students with existing portfolios: 2-3 weeks
Motivated students with aggressive deadlines: 1-2 weeks
This is a comprehensive course that requires dedication and time. It comes with templates to help write your content so you'll be able to build your portfolio alongside the course. By the end of the course, you'll have developed a solid portfolio that can be used to apply for UX Design jobs.
If you feel like one of the thousands of designers who've been missing guidance on this precious portfolio building process, then this course was built with you in mind.
target_audience: Any UX Designer or Product Designer who wants to create a portfolio that is easy to update and has a clear structure

Beginning UX Designers who have at least 1 project to create a portfolio around. This is a highly hands on course that involves writing and packaging case studies and portfolios. Thus it's not ideal for absolute beginners who haven't completed at least 1 UX project.
Students looking to update their design portfolio with best practices tailored for the UX Job market.

Designers looking for jobs in User Experience or Product Design. The UX portfolio is a non-negotiable piece of the hiring process, and prospective students can learn how to best present their portfolio to increase their odds of getting a UX job.
